-OKHU0rcJOAyq1CEOC461Q.text: Do not let the outside of this place deter you! Inside it is beautifully coordinated in blue and white. It's very unique and relaxing.  The food is very good. Generous portions, fresh bread!! Their soup is addictive. The gyros huge!  Unfortunately this place to too far from me and we do not get there often enough.  I have not tried the dinner menu yet. I can't wait!

nXC-oX8ClXoMkYnRBbSdcg.text: This place is absolutely great. Me and my girlfriend have become regulars here because we love it. The place is never crowded or noisy so it's a great place to just enjoy each other's company. We aren't very adventurous, so I've only had the Gyro plate, but it's delicious. I usually get it with their lemon chicken soup which is great. The lemon flavor may be too strong for some, but it's perfect for me. I get French fries as my side on the plate, which are decent. The portion sizes are large so you shouldn't leave hungry!

RVDYU7gr24LWMdwBalHwRQ.text: Very good place. Had a quick lunch. Easy to get to. Staff was friendly. Good was fresh hot and delicious. Affordable price. Can eat quick but not feel like fast food. Quality of food is great. Comes out fast but doesn't feel rushed.

kVE7pgEjIaro7iNGcPFvfQ.text: Great place! I had spanikopita, fat Greek salad an a side of hummus-yummy! Waiter was very nice!

fadSu8e9IPZnHP8wRyXJCw.text: I'm fairly new to Greek food, and don't venture too far away from the gyros, but i was with my ex so she showed me the ropes.  I've been coming here before the expansion just for the gyros alone and they never ever disappoint.  Make it a combo with either pilaf rice or french fries and a drink for like 2-3bucks more.    Just across the street is The Greek American Grille, but their fries and rice does not even compare to The Fat Greek. Not to mention TFG is more of a restaurant while GAG is more of fast food type.  I let my ex do all the ordering because I'm a man.. of my words lol  Chicken soulvaki.  Chicken skewers with a tzatziki sauce on side with a bed of pilaf rice.  Spanakopita spinach:  Nice flaky pastry filled spinach and a hint of butter or even cream. Definet Yes!  Babagounash:  Holy mother 'effer.  This eggplant dip was amazing and severed with warm pita bread.    Greek burger:  Never in my life and of all place would I thought the burger here be this good.  It was my ex's meal and yet i ate most of it.  A little too much bread for my liking, but the light thin cheese sauce, tirokafteri, was out of this world. Chopped red onions, lettuce, tomato, and a side of slice dill pickle to top if off. Winner!  Every time I dine here or pick up I received friendly service.  The place is always clean because the white and blue really stood out.  The week before I came here with a friend and had the Combination Plate For Two which is a variation of dish to try: (description from their website because i'd still no clue which is which) Moussaka - Casserole of Roasted Eggplants, Potatoes, and Ground Beef Baked with Greek Bechamel Sauce and Kefalotiri Cheese. Good stuff Pasticcio - Traditional Greek Baked Pasta with Rich Meat Sauce and Greek Bechamel with Kefalotiri Cheese. Like a lasagna with a layer of cheese. Gyro - Shaved lambs. Perfect as usual. Dolmades - Grape Leaves Stuffed with Seasoned Ground Beef and Herbs.  Ehhh something about eating the grape leaves.  It's not bad, but i can do without. Also come with roasted potatoes, pita breads, and soup or salad.  For 30bucks you can try different items, but if i had a chance to pick again i would have picked something else.  Its good, but right now carbs are my enemies.  Love this place!

RGdnh_9YwzpSS0URKsVaww.text: I tried their Gyro just couple of weeks ago...I had finished everything on my plate including the fries and had even ordered their huge slice of baklava....that baklava was soooo good!!!!!

Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro

aqa7avFHKvfQmUER7_7GAQ.text: It's a good try at greek with some Mediterranean favorites sprinkled in too. Saganaki is some of the best I've had. Hummus and melitzanosalata were above average. Worth a stop to check out

N0slIb-zLccBovNmLZEjFw.text: Decided to drop in here with my mom while she was in town and really enjoyed our meal. We went for lunch and ordered a couple of gyros. I had the Chicken Shawerma and it was awesome! I have never been the biggest fan of Greek food, but it has grown on me recently. This place helped! One of the best gyros I have had and pretty fair priced for the size at $7.50. You must order the baklava! Get it as fresh as possible if you can, not sure what times they make it but I believe they only make certain number in the morning and then more later in the day. We were lucky enough to get it very fresh and it was fantastic. I have since stopped in and ordered two pieces to go and they seemed not as fresh and a bit tougher, but still tasted great. It's pricey at about $5 for a small 4x4 (maybe) square, but considering all the time and effort that goes in to making baklava its worth splurging on here and there. Only downfall for me is that they have separate menus for lunch and dinner. The gyros are only available on the lunch menu which I miss because I get out of work at 6pm. Maybe one day they will change that!

OTOFBTYh4MUuqFKsFX86bw.text: Wow. My  best friend and partner-in-dining out, Ana, raved about eating here, and I thought to finally go out with her and give this place a try; I didn't expect much, but I did trust my friends' assessment--I am definitely glad I did! The restaurant is tucked away in an urban shopping center, without any special banner or advertisement. I almost didn't find it, driving past it. The interior is very average Greek-restaurant--light blue and white--colors of the Greek flag are decorated inside. I will say that the place was extremely clean and meticulous, which I appreciated. The food pleasantly surprised me. My Greek salad was very flavorful. Pita bread was average. Babaghanoush was as good as it gets. Chicken shawarma was slightly above average--but very fresh. Deserts were too die for--great prices, too! I had Napolean--huge portion for only $3. Incredible.   I have some food allergies, and both, the waiter and the chef came out to discuss which foods had certain allergies etc. Very much appreciated!  Service was good, although it did take a little bit to get the check. Overall, very well above average experience. I will be back. No, I plan to come back within the next two months and I'll update my review then.   Thank you, Ana, for introducing me to this authentic gem.

lQuE1duLoHz__dNT4pL9kA.text: Satisfied wholeheartedly my craving for Greek food!

3StYEOKCq2HbM4HwNpkumg.text: CLOSED SUNDAY! I've been burned twice now by Yelp with wrong hours, oddly enough, both at Greek places on Sunday. Lesson learned-call first...  I love the bright, cheerful blue and white interior and the beautiful, genuinely friendly waitresses here. Of course, the food is truly stellar.   Excellent eggplant salad and chicken soup.  Thanks, Blair B., for the tip!  Cheers~

nnwD8zYX7HeKlK7pdVeJDg.text: Looking for something different we ended up at the Fat Greek restaurant and I'm really glad we did.  They offer many  authentic Greek and other Mediterranean dishes and drinks,  the service is very good and hospitable, they really make you feel like home, we really enjoyed our meal and the atmosphere here. Nothing says more Greek like blue and white colors, and this is what  you find here and at any Greek restaurant, blue and white and that's my description of the decor. Prices are reasonable and the food was excellent and authentic.. I know what you're thinking. how can a Mexican know anything about the authenticity of Greek food? Well if Zorba the Greek was actually a Mexican actor playing an authentic Greek character on the big screen, then I can pretty much play a Greek food connoisseur and tell you that the food I'm eating is authentic Greek food. Besides after a good moussaka a couple of mythos beers and a shot of raki  I even speak Greek ..... Opa! Opa!       ( means I need a cab.)

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TfgAX2csRpXDd2th2eyxsQ.text: A solid 4 stars and maybe a little more. The staff, definitely imported, need to work on their friendliness a little bit. They did their jobs well but seemed a bit on the stiff side and need to liven up just a bit for this environment. Wifey had a big salad with chicken that she liked. It was a Greek salad with calamata olives, feta and a few other traditional ingredients. I had the traditional gyro, no lettuce!, and it was very good. The fries with melted feta on them are outstanding! We'll definitely be going back when we're in the neighborhood.

a-x4Pe1fIJPcy4RC9AVwjQ.text: I used to go to another Greek place right across the street but since they shut down I started to go here.  It's a good thing I discovered them because their food has great flavor and the price isn't too high.  Their gyros are fresh and they don't skimp on the food.  I normally get the chicken salad and it is tasty!

Ao7AQlZtKqU3uJpYfLnmYw.text: This is my favorite spot to eat. Been coming here for months now. Food still GREAT! But service now is very slow & poor. Takes along time to order a drink & get a menu. They hired new help because I'm sure the owner realized they got busy but the new help is very slow.

CRWGUr-KNenv-B4L49p-Ow.text: Delicious hummus - they just need to include more pita bread with the appetizer hummus.  I got takeout, but the atmosphere looked cute.  The young guy working at the front counter was very friendly, and the service was quick.  Definitely recommend this as nice casual place off the strip.

-n-x2jDsM-7zPwp6W-SX8w.text: Perfect. I got the fat Greek chicken gyro. I could eat it every day. The feta and tzatziki were amazing!  The fries were really great too. I wanted to go again the next day. The staff is great and friendly. Lots of actual Greek folks in here eating and chatting. My friend got the lamb souvlaki but wished he had asked for medium rare instead of medium. Some of the outer pieces were too done. The Greek salad was tasty, loved sopping up that olive oil dressing with the toasty warm pitas.  I want The Fat Greek to come to Phoenix!!

38pMEHALslKXx_nvpekreA.text: Came here to get some soup because I was sick. Their chicken lemon soup is to die for. The bread and zatziki sauce is a great starter for your meal.

vPOqrIgkiYxrryjMbFG3Wg.text: The food here is so good... the best falafel I've had in Las Vegas (not too dense and not dry at all), and I highly recommend the tirokefteri (tangy and salty, yum) although really, I've tried lots of things off this menu and the worst thing I have to say is I've had spanokopitas I've liked more, but this one is good too. Anyway, prepare yourself for cheap prices, extra-large portions (aka leftovers), satisfying and tasty food, and great service.

5Wp8pUnk6hfwr5s0gQNf8A.text: I love the Fat Greek on Decatur.  The lamb chops are amazing as is the lemon rice soup.  This place is my comfort food go to.  The prices are very reasonable and Gina the owner is very nice.  The Chef prepares my lamb chops perfectly each and every time I order them.  No wonder that this is the place where the World Series of Poker players come to eat on their breaks.  The food is delicious and authentic.  Each order is prepared as it is ordered so that it is very fresh.  I will only go to The Fat Greek on Decatur for my Greek cravings.  I've tried the rest and The Fat Greek is the best.

PlGKXerQsVE8QlTGH6wfHw.text: My husband and I ordered the Gyro platter!! Absolutely delicious!! We are from the east coast and wanted to try the restaurant based on the reviews. -Z0NZ98GHQCMtjuFHRansQ.text: I love Greek food, were in Greece many times and today I went to try out this place! Absolutely loved the food. hWKij_lxdJRiUvY86OT0Lw.text: This might be my new favorite place. I've been craving a big salad all day. On a whim we ordered from this place for pick up.  First the people who work there couldn't be nicer. We went in and there was a mix up on our order, not a problem they fixed it and we're super apologetic about it.  My hubby ordered the beef shawerma combo. Its was perfect. Soft fluffy pita, tender beef. Fresh, fresh, fresh! Fries super crispy. I had the Fat Greek Salad. It was big. It was good....I WANT another...lol  I added chicken to it for an additonal charge of 3 bucks. I would happily pay that all day. The chicken is seasoned amazingly and charbroiled. I've never had a salad that didn't need some kind of dressing. This one does not. Between the red onions, feta and that chicken this salad packs a flavorful punch. I can't believe we waited so long to try this place. Will definitely be repeat customers.

Faak0DR5MTuUr0jtAdUEMg.text: Hmm never I would thought that I can find really good Greek food in Las Vegas, but this place really it's a nice surprise, instead of inject ourselves a steady stream of empty calories at all the same buffet line, thus place is inexpensive, fresh and tasty  Gyro was really fresh and right amount of seasoning like a well rehearsed band, every element of the ingredient had its purpose and brings all of the taste together... Party in your mouth...   The side salad with feta cheese... The feta is so good, smooth with just the right amount of sharp and saltyness, it's creamy yet light... With really fresh olive oil and vinegar, never thought I would enjoy side salad add much as I would enjoy the main dish  Falafel was really really fresh, you can taste all the peas grinded into it and not crushed.  It is formed into a perfect serving size and fried just right, accompanied with greens and overall again the perfect balance  Definitely would come back and visit every time I'm in Vegas  The only reason I have it a for instead of five is due to wait time, servers are knowledgeable, friendly and attentive.  The kitchen had lost my ticket, and my server explained what had happened and offered that kitchen is putting my orders in priority

VOLzJLEhcBnDfHVR6V-5Mg.text: Love this place! It's very close to my work and I eat here often. The food is always so fresh and tasty. Favorites include: greek salad, avgolemeno, suvlaki, shrimp skewer meal, lamb chops, and the pork chop. I highly recommend it!

fqTl4tR_7P5dzw-yJdQJ1A.text: The seafood pasta was fantastic!  My spouse had the gyro plate and he ate every bite!!!  So awesome!

GJkwEcYSzuyPgBWBWazOyg.text: I work super close to this restaurant and love Greek food! I have ordered to go and eaten inside several times. However I always have the WORST service EVERTIME I go! There's this older lady there that usually helps me and she is not friendly and very rude! She argues with me about the stupidest things every time! For instance, I ordered a Greek gyro salad and a side of baba Ganoush . Baba Ganoush  is an appetizer so it comes with pita bread. They also give pita bread for the salad every time I order it. When I went to pick up my order I pointed out that I was short on pita bread. They only gave me 1 that was cut in 4's. She spent 10 minutes arguing with me until finally the cook came over and gave me the extra pita bread I was supposed to get in the first place!  Also- last week my co workers and I called and placed an order for pick up. We usually pay separately with our cards so we have to order each of our orders separately. They told us 1 time before that they cant put it on more than one card (which sounds like BS to me) but whatever we just order each separately. But we were so frustrated because we sent one of our co workers to pick up the food and when she arrived, there was a line out the door of people waiting to pick up their to go order. She spent about 45 mins in line and when she got to the front they told her the credit card machine has been broken all day and we had to pay with cash only! It was super frustrating because they didn't warn us on the phone. So our co-worker had to take her personal debit card into the grocery store next door and pull out enough cash to pay for everyone's order. After she did that, they handed her the order rudely and they didn't even apologize. When she brought the food back to the office it was super cold! We all had to then go and get cash to pay her back. It would have been nice for them to warn us! Like I said, the customer service sucks every time we go here! We have decided to stop ordering here because of all these problems!

0I1Bb49LDr1IrrThyDn5Xg.text: I went based off of other reviews. Unfortunately they were out of the moussaka and babaganoush, but he recommended the gyro sandwich and I chose the lamb and it was really tender and good. I had takeout, but the atmosphere of the restaurant was ok.

VX3icyoPe6KoOqNEc1O5gQ.text: We've added a new favorite in Las Vegas!!!  We love Mediterranean food and Greek especially.  The kabobs were delicious as was everything else we order.  My leftovers of the Tabbouli Salad has stayed fresh even on it's third day.  We had wonderful service and Gina is such a delight.  The Falafal Plate comes with a side of a cucumber salad so be prepared and don't order too much (we did but we don't mind leftovers).  My bowl of Lentil soup was perfect and I can begin to say how much we loved the Tzatziki and the grilled vegetables on the side of the kabobs.  We will definitely be back!!!

rxHUrg36EqEdtQ7oas78kA.text: This place is grest. Found it by accident.   Tucked away between an Indian restaurant and a supermarket.  Bright and clean.   The food was great starting with fresh baked bread.  The house dressing on the salad was perfect, light and simple with a wonderful flavor.  We ordered an appetizer of ba aganooush.(sp?) I'm used it it being a little more chunky, but the taste was right on.  We also split a gyro dinner.  Glad we did the split because it was Lumber Jack sized. The meat was moist with lots of toasty  burnt edges.  This place will be on our regular stops every time we come to town.

tgGugJ32naL4G2lXMYpdzw.text: This place was pretty great. It's a small joint with uncomfortable fluorescent lighting with cafeteria style seating but the staff are kind and urgent. The food is out of this world! I was afraid I might get some tiny Greek imposter plate but I was impressed and will be returning.

Rk6fkN8s_w_jG52Pvd3u9Q.text: The food, service, and ambiance is absolutely amazing! The food is always so fresh and delicious. Servers are pleasant and attentive. Food comes out quickly. I LOVE it here. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

TckrcjjKnf11g-Ij2d7n-w.text: If you want decent food but to be treated like trash, come to this place! I have tried to give these people chances multiple times because they are close to my office, but they can't get it together. Because the service is exceptionally slow during lunch my coworkers and I usually order for pick up. Apparently they can't handle that.  Here's a rundown of the many things they have done to earn this review: 1. They flipped out because we asked for two separate checks for a phone order and refused to accept split payments. I had to pay for a coworker's meal as a result. 2. They have messed up phone orders more than once; forgetting gyro meat on a gyro salad and a side order with a plate. They were not willing to refund the meals in either case, nor did they apologize. They actually argued that a mistake was made in the first place. 3. They have left me on hold and eventually hung up altogether when I've tried to place phone orders. Additionally the staff has poor attitudes and always seem unhappy to be there. As I said before, the food is fine (assuming your order is right) but they are clueless about running a business.

i0kWvnesv5vtZM_hpd0W3A.text: Delicious! Loved everything from the Greek wine, my souvlaki and my husband had a delicious pork chop.  Great food, great service!! Yum!!

3YODcJAF6mpQ5yXdTL6OPA.text: I love this place. Consistently delicious food at great prices. Personalized service makes me come back over and over. The restaurant is impeccably clean and if you go... Do not leave without a desert... Seriously some of the most delicious bakery items ever... In fact... Im eating my Baklava now... Amazing!!!

rROXLbPp83DJO8YDghKrmg.text: Excellent food, excellent service, cheerful atmosphere, and great prices. They offer a number of traditional Greek dishes that are rarely found in Greek restaurants in the US. Everything is fresh, well prepared, and nicely presented. I had the meat-stuffed grape leaves in lemon sauce. Delicious! And obviously freshly prepared, not frozen. It came with a large, crisp, fresh salad. (One has a choice of soup or salad with all the entrees.) My companion had the "village salad", which is a traditional Greek salad as they are served in Greece, (meaning without lettuce) with grilled chicken on the side. It was huge, fresh, well seasoned, & dressed with real olive oil. The meal came with a nice basket of warm crusty bread and sliced pita pockets, with a generous slab of fresh butter on the side. We both had their Armenian coffee, which is excellent. Sugar and milk not required! (But it comes with both, should you want them.) We had walnut cookies for desert, crisp and buttery. The service is excellent, friendly and attentive. When I forgot my jacket, the waiter found me in the supermarket next door to return it! All this, and a soda was only $33! The only thing missing from the menu would be an authentic Greek frappe, but this is a minor detail. The decor is cheery and bright, and everything is very clean. This restaurant is well worth the short drive off the Vegas strip. Highly recommended, especially for anyone who is homesick for authentic Greek cooking!!!

BZojx_yflapFUmkyxPdXfA.text: I'm an out of towner visiting Las Vegas for business, and decided to try the Fat Greek for a change. Located off Flamingo near the strip the Fat Greek is close enough to sneak away for lunch. Everything was amazingly flavorful and fresh. I will be back on my next trip to Sin City.

-_cC0hyMjAN7kkL91bF6qg.text: My friends couldn't decide what to eat, so I eliminated choices and we ended up here at the Fat Greek because the Greek food makes the tummy happy and not overall full.  The restaurant is rather clean as well as the bathrooms which some of the others on these reviews had mentioned.  Why this is four stars, and it's because I didn't get to try all their yummy food!  I hope to come back to Vegas and try the rest of the items on the menu.  So many unique items I have never even heard of:  Tirokefteri (I don't even remember what this was but I know it was really good and spicy) Saganaki (Salty kinda crispy cheese)? Tzatziki (yogurt with cucumber with infused olive oil) --common at most Greek Restaurants (this was a little different from other Greek Restaurants I've been to, but it was so refreshing) Babaganoush (eggplant) -- common at most Greek Restaurants  Avgolemono-Lemon, rice, chicken soup-- I am a soup fan, so I loved this soup, however, I wished it was a little more lemony to add extra zest.  Fat Greek Gyro with Chicken/Lamb-- Chicken was on the dry side but still delicious.  I don't believe in ever restaurant being perfect, but we came at a not busy time and there was only one waiter, and he did an okay job checking up on us.    Take Home Message: If you want a break from the strip, come to Fat Greek to have some happy tummy food for lunch.

OGML5OIi65_xV3Iml6dvNA.text: Well the reviews are not wrong its a very long wait time WHY?It first took 10 minutes to order my drink I only got water and the wait staff are rude and mean I had to beg her to even get me  water then I had to wait another 10 minutes to order no kidding. I was really hungry so I just dealt with it So when I order my food I told her no sauce im allergic to It I made sure she heard me.Another ten minutes go by still no food I only got one gyro and another 15 minutes goes by nothing the waitress did not even check up on me.I notice the cooks where working real slow in the kitchen a lot of people  wore waiting for food too I asked to speak to the manager he actually blame me he said I should know its busy and the food will come when its comes.I was very upset then the food did arrived the manger said see there is your food what are you complaining about.So when I look at it they put the sauce on it really after waiting all this time I could not eat it I tried to get the waitress but she refuse to come to the table.I had to get up to the front and that is where the manger was,he said what is your problem now.I was in disbelieve I told him I was allergic to the sauce he said I was lying well i only had water and ate no food so i walk out As you know part of running a business is not only about the food it is having a good staff and cooks that do their job well because if you know you get that busy and there other reviews about the wait time being to long you would try to fix that problem not make it worse

7ZzqBrAse1X1KXS_My5wBg.text: New in town. Tried on a whim. $10 for gyros and a Greek salad (and a drink) Very tasty. Cute little place in a strip mall. All blue and white. I will be back.

USzWXH8KFChxmAxqv-j9pA.text: My CO workers & I love their Greek salads & fried calamari, we constantly order them for lunch. Fair prices and great customer service.

VINmvp6ADe7eqBwtJxM9RA.text: If you love Greek food and want to know what it was like when the 1st man walked on the moon and bounced around without gravity, then I suggest you head to The Fat Greek.  Truthfully, I went there because it was the closest Greek restaurant to where I was staying with good reviews.  As others have said, it is super clean, and the service is great.  But, the food?  It is hands down, the best Greek food I've ever had.  I ordered humus and flat bread, the fried cheese - not sure what they call it because I'm not Green and cannot pronounce most of the menu items.  And I also had a Gyro plate with Greek Salad.  Eating each course, bite by bite, I felt as though the room filled with helium and I was floating off to somewhere over the Mediterranean Sea.  side note, I have tattoos all over my neck and head so I sometimes get treated like a criminal or at the very least skeptically.  But, the staff was polite and very on the ball.  When I was about to take my last sip of soda, the waitress appeared with a pitcher and refilled my glass.  She thought I ordered alot of food and would have left overs buy I did not.  I would have kept eating until I popped.

Ww_aU6WBCFgxY4s6P_K2_A.text: Te place was simple and cute and tey had a glass case that held baklava and other yummy looking pastries.  We tried the falafel plate which came with a salad and hummus drizzle around the falafel which you can dip the pita bread it came with into.  We also ordered the chciken soup which was very lemony and fresh tasting for a chicken soup w rice.  Overall i will be back.   I want to try their dolmas and seafood dishes.

olvYYu-wdfiUs94HFH-kcg.text: This place was packed with a wait at lunch time - definitely a great sign! Service was friendly and prices were decent.   Gyro Supreme - $6.75 or so (add $1.75 for drink + fries/rice). Great gyro meat, soft warm pita bread and tons of feta and tzatziki sauce! I've actually never had a gyro with feta cheese - but it was a welcome addition !

xsOMMfnmso9HSjWr0fESxw.text: Came here tonight with my family, none of were impressed and my mom was quite put off with one of the waiters (the same one with whom I have had problems in the past).  She felt her food was average, minus the hummus, and much of our food was dried out and overcooked.  Service had an attitude or was just overall forgetful.  It just felt like an overall bad experience.  We talked to the table next to us and they were leaving a "$0" tip for the same waiter and said their service and food were also terrible.  We won't be returning.

g5y1fnM2aGRDRUZczs7dwQ.text: This restaurant is so good me and my friend went there today on an accident we were shopping at the smiths so on the way out we got hungry we love greek food so we are like why not !! Well we were honestly not expecting the food to be so amazing been world travelers and actually have been to Greece manny times our Greek food expectations are pretty high!! Well let me tell you what the gyro plate was amazing if I could change something it will be the French fries I would preferred Fried and more olive taste to them but still excellent the food was delicious we will be go mg back for sure !!!!!!!

DNomqEjBK4ISexTWVF8YeA.text: Food was probably 3.5 stars but customer service sucks. Also, as someone already stated, not many vegetarian options except falafel plate, lentil soup and salads. Would have liked more of a selection for vegetarian plates.   Didn't like their charging policy and poor customer service.  Just note they have a 20 % compulsory gratuity if you have a party of 11- even with separate checks. And, they charge you 1.00 for more sauce (when the falafel comes with the sauce and should have more i.e. they're skimping on the sauce.) normally, sauce is included in Greek places in a plastic squeeze bottle - especially at the prices they are charging for food and if the item you ordered should have come with sauce and more of it!!  I could understand if the food that I ordered didn't have the sauce as part of it.  I ordered the falafel plate and I specifically asked them not to make the falafels dry. I asked them to put more water/ not to use too much oil/ whatever could make the falafels more moist (hate dry falafels) but instead of thinking to offer me more tahini sauce, they skimp on it and on top of that, they charge me 1.00 for more sauce they should have included with the falafel plate in the first place!!    When I got my falafel plate, there was barely any tahini sauce. I asked him for the same sauce as what was in the falafel and he gave me a white sauce (which I guess was thazini sauce.) he came out with the tahini (brown sauce) when I mentioned it was the sauce I didn't want. I wanted the same sauce that was in the falafel sandwich. He came out with the correct sauce. But, both times,  he never mentioned that the sauce was 1.00/ sauce when I didn't even want the first sauce he gave me. When I got the bill, I was obviously upset. Instead of trying to make it right, he said "the sauce charge was m in the menu" thereby justifying why he didn't have to tell me there was a charge when I ordered it.  I asked to speak to the manager and he said the manager wasn't there. Wasn't the least bit apologetic nor trying to rectify the problem but just left!!  I told him I would pay for one but not the one I didn't want. He finally conceded but not happily. Customer service sucks!!  I do like that they cut up the falafels into strips so the falafels don't seem as dry since they are not such hugh balls of dryness...

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu page 2
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu page 1

viRlkzrf338wlMlf4Azvmg.text: I ordered through Grub Hub, this in no reflects the poor delivery guy who was sweet.  Won't be using Grub Hub anymore as we have had nothing but problems with.  Now for the rating.  It was more than $75 for four people.  I ordered 4 Original sandwiches, one with the sauce on the side. Four fries, and three extra sauces, with three Cokes and a Raspberry Ice Tea. What I got: sandwiches were right, fries were right. I got sauce on the side for one, none of the extras I paid $8 for.   I got three flat diet Cokes and one regular tea with no ice. Another $8, add the tip portion for that and I'm out twenty bucks already. So I called the place. The first guy started explaining why the order was late when I didn't even bring that up, although it was.  Enter second guy who says yeah they forgot the sauces.  @__@. So he asks if I order there a lot, I said it's our first time. He says yeah but you live in Vegas right? I admitted I did. He says mention it next time and they'll give me the sauces. Really? Wow, I get to eat dry sandwiches and be blackmailed into eating there again?  He said since it was Grub Hub it's just more work for him to fix it.  He also said they knew they were out of the tea I ordered but just gave me what they had.  Guess they are out if ice, too?  The sandwiches were good, maybe if you're eating in it's ok. You know because you'll be able to get what you paid for. Unless you want fresh drinks too.

uI1JBM2ojGoc4_hUx3HZwg.text: Food and price is 5 stars. Service is never better than a 3 and usually between 1-2. There's usually only 1 server for the whole restaurant who is also the cashier and phone answerer. Waited 25 minutes last time and only got drinks. Don't come here if you're ina rush.

gvc_aQIqHeA-AR97s78ttw.text: I ordered a very large and expensive order from this restaurant through doordash at 11am. The app showed that my doordash driver had been waiting at the restaurant for about 20 minutes to pick up my food when I checked it at around 11:35. I called The Fat Greek to see what was going on, a gentleman answered, didn't even ask my name for the order and said "were waiting on your delivery guy."  I then contacted my doordash delivery driver and he stated he had been there for 20 minutes (as it showed on the app.) When we got our food (an hour later) it was cold and really gross. The chicken was tough and over cooked, the taziki sauce tasted old and the tomatoes tasted weird. DON'T order from here. I don't appreciate being lied too, especially after spending that much money.

Hz9kR0PcoVX9nJWCYU29Ww.text: The gyro is so good and packed with a ton of meat and toppings. Definitely worth it and amazing. The feta fries are super tasty but there wasn't a lot to feta like the pic. Still pretty great. Falafel is yummy could use more sauce or something to help with the dryness.

fqafiAPd4L5oPfNJjRjUIw.text: Amazing food! So fresh and tasty! Stopped in because it was close, but will be back again for the above quality meal, low prices and friendly staff!

mfDKUg4B9-XpiPwHqH4t-g.text: I love Greek food and was pleasantly surprised to find this place while on a business trip to Las Vegas. It was very close to my hotel and easy to navigate to since it was in the opposite direction of the Strip. The hummus was excellent - some of the best I've had in a while; creamy, smooth and had a nice flavor. I ordered the chicken pita, and although it was a little larger than I would like, the chicken was well marinated, very flavorful and juicy. Everything inside - including the tzatziki. I was extremely happy with my choice and would definitely return. The restaurant also seemed to cater to a strong local clientele. A lot of the tables at lunchtime were occupied by single dinners whom the waitstaff knew and welcomed on a first name basis.

uJr3vW_wHUmUnXuDaKIyYw.text: Best Greek spot in Vegas hands down!! The avgolemono soup is the best. I also enjoy the chicken gyro. They stuff the gryros so fat. Food is always fresh and the service is great. The Athena fries are also amazing. The portions of the food is something I appreciate. The prices are fair. I go here several times a week for lunch or dinner, and don't plan on stopping anytime soon. This is a must try spot!

1CcNEBtprzUGWfq0gZrO2w.text: Food was delicious. The dressing was amazing on the Greek salad the hummus had good flavor and the Gyros were fantastic. Everything came warm and the desserts looked amazing but will have to get back on taste I'm too full from dinner to eat dessert.

yier_CaQJSl2w1zzd7Oayg.text: When we tired of restaurant eating and casino prices and wanted to spend the evening in our room, we ordered from The Fat Greek.  They arrived within the promised window and even followed my directions to bring our order to the Tower Suites reception at the Encore.  The food was yummy and the baklava was fantastic.    With food like this, no wonder the greek is fat!  :)

FuXhGICRERfsErJ6X4k2Dg.text: We're on vacation with our family and didn't want to have to go out to grab a bite with the two young kids. So, I checked Yelp and found this restaurant that delivers. I love Greek food and decided to give it a try.   I ordered Hummus with pita bread, a full greek salad, a gyro and baklava. My order arrived 20 minutes EARLY! The food was delicious. The gyro and pita bread was warm and the salad and hummus were cold. Everything was full of flavor and for the price we paid we got a lot of food.   I was very happy with the price including the delivery charge, speed of delivery, and the quality of the food. I will definitely order from them again the next time I'm in town.

5BrhTUuG3bC1gPqJLaZEdw.text: Attentive service. Nicely flavored ice tea. Cucumbers could be little crispier. Good hummus. Well flavored gyro meat that was appropriately cooked - not burnt. Good find overall

D0l4xH7pAd-_U7muHV29Mw.text: I just found this gem last week. I went twice in one week to enjoy the delicious food. I tried the Avgolemono soup and the Greek salad with gyro meat. Both were outstanding! The ice tea was fresh and tasted better than most teas I've had elsewhere.  The service was excellent from start to finish.

i1Rqx9H-7fOBH_iRCKcU3g.text: Hidden jewel!! Delicious food every time!!! Been going here for years and not only is the food fantastic but they have a great wait staff too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty big side salad lol. More like a meal

eSdQS0gbu_jpJpN5ZAPc5Q.text: Had a craving for a gyro and decided to give this place a try. I ordered the Fat Greek gyro with lamb/beef meat and added the Greek salad and drink for only 1.99 more. When the food came out I was pleased with the portion size of the food, it was a lot of food. The gyro had a lot of flavor and the tzatziki sauce was good. I would definitely come back to try some of the other foods they have to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek gyro w/ Greek salad

bcOVBNA1FwdQU6fiJDRWgw.text: Excellent food. Excellent prices.  Good service and nice people. Solid meal and worth going to 2x a week which I often do...

Yd5wiKuJ8rcOVMiM1s2LTw.text: This place is cheap and delicious . Great food and service. I ate everything No leftovers. This was the second time I've had their food went for a lunch break with my business partner he's Greek and loves the place as well!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken soup
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb and marinated steak

ETHQ-arTE6VGIdbY6bXAgA.text: A third party delivery service delivered the wrong items to me. No big deal, it happens NOT THE RESTERAUNTS FAULT! What did happen was the owner himself re-made the correct order and brought it to me himself after canceling the charge on my credit card! He also sent extra amazing authentic Greek samples!   I work in fine dining, I'm picky, demanding and hold people to a very high standard! The response to the mistake was not only above and beyond my exspectations, but the food was also above and beyond my exspectations !  Light airy phyllo dough Spanicopida ( spinach cheese filled crossant style Greek pastry)  AMAZING GYROS! Real carved meat! Big portions! Fresh SALADS with quality ingredients, big fresh feta chunks and kalamata olives!  LOVED IT ALL! REMINDS ME OF MY PAPOO's GREEK RESTERAUNT IN CHICAGO!   I will order again!!! See the pics!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG truffle cake!!!
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh salads with marinated juicy grilled chicken!
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh feta and olives!! Quality salads!!!

NozigA9Z-n34o5FVDyF2Tg.text: Probably my favorite Greek restaurant in Vegas. My family either eats here or orders from here once a month. The restaurant looks really nice and is always clean. I love the lemon soup and the kebabs and moussaka are especially good.

7s28Bd9hqDlkPjf-4F6PhA.text: Went there for lunch today. The restaurant is very clean. The customer service was excellent. The good was very tasty and portions were good size. I would recommend this place to anybody. Price for quantity of good is very good too.   .

73kc3waxbFa1bT5Cg7wp1w.text: Frequent this place so much that they  should make a plate in honored of my name !  try the pasta shrimp. Its awesome. Hummus. Greek salad. Greek friends. The burger is amazing. The water is amazing too !( I joke about their plain, same, filtered.water... It is refreshing though)

J5TCK_0bVGQ09mK2uOCOxw.text: I felt like having Mediterranean food for dinner in a casual atmosphere.  This place was a little nicer than casual but the service and food was wonderful.  We fell in love with grilled octopus in Greece.  The Fat Greek makes it differently than we found in Greece but it was still very delicious.  We also ordered spanakopita, Greek Salad and a lamb kebob plate.  Everything was really good.  We starting talking with the people at the next table.  They raved about their dinners especially the lamb chops and lamb shank.  I can't wait to return!

QIWUbip9xNInmmrA7cqkJQ.text: I am in LOVE with their Greek salad ! If I could have it everyday I would !! If you ever go . Get the meal. Comes with the delicious Pita Bread and dressing which is to die for as well! Prices are reasonable. Definitely come with an empty stomach.

OVLoaSs0lAEzWdGWr7cEMQ.text: My wife and I tried this place for the first time on a Sunday night. The service was very good, but it took a long time for our food to come out. However, the staff was very attentive and refilled the pita and bread plates and made sure that our drinks were always full. The beef kebabs and Gyro were better than expected.

3BBAD-5VX5bBdZn5yQcvlA.text: I love everything that I've tried here so far! The service can be a bit weird sometimes, the people are all very friendly, it just is always just a bit awkward for some reason. Anyways, the Greek house salad is amazing, the falafel is good, the hummus is good, the shawarma pita is delicious and so are the chicken kebabs. I haven't had anything I didn't like here and I have to scarf everything down every time . So yeah very very yummy food!

k0LCeb7469k4dTV2lRgMoQ.text: Love this place! The portions are large and the quality of meat is excellent. My favorite is The Fat Greek Salad with Chicken! Very friendly staff and if it's a hott day you must indulge in their Gelato.

CZdgoU1YNMDbSTj0TbRJsQ.text: Never crowded, attentive service, cheap wine, convenient location, excellent food. There's nothing more you need to know.  In my mind, whenever I think of what I want to eat and it's a greek salad, it's always THIS specific greek salad. Other greek salads can't even come close. This is great when I'm in Vegas from the end of May until the middle of July, and then really tragic for the rest of the year.

rWnittnnVOZaDbrw8S4-LQ.text: Nice welcoming place.   Somewhat limited menu and offering outdoor seating. The mousaka was pretty good though not excellent since it seemed  over spiced but the portion was huge..  My friend had the chicken shishkabob and I tried it and was very tasty. Also tried the saganaki (flaming cheese though they wont light it up) which was tasty but a bit too dry.  Overall, a good place for greek food.  Service was attentive and pleasant.

TxkPAR3vFxN3U3j493-UkQ.text: I ordered delivery from here and was so pleased to find every dish was excellent! My favorite was the big fat gyro sandwich. It was amazing. The meat was so tasty and tender and the vegetables were fresh and crisp! I will definitely make this place one of my regular go-to's. Generous portions, great food.

dIky0LLlTTGZMW6ezJoWhQ.text: I would really rate this place a 4 1/2, but you have to choose and it's hot and sweaty today, so I'm going with the cranky option.   Speaking of cranky, one of my quarrels is that you never know what kind of mood the waiter will be in. Never actually rude, but sometimes pleasant and sometimes looking like he was wishin' he was someplace else. We all feel that way, buddy, but you are working for tips and you need to be kissin  butt the like the girls do.   Having said that, I have mostly praise for the food. They have, hands down, the best tzaziki dip I've ever had. It's creamy, tangy, and enhanced with just a little kick of ouzo. Mmmm! (Maybe the fact that they were out today is what's pushing my cranky button. That and the fact that they could break loose with a little more pita to accompany it. Don't be cheap, especially with bread)!   They also have actual Greek salad; by that I mean NO LETTUCE! Yes! They also have the option with lettuce, if you don't know any better, but today they served it without  the dressing. Not docking them because it wouldn't have hurt the wounded parties to just ask for some, but still!   Gyros are tasty and filling, the chicken and rice is enough for two meals, and the fries, both regular and Athenian, are always hot, fresh and crispy. (As in burn your tongue). Baklava is stuffed with nuts and plenty to share, but don't try to get any of mine!   My only real quarrel is the saganaki. This classic dish of flaming cheese needs to be flaming. What a disappointment to get a slab of it just breaded and fried. (OK, I know that sounds good, too, but you'll have to trust me on this.) Still, I highly recommend this place. Just put a torch to that cheese and I'll give you that other star.

DxZGw0uIySALENSbzBzGUg.text: I eat here quite often and every time find myself almost dumbfounded at how delicious the food is. Both the avgolemeno and lentil soups are awesome, and you can't go wrong with their salads or anything from the grill. Their hummus and spanakopita are my favorite of all the Mediterranean restaurants I visit. I usually order delivery with no issues but have always had pleasant and friendly service when dining in. Love this place, I'll be back time and time again!

dOPDiDCuxJG9MB9T-3SF-w.text: The BF and I came for lunch.   He ordered the Fat Greek Gyro w/ fries. He thought it was pretty good and surprised at how plentiful the meat was. Fries were crispy outside and still fluffy inside. He originally wanted to get falafel but they were out, so next time.  I got the chicken shawarma w/ Greek salad. The chicken was pretty juicy and the hummus in it was good and plentiful in meat and toppings. Salad was pretty basic, but very fresh and crisp.   We got a baklava to share since it just got out the oven. This would have been pretty good of a pastry but the nuts tasted a little bit burnt so it was toasted a bit longer than it should have been.   Service was friendly, but a bit slow. This though wasn't because the server wasn't doing his thing, but he was the only server with two big parties and 3 other tables. There were other people prepping and who I think is maybe an owner sitting around, but no one helped him out.   Overall a pretty decent lunch spot.

Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek Gyro w/ fries
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Shawarma w/ salad

Prjclt4dk-2UddkCr9GhGA.text: So worth the bus ride from the strip!  We discovered this place when searching for something "different" to try on our vacation. The reviews left by others indicated we should try. So glad we did.  We ended up going on a Sunday for dinner/supper.   Since we did our research prior to going we knew they offered a gyro and fries.  But when we were given the menu it wasn't there.  Mentioned this to the waitress,which she said wasn't a problem and allowed us to order a lunch menu item for dinner. The gyro was wonderful!  Fries too.   Eventhouh we were already stuffed, we somehow managed to order the baklava.  It was equally as good.  I don't know what type of honey they have but I could drink it straight! Everyone was so polite, accommodating and attentive. When we visit Vegas again, we will be back. It's worth the 1200 mile trek.

Vd3bue6fFiVQkUVLVeSKGw.text: Great find!  The service was very attentive and the moussaka was excellent.  The tzatziki is also quite tasty. Our server listed the beers by region, not by maker, which was strange.  But we had the Greek beer, which turned out to be Hilla.  Served in a cold glass.  It went well with the food.  We came here just before 9pm on Friday. The sign outside says they close at 9pm every night of the week, except Sunday which is 8pm.  But they seemed to stay open past 9pm, so I don't know.  The website and Yelp says 10pm on Saturdays and Sundays. I thought they were closed on Sundays before.  It's so confusing.  $10 minimum for credit card charges.

3tr7SxVLsBr47wP_V8c1ug.text: I was very excited to try out Greek food, for I have never had it before. So I went here to expect Greek food. But I did not get any service!! I waited for at least 15 minutes and there were still no drinks on my table whatsoever...I was so disappointed, worst first time, ever. Don't think I will ever go to this location again.

zUzZkilM5qiJAvnHtZ_TyA.text: OPA!   This place was almost perfect. Almost...  I loved the blue walls with white trim that lined the store. It seemed to be a very quaint store seating below 100 seats inside and out.  The menu was small and that was perfect as the three dishes we ordered came out like ambrosia. I usually only eat one thing when I return to a store. Here however I want to try one of everything.  Service wasn't bad but wasn't good either. There was only one waiter to serve, clear, and refill drinks and he was busting his butt so it didn't surprise me our drinks were empty  for a long period of time (8mins) on more than one occasion.   I will be back soon and encourage you to come on down!

iltGXYRJ0Sih-GNrCSLlbw.text: Great service, generous portions. I ordered the gyro platter. The gyro meat was moist. I prefer a lot of red onions and tomatoes on my gyro and they were a bit skimpy on these :-( They were however generous portions of rice, a side Greek salad and the tzasiki. Overall pretty good and good value ($14) and I'll more than likely return when in the area. I recommend!

uzK-voEXU7Yzs5GcOmGQ2g.text: This place is soooooo good, if you are looking for good mediterranean/Greek food, this is one good place! I had the beef/lamb fat gyro and it was better then I expected, it was amazing! 5star customer service and the price is very reasonable! I got the gyro, fries and drink for $11-$12!

TDXG96odav_VInMil3sSTw.text: Ate here during the Rockabilly weekend. The food and the service was awesome. We got the four combo of the cold appetizers and the combo plate for two.. Get the soup with the combo! That filled up 3 of us. I wished we had room for dessert. Our server, Peter if I remember correctly, was friendly more than helpful with suggestions for our party. His helper Joaquin was also very friendly and helpful.  It's in a nice strip mall away for the LV Strip. Check this place out for some terrific authentic food.

pYI-fO8uV1F7aIq-GF11lw.text: If you're looking to get away from over-priced, tourist fusion food on the strip, there are several great places not all that far away.  The Fat Greek is one of them, a delightful and unassuming Greek restaurant conveniently hidden in a strip mall next to a Smith's grocery store.  The inside is airy and inviting, the staff was attentive during my two visits here, and the Greek food is as good as you'll find in the Las Vegas area.  Nothing fancy, just straightforward Greek classics and moderate prices.  If you're somewhat new to Greek food, try the sampler plate for two.  It has all of the best dishes and comes with soup or a giant Greek dinner salad.  The appetizers are solid as well, especially their felafel and tzatziki - as good as I have had in Greece, whether in the islands, in Athens, or in the northern region like Kastraki.  I saw other reviews saying that the food was average, while also stating it was the reviewer's first time eating Greek food.  If you're looking for powerful flavors that BLOW you away, then Mediterranean food is not for you - stop bashing a cuisine because you're used to over salted and over spiced meals.  The classic Gyro plate is solid, the meat a great blend of lamb and beef with just enough spice.  It may be hard to truly screw up most Greek dishes, but this place delivers an especially good Greek meal from a value perspective as their prices are very reasonable.  This is my new go to Greek place when I am sentenced to Vegas on business.  If you like Greek food, you won't go wrong here.

jJybiSEs6NFaTnG0ll0NCw.text: We are staying on the strip and are so tired of overpriced junk food. I looked up Greek food on yelp and found this place. I was only a short drive from the strip that was well worth it. I ordered food to go, I got a Greek salad with grilled chicken, a chicken gyro with fries, and a piece of baklava. The food was still hot and delicious after I got back to our hotel. The salad was so fresh and the chicken well seasoned. The chicken gyro had some of the most scrumptious feta I have ever had and it was topped with fresh tomatoes and lettuce. The baklava was out of this world! I definitely recommend this place to anyone staying near the strip who wants fresh and reasonably priced instead of bland and overpriced! The woman who helped me with my order was very courteous and the food was ready in less than 10 minutes. Eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soooooo delish!!!

dui0f8M0wU_3LkB53-3aQQ.text: With a name like this, it took a while for me to get up the nerve to go: I'm not sure it's good marketing, but at least it indicates that the food is probably good. After visiting, I can confirm, it is the kind of food you can get fat on.  Location is easy to miss if you aren't familiar with the plaza- I've driven past the intersection countless times but didn't know it was here. Parking can be difficult to find due to other busy businesses nearby. This place rocks a giant but empty patio which would probably be better utilized as additional parking spaces.  Ordered a fat gyro and athens fries. The fat gyro is no joke, the name of this sandwich is as honest as the name of the restaurant: it's enormous and was two solid meals for me. The chewy, soft pita pilllowed a plentiful portion of moist and flavorful gyro meat, topped with tzatziki sauce and feta, and supplemented with lettuce and tomato. From the first bite to about the middle of the 'ro, it is amazing: flavors complement one another in a classic way that is key to a good gyro. Then you realize how full you are and the debate between having fries and saving the other half, or forcing yourself to finish, kicks in. I opted to resis the urge, but was underwhelmed by the fries: I went at an odd time between lunch and dinner and expected the fries to be made fresh but they tasted like they'd been sitting out a while and were a bizarre combination of dry and flavorless. That being said, the cheese atop them was a generous amount, and the portion was a good value for the $3 price tag. However, I'm just not cool with the idea that I need to add several shakes of salt to a heap of cheese and fries to make them palatable.   If you choose to stuff yourself with gyro instead of opting for a side, I won't judge you. But I will judge you if you follow that up with another meal later in the day because, Lord, that's a lot of food! If you opt to save it for later, as I did, consider taking the lettuce and tomato out so that you can heat it up without getting nasty warm produce when you reheat in your morning daze. Also consider removing the layer of foil beneath your leftover fries so as not to reenact the microwave-fire scene from American Hustle. Your intact kitchen and taste buds will thank you.

8RT7JNskpORJv2UJo-jYBw.text: My boyfriend and I love Mediterranean food and this place by far has the best Greek food we've had in Vegas. It's also super close to where we live so we end up ordering take-out here at least once a week. We've actually never eaten inside, but its a cute place.  The food is always quality, delicious and the portions are great for the price.   Our favorites include their chicken or beef kabob plates, the Fat Greek gyro, the Athenian fries, and the Fat Greek salad with chicken (the chicken has a delicious lemon sauce on it). (We're creatures of habit) Although I'm sure everything is great. Their desserts are very good too.  The entrees come with soup or salad (we always opt for the salad, which is a small, fresh Greek salad) and also comes with pita.  We're moving at the end of the year and this will be my most missed Vegas restaurant!

LkZTmNanFql--L5TNAXYNw.text: FIrst things first....I loved the blue and white decor--very Greek! And the service was excellent. I ordered the Spanakopita(and learned how to pronounce it!), a flaky pastry filled with spinach and feta cheese, and the Tiropita, a flaky pastry filled with creamy cheese. I can say only that they were good, but not great. (Having just experienced the Las Vegas Greek Food Festival, I couldn't help comparing and I liked the Spanakopita and Tiropita I had there better). I also ordered the Babaganoush. It, also, was good, but not great. There was that slightly bitter aftertaste that I often detect in Babaganoush. So, while I would give this restaurant 5 stars for it's charming decor and attentive servers, the food earns only 3 stars from me. However, the decor may lure me back to try their Pasticcio(Greek lasagna). And THAT will either make it or break it!

5Oy7le-jM4Ut7p-pfJ26Eg.text: I order from here for lunch very often using food delivery services. I think the food is worth paying the delivery price. I usually get a Lamb/Beef Gyro with a side of Baba Ganoush and extra Pita, all of which are awesome. That Gyro is FAT. It will fill you up and I'm happy to say that the ratio of Tzatziki, Feta, and Veggies perfect for me. I don't find anything lacking.  So I ask myself, if the food is this good being delivered by a 3rd party what does it taste like fresh. I recently stopped in on my day off to answer that question. The food i so much better when you eat in and I am more inclined to order other things on the menu aside from something I think will carry well.  I had the Shrimp Santorini which is like a Mediterranean style Capellini with a Pomodoro Sauce tossed with ten Shrimp. It was great and enough for 2-3 people.  Also got to try the Fat Gyro made fresh and it made a huge difference.  I was really good delivered but excellent fresh which was expected.  Add some Hummus and extra Pita and my tummy was happy.   I will continue to order from here but will stop by whenever I get a chance.

LTbewOu-WJas9lGUQ4gVKw.text: I really wanted to love this place.  I came here straight from work with two friends for an early dinner at 6 pm. We chose to be seated outdoor as the weather was pleasant. Our servers quickly set up the table and took our drinks order. Good first impression certainly, but it was all downhill from then.  I was disappointed that they were out of bean soup, the only vegetarian soup on their menu (lentil soup, other vegetarian-sounding soup was made in chicken broth). I tried spankopita, which was very different from the one I had at Paymon's, but it was good nonetheless. We ordered saganaki, fried cheese for the table, but it was very disappointing. It was rubbery and too salty. In salads, they do side portion only for Greek salad. So I had to order full plate of Athenian pasta salad. The pasta salad was good, and so were their breads.  Among dishes my friends ordered, lamb shank was a winner. Keftedakia, not as much. They are famous for their ball shaped variety of cookies, but I guess we were out of luck that day. They only had walnut cookies and they were uninteresting and dry.  It seemed our servers had forgotten us after seating us outside. After waiting for 15 mins for the check, we literally had to wave at them for their attention.  Being spoilt for choice with so many Greek and Mediterranean restaurants in Vegas, I don't think I will come here again.

Their food is fresh and has a delightful smell the whole way home. They have a different take on a dish that I like and it's great.  The restaurant isn't in the best of areas but is in an ideal location.  Outside, where the city wreaks havoc, it isn't very clean and you can smell the stench of bums, but when you go inside its a different story. The restaurant is clean and shows the traditional colors you see in Greek atmosphere, blue and white. As you walk in the direction of the cash register you will notice a long mirror extending the whole left wall and tv's showing the news or a game. The place seemed like a very relaxing place and if I didn't work out late then I would enjoy sitting down and eating. Normally when I come there is a lady there who is really nice and treats us well. All in all it's a good place to eat and the way they conduct business with their customers is excellent. I'll enjoy meandering over here for years to come :)   Keep up the good work you guys

kpvYHBTBiYofo0F5lGJ_Cg.text: I quite liked this place. I ordered take out so I can't say anything about their table service. I came here and got a greek salad with gyro meat on top, which was suggested by the woman who took my order. I was originally going to order a Gyro Plate, but she realized I wanted more salad, so she said I should just do the salad with extra meat, which was a great recommendation. The lettuce on the salad was so nice! Very crispy and delicious. The meat also was really flavorful and satisfying. The salad came with Tatziki and Pita, which were both also delicious. The bread was grilled, but soft and really good!  The woman at the counter was friendly, helpful with suggestions, and just nice overall. I came when it wasn't at all crowded on a Saturday night and I think if I was in Vegas again, craving Middle Eastern food, I would come back here because it seemed pretty high quality and decently priced since it's farther away from the Strip. I also tried the baklava and it was pretty good, but I usually like the pastry to be a bit lighter, but it was still pretty tasty.
