Our tab was only 35 dollars, which was awesome for the amount of food. Service was great and fast. Definitely had a wide selection of options but I would definitely say to try the gyro plate!   Highly recommend it if your in the mood for Mediterranean food!

JRo8-l0AwdWM5UOsKO9Njw.text: Sounds like Sanchan below and I had the same experience.   Walked in at 5:30 on a Monday and the restaurant had two families dining there already. My cousin and I plopped ourselves down and settled on sharing an appetizer and a large entree plate (Kabob plate).   After being presented with menus, it took forever for the waiter to come around and take our order. Also, my water glass was downed within 5 minutes of seating and in the 75 minutes or so I was seated, it was never refilled. It seemed as if ONE guy were working. The restaurant eventually filled up by 6:30 but there was still ONE waiter working all the tables.   The appetizer (calamari) seemed to be kinda..old? It was crispy but didn't taste very fresh. My cousin and I felt as if it were bought and fried..and overcooked. Really not great.  The fries here are great, and the kabob plate was pretty tasty. However, the service once again got us all bent out of shape. We had to wave the ONE guy down but he was too busy trying to get people seated, orders, and whatnot.   I finally ended up just picking up my card and walking over to him at the cash register because we were starting to run late and I was tired of waving him down.   I wish I could love it because there are so many positive reviews here. I might try to give it another chance, but that's honestly a "fat chance" (pun intended).

S5cTdM3RxPV1NYDjiz_uDQ.text: So good! Can't wait to try the other dishes. The lule kabob was what I ate. The Greek salad was huge. Only thing I didn't like was the 25 mins wait for take out so I'm giving 4stars.

xWJPN4O4Q2ncRdYZBZT13A.text: One of the "go-to" Mediterranean joints around my work.  Am I the only one who confuses Mad Greek with Fat Greek though?  On any given day I have no idea which one is which and which one I prefer (I definitely prefer this one though).    The first time I went here I was convinced they had the best falafels I'd ever had (then I went to Hedary's a few days later and it got bumped to #2).   I noticed Misti in her review mentioned they seemed overcooked.   I actually have experienced them this way a few times from here but happen to enjoy the flavor that the falafels get with some extra cooking once in a while.   Would now be an appropriate time for me to present you with my idea for a restaurant that only serves burnt food?   Am I the only person who would eat there?   But I digress...  So yeah, love the falafels, and love the lentil soup as well.   I've also ordered the Chicken Skewers and thought those were excellent as well.   Big chunks of juicy chicken on a skewer with sliced tomato over some rice.  What more could you want?  Service is usually fine, but a few times one of the male staff has seemed a little stand-offish to me.  Prices are fair, but not any exceptional value either.    Bottom line is the Fat Greek is one of the better Mediterranean restaurants here in Las Vegas.   I just hope no-one ever opens a place called "The Bad Greek" anytime soon.

NL_2XpN_mrVFfugukcaU2g.text: The best Greek salad in town....PERIOD! Friendly staff always clean and never too crowded. A great dining experience whether you take out or eat in. Gina and Miguel make you feel right at home. They also have a great homemade chicken soup that's a real cold and flu killer!

LUOQfLYNdKYEWlrrL3pECg.text: This is my favorite Greek place! I have another one in Long Beach but this beats them. My favorite is falafel and the lentil soup ! Everything on the menu is tasty!!

9CgQkWq0HEeQvIvq4bCErg.text: Be prepared for a long wait before your food arrives. My first visit here took almost an hour for the food to arrive, and that was with a warning from a friend who's also had a similar experience. That's the reason for the 3 stars. I got the Fat Greek Gyro with chicken. Everything was great, especially the tzatziki sauce. I also got a side of pita and hummus, both of which were good.  The interior is literally all baby blue and white. It makes me feel like I'm near a beach. There are many seats, so if you come in with a large group, they can probably accommodate.  I would recommend this place ONLY if you're off work or if you have nowhere that you'd have to be. Otherwise, you'll be having a 2 hour lunch break. However, they also seem to do pick-up orders; I saw people come in and walk out with a bag of food in under 5 minutes. That might be the best way to enjoy the food.

hQq8fCZ2OalnX1P0bLpUeQ.text: This is my Go to place for Greek food, yummy, generous portions. their orzo is  the best, buttery and flavorful. Gyro meat is always juicy and there (I'm gonna kill this word) Tszitsiki sauce has got a kick of garlic.

BDlpFcuNeQocahVgrhM65w.text: Delicious delicious delicious salad. I will most definitely come back again. My only complaint, which is nearly my experience with every salad I order, a little too much dressing for my taste. However, it was still fantastic! I highly recommend eating here :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Obviously delicious...it was a fat Greek salad with chicken
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek salad with chicken

bLeDkp4MJ5RO2WopursHLA.text: This place is amazing tastes amazing and great customer service.   Usually don't give 5 stars unless their food is really good and customer service is on point!

nsHd5o4bfHrCT_jNFxvEkw.text: Food is great. Come here often for lunch. Went to lunch today and had a horrible experience. Ordered a Greek salad with chicken, beef/lamb gyro and a chicken sandwich with fries,to go. We waited 30 mins for our food and received the wrong order!!! Our total wait was 40 minutes and food wasn't even ready, cancelled our order. I brought this up to the owner/manager and didn't seem to care very much. Beyond disappointed!!

gtcdlo6NMFY5kmFVVKZ_7w.text: Wow :) food is great. Server is nice and his little son is cute :) Tiropita is so deliciousss.

Fc-hkyvhSwCTZNHAduSDXA.text: Surprised at how many nice reviews this place received. I don't usually write Yelp reviews unless I had a genuinely great or terrible experience... This place fell flat.    First off... $10 Gyro Sandwich??  Coming from a San Diego local's perspective, THAT is an absolutely ludicrous price. Best Gyro in USA too? Pretty cocky.   My friends and I stopped in after EDC weekend with a craving for some decent Greek food. Firstly, I wanted to order a slice of baklava with my meal but after checking the prices, one friend and I decided to just split the gyro price by itself. I was really bummed because I would have loved a sweet for my road trip... But if I remember correctly it was around $5-$6 alone? Come on.   I decided to grab a drink too and opted for Pepsi. I'm not sure if their soda machine was dirty or the Pepsi hadn't been changed out, but my drink had a horrible lingering aftertaste that made my stomach sick. Too bad I even paid for the drink, I ended up getting water instead:(   The gyro was so stupidly mediocre I couldn't believe we had even split the bill, much less paid for anything at all. The bread was tough and dry, the meat was bland, the veggies seemed out of season and the onions were vile. The sauce to accompany it was sour like a pickle. I'm not a professional by any means, but I've never tasted such a vinegary/pickled version of that sauce elsewhere. Needs SO much improvement.   The only good thing about the visit was very friendly employees working the registers, it seemed pretty clean, and also the restaurant was a bit cliche and awkward but all in all still charming. The seasoned fries were pretty yum too. I think I'll take my cravings elsewhere in Vegas next year.

nder9Ek9qCUxoZ88xzuJKA.text: Best place for Gyros they are authentic and a lot of food for the money.  I go here all the time for Gyros

uNlT1dnfgLXHe6YXhTCTmQ.text: More proof that the best food in Vegas is always the most unassuming. I'm not a fan of the Strip for a number of reasons, one of which is the overpriced, overhyped, and underwhelming food.   The Fat Greek sits in an unimpressive strip mall and could easily be overlooked. The interior is old school decor with sky blue paint adorning the walls. There's nothing fancy or trendy about this place, and I love it for that.   Easily some of the best Greek food I've ever had. Kebab platter, falafel, hummus, everything was top notch.   Service was average at best, but it didn't matter. Food at this price, at this quality having eaten at the Strip all week was priceless.

ORC3M-TWRFZFdMlrIj5u5g.text: Visiting Vegas, we were looking for a reasonably priced restaurant so we went off the strip. The food here was not only reasonably priced but delicious. We highly recommend the gyro, lamb slovaki and the kabobs.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Slovaki
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp shish ka bob
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Schwarma

MREJ8wjPVSLoY7tySrsqXg.text: This place is the bomb! Maybe the best Greek I have eaten. Reasonably priced. If your in Vegas, you must try The Fat Greek.

u0fPntmZ4YSt2CQpXmIZsg.text: The Fat Greek will make you just that, if you eat the oversized helpings. Wonderful wonderful eating experience.  The atmosphere has the feel of modern Mediteranean...a lovely dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fabulous

MZRJ4uhisU4rghDUd4fbQg.text: The only reason I'm giving them 3 stars is because they are so darn expensive!!! 40 bucks for two gyros (that come with no fries or any salad even) and a Greek salad with gyro meat and what they consider to be a "side salad" which was a whole meal in itself. And let's not forget they charge 1$ for extra tzaziki sauce. The food itself was pretty good but for the cost, it wasn't anything special. I will probably never come back. There is better Greek food out there for a way better price!

n8P_a8tESC1YQySIyuBSIg.text: Simply put, I do not eat here enough. I should make it a point to eat here at least every other week because they are that GOOD.  They are always busy but the food is always fresh and delicious.   I have loved almost everything I have tried here except the falafel. Otherwise, I would have given them 5 stars but their falafel is a little on the dry side for me.  The Gyro's are always amazing. Filled with just enough meat to veggies ratio and the perfect tzatziki sauce.  The kabobs are always on point and have yet to disappoint me yet. Never dry or overcooked. Perfectly moist and the most delicious tantalizing bites I can put in my mouth.  The hummus and babagoonoosh are always a huge hit for me too.  I love this place.  The prices are very accommodating and I love that I can call ahead to pick up my order.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat greek gyro (get in my belly)

d9w-DVeIq57QMvtfsZ8AGQ.text: Great lunch spot! I got the Greek salad with chicken, a very delicious healthy salad. I also recommend the gyro that I got last time! #FoodComa

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qriaAcKd8G6lYcvuTYpoOA.text: Good food at a reasonable price. A golden rule of a sustainable business.  The Fat Greek is a great Greek restaurant in my neighborhood.  - Gyro plate - Lamb shish kebob  The lamb was tender and juicy, and the grilled vegetables came with aroma of charcoal.  Order comes with soup or salad, plus bread and butter in addition to pita. It's actually a lot of food at this point.  Also, they have the patio seating which is nice to chill out in the cool evening.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb shish kebob
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro plate
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and butter in addition to pita? Nice.

cNnHgF8naSglokUtR3HY3w.text: Wonderful Food and Staff. I saw this restaurant  3 years ago during the end of my vacation and made plans to dine here on my return visit. For the past two years, we've dined here twice per visit. The atmosphere and dishes reminds  me of my Crete Greece experience. I have exposed this Gem to my friends who live in the area. The Fat Greek is well worth a visit...or two...or three... .

X0rrZOogVbK9MbADChKr9w.text: Excellent greek redtaurant. Fantastic salad and beef souvlaki dinners. Fresh and good. Not crazy about their saganaki.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BtnbszDEIDF0qeVmp-ln-g.text: We decided to check out The Fat Greek about a month ago. We split the combination plate for two (moussaka, pasticcio, gyro, dolmades, roasted potatoes and tiropita). They were out of grape leaves so they substituted meat patties for the dolmades. We each got a Greek beer. I was impressed with their selection of Eastern European beers but not so impressed with the food. The food was fine but not particularly memorable...if I remember correctly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination plate for two
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken soup
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek beer

yPYLHg2oWv4h-Bso9qR_PA.text: Stopped in here looking for a quick gyro, ended up getting the gyro platter for $12, which turned out to be a fair price for a lot of food, including an excellent, fresh side salad with Greek house dressing, plus fresh baked bread and flat bread. The gyro meat was moist and delicious, the tsatsiki was fresh and tangy, with a hit of dill.  I wanted to try the mousaka, but they were out of it the day I stopped in. They have lunch specials, so if you want to just grab a gyro, falafel, etc you can. I'm glad I found this place, and highly recommend!

2Y8slaqJ8Whm8TDolsOiNQ.text: I pass this restaurant everyday and my family and I finally decided to give it a try today for lunch.    The Fat Greek Gyro is out of this world! I've had many a gyro, but the feta cheese on the top of the Fat Greek Gyro really sets this gyro apart from the rest.  If you are a feta fan, you also have to try the Athenian fries- melted feta on the top of crispy, delicious fries.  Oh, so very good!   The Fat Greek is also an excellent value.  The portions are huge and the overall atmosphere of the place is great.  I think I will be hard pressed to find a gyro that is as good as the one I had here today!

3IUTaYS6oZOw5cFqKX1yuA.text: I was very impressed how clean, pristine really, this place is.  Second I was impressed with the waitress - she was always smiling and very polite and helpful.  I was not impressed with the gyro meat.  It was sorta dry so I think it was shaved well before I arrived for my meal.  The greek salad was just average compared to others I've had.

gdIq99S-fyQjsLhNO8syEw.text: I've been coming here since 2009. Nothing can beat this Greek food in town. This coming from a person who has been to Greece and who has many (married into) Greek relatives. My favorite is the Avgolemono soup, tiropita, and pasticcio. Their rice is excellent and the chicken pitas are great too! I haven't eaten anything I don't like here. Thumbs up!

MVuij8MkW6jC4p_m5XlbvA.text: He may be fat, but he is a charmer. "Charming" is not a word I use regularly, but it is the perfect word for The Fat Greek. Regardless of the food, the bright blue interior here is the perfect respite from the blazing desert days of Vegas. Right down to the chairs, everything is perfectly coordinated in a blue and white color scheme that makes you feel like you are in a cooler climate.   The service is also charming. Everyone is personable and easy-going. You can see that there are regulars, as the staff takes time to check up on the happenings in their lives. It definitely has the "I could be a regular here" vibe. It's just so darn charming. I simply can't think of a better word!  The menu has a broad range of Mediterranean offerings, not exclusively Greek, but I would expect a fat Greek to eat a lot of things, right? I shared bean soup, a falafel pita wrap and a Greek salad with some gyro on top with the husband. The portions are generous. For example, the small Greek salad was enough to share given the other items we had ordered. I loved the bean soup, and the salad was fresh with a nice dressing. The falafel pita was beautiful and prepared in a way that made it easy to eat. My husband really liked it, but the falafel had too much parsley for my taste and seemed a little overcooked. I probably would not order the falafel again. However, the soup and salad were winners! Looking around, the kabob plates looked tempting, and it is probably worth exploring some of the authentic Greek options. I just couldn't resist trying the falafel!   Next time, I'm going for the appetizer combo plate.

IY790-q_sMRmaiM_sN3mPQ.text: Great place went with a group of 5 friends everyone got something different and tried each other's food. Everything was great. I loved the lamb and roasted veggies best, but the moussaka was bomb-tacular as well.   They have a good selection of beers including some Greek beers.  I would highly recommend to anyone that likes great food and chill times.

1MsgT-jbDIzYTp3X5qNahg.text: When I decided on The Fat Greek for lunch I was starving! It's so hard to make a menu selection when your eyes are as big as your stomach is empty. The first thing I knew I was getting was Athenian Fries. I'm not sure how "Greek" french fries really are, but hey, they have them on the menu, the gentleman at the counter recommended them AND the owners are really Greek, so why not. I'm a sucker for Feta Cheese so the Beef/Lamb Fat Greek Gyro sounded great to me. Neither selection let me down. The Gyro was HUGE!   The venue was very clean and the service was friendly and quick. Next time I would love to sit down and eat at the restaurant when I have time and eat only from the appetizers list. I heart Greek food, and especially love it when you know the restaurant owners are Truely Greek. :)  A great seletion for quality, fresh Greek food. Yum.

emTNG1CztPLyL5KWxumEIQ.text: Great fresh bread (get the hummus), amazing prices, solid fresh food.

4mUQFAQX_LI2Vpylz50A-Q.text: Service was great. The meal was fittingly cheap. Desserts looked good.   But I got soooo sick an hour after eating here(and only here) one day last week. I had the PROCESSED and overly salty "lamb-beef" gyro meat and funny-tasting moussaka... I suspect my two bites of the gross moussaka were to blame.   I can't fathom the fact that Americans enjoy gyro bologna, which is thin and processed (not skewered) and worth about $0.01/lb. Gyro meat should be chunky, moist and crispy... and lamb OR beef.  The baklava was overly-dense, bland and gross. I can understand why my throat refused said advances. Next.

8gdcTcUetdvmx7_VhKn3HQ.text: No wonder they call it The Fat Greek. Once you try anything you want everything!!!  The food was FANTASTIC as was the service. We even had a conversation with a man at a neighboring table that was fun. He was Greek and told us the food was very authentic.   I highly recommend "The Fat Greek". We're making plans to go back and have the Lamb Shanks as they were out the day that we went.  One other thing, if you're a vegetarian, you'll find ample food for you.

45WnvI2E0IbXGCo4fqk01Q.text: Great Atmosphere.  Not very busy.  Lovely wait staff! The spanikopita was bland.  And I didn't like the baklava.  But the Fat Salad was amazing, the Egg bread beautiful and the Avgolemono Soup was sooo creamy and wonderful.   I'll go back and try more!

oC6JNdldT5Pu1r0JztzD6g.text: This is our only go to for Greek, have it one or twice a month.  Gyro's are top notch (Fav. is the Fat Greek) price is dead on and serving size is huge.  Meat is not greasy, but very tasty.. Nothing more to say, can't recommend it enough!

mnWdkmFWiHF8hWFpYlhYbQ.text: When you seat me and my four friends ten minutes before your closing time, you deserve five stars.  When your food is delicious, and there's plenty of it, you deserve five stars.  When you're genial and join in our laughter even after we're the only ones in the restaurant, and we're the only things keeping you from going home, you deserve five stars.  After a long drive to Vegas and checking in our bags at our hotel, we drove over to The Fat Greek.  It was already about 8:50pm when we got there, but they welcomed us in as if the place had just opened up for the day.    Our waitress was super friendly and suggested we get the four-appetizer combo when we couldn't decide which appetizer to get.  Along with the combo, we also got the calamari.  The babaganoush and the hummus were my favorites of the cold appetizers, and the calamari was light and crispy.  Not to mention, our waitress kept bringing us fresh oven-warm pita like a Mexican restaurant brings your a never-ending bowl of tortilla chips.  My pork chops were fantastic--a huge serving of pork chops that were juicy and flavorful.  And I loved the lemon roasted potatoes that came with the chops.  I will definitely go back to this place when I go back to Vegas.

fIJxtNYrkrzifaSArQhlXQ.text: To have authentic Greek food, you have to have a Greek cook and you need to speak  to real Greeks not middle easterners who think Baba Ganoush is Greek!  And when you get your gyro you dont serve it with a pickle!  You serve it with greek fries and your drink.  It upsets me when you have a so-called Greek restaurant but every recipe or menu item is tweaked and changed.  Authentic means original not Middle Eastern style Greek.

HVM6q7zib9l6UqqKqKsqxA.text: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!! I started with tabouli and it was really tasty. Just the right amount of lemon and fresh mint. For my main course I ordered the Athenian fries and the Fat Greek Gyro. I asked for my meat to be a little crispy and it was prepared perfectly. It was still moist on the inside of the strips and was seasoned well. The tzatziki sauce was authentic with a great flavor.The Fries were the highlight for everyone though. The garlic and feta combo is unbelievable. Miguel was an awesome waiter, and made sure our experience was great. If you're looking for Great Greek in Vegas this is definitely it!!

9UcFTYkXIJb6YxI_wujUcw.text: I was on Vacation in Las Vegas , when i found The Fat Greek.It is a small restaurant close the streep. Very good food and very nice waiters. Large portions for reasonable prices.the deserts are delirious also. I will back in January.

PcPA9UAHqKPxbby9eZziyA.text: The Best Greek Restaurant inTown!  The food is excellent, large portions, very reasonable prices, friendly staff, great service...not much more you can ask for. The Gyro's are stuffed to the brim, the Greek Salad is awesome (especially if you add Gyro meat) The lemon/chicken/rice soup "Avolomole" or something like that, is wonderful.  I have never had a bad meal, if you like greek food, you will love this restaurant!

s1PT5eRrL4tv9pJYQvw5Qw.text: I'm not a fan of Greek food, but I've eaten lunch here twice and enjoyed it a ton both times. The traditional gyro and hummus is awesome.

LshDhSW3nFOo3tnNhK_z2Q.text: Absolutely FANTASTIC!!! My wife would eat here every day if I'd go with her. Fresh, Fast, Super Friendly & CLEAN !!! This place is the best we've ever had greek food. The Gyro is awesome and only outdone by the Greek Salad with Gyro meat on top. The Pork chop is Amazing (and I NEVER order pork chops but a neighbor said to give it a try). Absolutely the best IF you can find a spot for lunch. Seems everybody knows about it now. Nest to the Smith's ... Go and you won't be disappointed.

CmzoxLTpqG8oKhoHfYjXHQ.text: Delicious. What a simple and perfect place.   Like most restaurants in Vegas, it's in an old crappy shopping center and you would never think to try it unless you saw it on Yelp and read the great reviews.   The decor inside is semi outdated but also authentic. The menu is clear and simple with a great variety. The prices are totally reasonable. My girlfriend and I shared the saganaki (fried cheese) which came with pita, I had a falafel gyro with a delicious side Greek salad and she had a small Greek salad and a cup of soup. The dressing was a simple Olive oil/ vinegar /lemon juice  blend but so flavorful and fresh. The bill was under 30.00 and we had lots of delicious food.   The vibe inside was steady but calm and great for a leisurely lunch. Servers were helpful, knowledgeable and nice.   I would definitely come back on the regular.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Falafel gyro.
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad, comes with all gyros and sandwiches. The dressing was so flavorful and perfect
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saganaki. Served with warm pita. Delish.

eW47Jozb5rL44RqiaD8IBw.text: OMG just walked out waited for 50 minutes for our food our waiter never came back after he served our drinks. I asked the waitress to find out how much longer and she said 15 more minutes  REALLY  No one tell us that it was going to take an hour to get our food. I will never come again I normally go twice a month service has always been slow but this is ridiculous.

ZHJZH_n11f5LDuFzWkh-ag.text: The prices are so affordable here, great break from overpriced LV strip restaurants   Great Greek Chicken salad   The Lemon Chicken soup is awesome   The gyro sandwich was big

ZkZLhaYDfyGE7JzXZ5aDOA.text: While we were eating a cockroach ran cross our table and fell on the floor we killed it and put a napkin over it so other won't see it and get disgusted, we told the worker to pick it up so others won't see it she didn't even apologize or gave us a discount, even tho the food is good  after that roach I don't think I can go eat there again that was nasty...

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1FmvezUXo1jvR7t-uJtxZQ.text: This place was very delightful.    Walking in the ambiance was very nice.   It's bright and sunny and there's some nice paintings on the walls.   You have to self seat which actually makes me crazy but that's just one of my personal quirks.  It took longer than I think it should have to get our order taken but it was prime lunch time and the restaurant was quite crowded.  There were only 2 servers so that probably didn't help much.   It also took quite some time to get our food but again it was busy and I think there was only one person in the kitchen.   Once we did get our food I will say it was worth it.   The flavors are deep, rich and strong in a good way.   The only thing I didn't like was the pita bread as it was thin and hard.   Definitely well be coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kefta kebab
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek gyro
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad

0efDqnZoPR8rbi5xoyjVFw.text: Delicious, large portion, and very cheap. I recommend!!!! Great spot!!!  We had Greek salad with chicken, small Greek salad and side of gyros

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad with chicken, small Greek salad and side of gyros  so good

D5v9NX3eW5S4HVJMzn4ONQ.text: Last Monday, I ordered a classic gyro sandwich via Eat24. I liked the convenience that gave me especially when you can set up a schedule for your food to be ready. Having said that, they were quick in service. I walked into the restaurant, and my food was ready after transaction.  Ambiance: The interior of this shop was a bit rundown. It's a shame because it seems like they get a lot of customers, yet they don't seem to care for customer experience. It almost reminds me of a diner with old looking seats, tables and decor. It's not really something I want to see you while eating.   Food: The classic gyro seemed average in taste. The most notable part of this sandwich was the meat. I loved how tender it was as it made the meal enjoyable. Honestly, I could've eaten that on its own or maybe with salad. One setback about it was the over execution. With out together, nothing seemed to pop out except for the gyro. It was almost as though, I could do without the other ingredients.  Customer Service: I may have put this at a four star had the rep didn't make me feel so unwelcomed. I walked to the counter and he stared at me not asking what he can help me with. Instead he continued staring with a scowl on his face! It was unbearable and I almost wanted to ask what his problem was. Luckily, another server came up to me and asked what I needed. Anyway, that was one of the worst experience I've had in a long while! Maybe they need to train that man about being courteous or put him at the back with the cooks. He really didn't have a place to be up front looking so upset.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Babaganoush
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fat Greek

SZ4Hqf0SMs_d-Qu3Tdai7A.text: We've ordered take-out a couple of times. This restaurant has delicious food and fair prices. Portions are large and the staff are friendly. The Fat Greek Gyro, falafel and spanakopita are delicious!

wRxt30EbJMTbEiRoUSwoqw.text: This cashier named Gina, so rude!!! We came to pick up some food and she had an attitude the entire time. She should NOT be working in a place where customer service is required. She didn't help us at all.

n-cwHXNHMjpGoryiT56L_g.text: Had a craving for gyro and thanks to Yelpers, found this place!  It's simple and clean, in a newly redone shopping center in a decent part of town. Plenty of parking. We came off hours, so it was almost empty, but had a steady stream of customers. Outside, the manager chatted with a couple of regulars. I like seeing that.   Service was fast and good. Both the gyros and kabobs were excellent. Quality meats, done perfectly. Will definitely be back! I think the ambiance would be nice at night, but even during the day, it's a go-to place for lunch.

FUBz4pybU9dxG9e0RQWu6w.text: Pay close attention to the low reviews that focus on service. This place has some of the worst customer service I've ever experienced.   I was craving some Greek food and the normal spot I go to is closed on Sundays. I checked Yelp and was convinced to try this place by the number of good reviews. I stopped in and was immediately a little weary because they didn't have much business. There were 3 tables in the restaurant. I went to the register and asked for a menu to place a takeout order. I noticed that the cashier was also the only waiter. After almost a 10 minute wait,  the guy came back and took my order. I got the traditional gyro with beef/lamb and an order of Athenian fries. I paid for my order by debit card and took the table closest to the register. During the 35 minutes it took for me to get my food I noticed the few people walking in not being greeted,  not knowing whether or not to just sit or wait to be seated,  and waiting for anyone to speak to them for 10 + minutes. Meanwhile the one waiter was lounging at the front chatting with the busboy.    Any remotely competent server could've handled this small size group with ease. Finally I asked about my food. Turns out my food was sitting on their back counter. I asked how long it was sitting there and the waiter said he didn't know. I opened my bag before leaving and the food was cold. Not having another hour to invest in this place since I paled in the 30 minute parking I just took it and left.   Don't come here if you're hungry, on any kind of schedule, or you want takeout. You will regret it. Soggy fries and dry gyro meat don't make me want to put up with this again.

IIqQYbkQ3oLmrYyDRZFSZg.text: My favorite Greek restaurant in Vegas!  This is a locally owned business with extremely friendly staff and delicious food.  My favorite things to get are the lamb kabobs or the gyro place.  The lamb kabobs come with a delicious lemon sauce, veggies and rice.  Amazing!  Those two dishes also come with a side Greek salad.  A lot of food for a really good price.  Must try.    This place is located in an older strip mall, so dont let the location fool you.

55ZYpnvcrocnVgS4_151Jw.text: Great place to pick up a delicious Greek gyro to go, which is usually what I do. Whenever I dine in I sit outside. The inside  dining area is pretty cramped and can get loud sometimes. Since its summer in sunny Las Vegas my only option is take out lol. But it's definitely worth it. They have beyond generous portions and exceptional  staff.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lacking in dessert section but gyros are amazing...

7IOEvijpUgqwq_MrcIMoMQ.text: So we've tried several greek spots here in Las Vegas in search of our "go to" Greek food spot. We decided to give this place a try after seeing awesome pics on Yelp! Everything looked yummy, so we were really crossing our fingers that it wasn't too good to be True.    We absolutely LOVED everything! The place was clean and decorated in white and blue which reminded us of Greece. Cute little spot in a strip mall.   Our server was nice and brought our food in it's respective time. There's nothing I dislike the most than bad timing. We ordered hummus; something I always look for: warm pita bread! They had it!! We had the time to enjoy it before getting our gyros as the main entree. Presentation was beautiful, clean and absolutely delicious.   We are definitely going back since we now found our GO TO Greek spot!

My partner had something else, but she didn't complain as her meal was fine.  Been coming to this restaurant for maybe 6 years and I finally had a poor meal.

qOQUURMjqjKAH7xYd56GWQ.text: Ok, for me to go to the same spot twice in one day tells you that I couldn't get the tasty thought of the Fat Greek out of my head since lunch, and had to have it for dinner. Tonight I ordered takeout, and I accept the thought that takeout js generally not as good as dining in, well, that is not the case at the Fat Greek. I ordered the pastichio with a side Greek salad and a rum raisin rice pudding. Every bite of the salad was delicious, the vegetables were crisp and ripe, the feta cheese soft and not too salty. The pastichio was unbelievable! The meat was so seasoned deliciously, and the red tomato sauce complimented it nicely. Finally, I had the rum raisin rice pudding and it made me smiiiile. So delicious. I'm so happy I didn't eat anywhere else today, this food def made my day. Wish they were open for breakfast lol.

oVHCs_LV2dup5Eq6s6a6xQ.text: I came here with the hubby. This was our 2nd time trying Greek food. Which turned out better than I had expected from our first time (at a different location). Our server was a male, he was okay, but he isn't the friendliest server (lost a point). The food came out quickly. We ordered the hummus and the babaganoush for our appetizer, which was really good. -Wu4J1epLHXcRzI978BaMw.text: I'm updating to improve my review to 4 stars.  They've expanded the restaurant and improved the service.  Food is still great.  Best Greek food I've had in a long time.  Good food, especially the gyros.  Greek salad was made with great olive oil and the flavor really improves the dish, especially compared to the vinagrette they put on at most Greek restaurants.

3EEeaMJBmYfc4SMfJ5wUcw.text: Great lunch spot.  I have eaten here 20+ times and haven't had a bad experience yet..

gMf9ktefD5iq4AhT9KxMRw.text: Okay, so I have frequented at least 4 different Greek places in Vegas and have yet to find one I REALLY liked. I generally judge a Greek Restaurant on two things. First is their dolmades (stuffed grape leaves) and the second is their tzatziki (the cucumber yogurt sauce you usually get on gyros). This place delivered on both!   I actually ended up ordering an appetizer sampler (as I don't eat meat, the appetizers are where the good stuff is). I ordered the dolmades, hummus, baba ghanoush, and tzatziki, which came with pita (although not enough pita to eat everything. I had to order more). For the most part everything was DELICIOUS!! The hummus did need a little more lemon juice for my taste, but that was an easy fix as they serve the platter with a wedge of lemon. The dolamdes were served cold, which I found I tend to like better. They had really good flavor and were a decent size. The baba ghanoush had a good smoky eggplant flavor and the tzatziki...OH, the tzatziki....it was so thick, creamy, and smooth (I mean, despite the fact that there were bits of cucumber in it - you know what I mean). GREAT flavor...a hint of dill, refreshing cucumber, a the distinct flavor of garlic (not overpowering, just a hint). It really is some of the best tzatziki I've had...even at "authentic" Greek places.  My bf got a gyro platter and he thought it was really good as well. It came with a side of fries which were REALLY good. They were a thicker cut fry with a crispy outside and velvety soft center. I really didn't know potatoes could have such a light texture. They were also coated in a kind of seasoning, although not overpowering. It may just be the oil they fried them in. TIP: Dip the fries in the tzatziki....oh so, so good.  The only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is that they don't have a vegetarian platter. Yes, they have a falafel platter and a Spanakopita platter, but not a platter with the stuff I got on it. While I enjoyed the appetizer sampler, it was  ALOT of food (I shared and still had a lot of leftovers) and it cost $14.95 (the gyro platter was only $7.95 - is that me being cheap?). I would have much rather had smaller portions of each with maybe two falafel. It would have been perfect.   But really...I will definitely go back to this place when I can...it's a bit of drive for me, but it's well worth it!

JpJbtQN2lVyQheRJpaCwbQ.text: The service is horrendous!  The new owner is so rude and doesn't have a clue about customer service.  The food is good but he changed the portion sizes.....get ready to get half a pida with ur full order of hummus!

iu0x1qgFSbKcTrEhSyLjhA.text: Excellent Greek food at fair prices. The service is friendly and the food is out of this world. Try the Gyro platter, you'll thank me later. It's probably enough food to feed three people. I get over there whenever I can and eat outside when the weather is reasonable. I only wish they were open on Sunday!

ODQrHQTAC7XUxOV2UTgZbg.text: Yay YELP! Came here based on other reviews, and had a great meal, well, meals!  Way better than your average Greek place. Had a delicious gyro for lunch. The fries were amazing also. Liked it so much I went back for diner the following night.  Had the Gyro salad, with a side of falafels, and an appetizer of, I forget the name, but it was fried cheese, VERY good. The falafels were not dry, came with an delicious sauce and went well with the salad but would be great by itself too. Lots of people order salads there it seems, and their olive oil was extremely good.  Met the owner, who was very nice. He truly is a fat Greek :)  He's happy and takes pride in his restaurant.  I highly recommend The Fat Greek for lunch or diner!

lkYCjOBwYPYz-oHmNlDxQg.text: This is it, look no more for great Greek food. The staff was very friendly and very helpful as I am not very familiar to Greek cuisine. My husband and I split the Combination Plate For Two which has enough food that it could have been a dinner for four. Great portion sizes and fair prices. This dish has a little bit of everything,  Moussaka, Pasticcio, Gyro, Dolmades, Roasted Potatoes and Tiropita and was a great way for us to try some Greek dishes. Amazing, I will definitely be back.

j0dM5AVo2m3oTRvV302hhQ.text: I want to start off by saying the baklava is the best I've ever had, hands down; however, that's the only silver lining. The food is mediocre and over priced and they do charge extra for every side condiment. The reason for this review is why I will never come back. The restaurant had just closed maybe 4 minutes ago and we tried to get a last minute baklava since it is already made so all they have to do is ring it up. We came another time before about five minutes late again and the male sever gave it to us no problem. This time there was a female server and she adamantly told us no. She was very rude for selling a simple item. I understand they had just closed, but really took no effort on her part. Needless to say, that server is not too customer friendly for a town based on hospitality. Too many other restaurants that try harder to cater to customers for me to waste my money there, no matter how good the baklava is.

Fat Greek salad, gyro plate, and Moussaka was Perfect although I could really taste the cinnamon in the mossaka it was still good.  Service was great!

GkV8pU_wkGzBG8s2-u3ktg.text: This place is fantastic!!!  We wanted a good restaurant off the Strip, and found The Fat Greek on Yelp.  It did not disappoint.  We ordered the family meal for four ($55), and it was enough food to feed our party of 6 adults and 2 kids.  The salad was delicious, as were the roasted tomatoes and peppers, but the skewers were amazing.  The lamb and chicken skewers were so good you want to keep eating long after you're full.  The steak was marinated perfectly and was very tender.  The only bad thing is that we live in California, and can't visit this wonderful place more often!

tGeCpkErq7YD_CKNeuKaJg.text: When you are looking for great  Greek for Middle Eastern Food, this is the place.

B-o9OBediHhrTG4xFcUTWg.text: 5-STARS! They serve you warm bread and pita as you are ready to order. Their bread melts is your mouth. The salads are fresh and crisp tossed lightly with olive oil. My favorite is the Gyros plate; served with a lemony authentic pilaf, you can tell it's home made. The gyros are tender and flavorful. The staff is extremely nice. The atmosphere is authentic, not extremely fancy but very welcoming.

9V3fTuU4-q88l-q8IodV3A.text: After eating lunch buffet, my husband and I were not too hungry, but would like to try something different than buffet food.  This is not your fast food joint.  It's more for the experience.  They give you some bread and pita on the house.  We got the kabob plate, one beef and one chicken ($13.99), Both are moist and tasty.  Come with soup or greek salad. Not too much rice.  Total is less than $20.  Definitely, we'll come back again to try their gyro plate and the other stuff.

The avgolemono and Fat Greek Gyro are very good. The Tzatziki is perfect, the vegetables are always fresh, and the meat very flavorful. I definitely look forward to exploring the menu more.

d85VfeTf__AqKczicffTHg.text: This restaurant has AWESOME customer service. We came in an hour before closing time and yet they still served us an awesome meal. Our waitress was awesome and had awesome manners too. Their hummus is fantastic. I had their pasta with shrimp and their shrimp were perfect. Their Fat Greek Salad is awesome too. All their seafood is fresh, literally. The cook goes out and buys it fresh or still alive... Awesome place overall.

z3ukteEq-vNYf1EnF46xtA.text: Solid, good authentic greek food. Everything taste fresh, clean, and awesome.  Its a total hidden gem in a crap hole strip mall, but its worth the hunt.  Greak gyros, shwerma, and souvlaki.  The pita bred is warm, fresh, and is not a chewy piece of cardboard, like some of those other greek chains, that pump out food like a nerd pumps out star wars facts....go here, you will not be dissapointed

AaJO_ZSJdkukefKnXZMB0w.text: This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is sooo good. The interior is delightfully homey, and the staff is incredibly attentive and friendly.  The gyro was incredible, although maybe not quite as good as the Bay Area's Opa's. The fries were some of the best I've had (crispy on the outside but nice and soft on the inside).  If we go back to Vegas we're definitely coming back to the Fat Greek.

PcEZXvHsZRFphU_Y_ARcLA.text: Best Greek food I have ever had! Amazing and great service.

bH8o_zZ4oW4z0vi6tMtcTQ.text: Best Greek food ever! Be sure to have the lemon chicken soup.  We went here twice in the week we were in LV and enjoyed everything they fixed.  Fabulous food, good prices, big potions, and quiet enough to talk -- no crazy slots or crowds.  Great place!

_YBdHLuKraseMTUFP1j2Jw.text: I love Greek food!!!!  Filling and full of flavor.  No wonder they call this place the Fat Greek, I can hardly stop shoving my face when I'm there.  So, The Fat Greek was a pleasant discovery one weekend when i was strolling in a shopping center during lunch time.  It's not cozy, it's decorated in traditional blue and white, with some grapes here and there, but once you sit down you realize....you're here to eat.  The Fat Greek is family owned and operated....and they are so happy to help you choose  something wonderful from their menu.  I recommend a bottle or two of Mythos beer, (oh yeah, they have a full bar. OPA!) and the beef kabob, with a appetizer of their homemade Hummus and fresh pita's.  WORD to the taste buds.

m2XvTKGBMaQ8EWYTKikNvg.text: Located right outside the strip next door to a food 4 less supermarket and fortunately right down the street from my place.   this Greeks is AWESOME! it's affordable, family owned, very nice people, and good quality food. the owner is really a fat greek lol and he's very nice.  you should give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

aHBe1ow9OMH2s9T9pnM1vA.text: Really liked Paymon's until we found The Fat Greek.  Everything was fresh.  Bread was incredible. Gyros was tender, wrapped in warm pita.  Terrific Greek salad.  Would have loved to try the desserts, but we ran out of time.  Bummer that they close so early.

Ty1XmNTbKaAPPhclV4CP9w.text: I love this local Greek restaurant! It's so hard to find good local places in Las Vegas that when you do you really have to support the ones you love. They make a great gyro plate here, and although it's a little more pricey they offer generous portions. The desserts are delicious as well, and they have great service. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to try something new!

YabqukdgpZEjv1mdTpv6LA.text: I have been craving Greek food for about a week now. Living in the sw, there aren't very many options. Finally I decided to make the drive to this location. It was hidden away in a strip mall, so you know the food had to be delicious. unfortunately I did not have the opportunity to try it. Walking into the brightly lit diner, there were 6 tables that were eating their food and a customer at the cash register. After a few minutes the man working asked if we were placing an order to go. When we told him we were dining in, he said we could sit anywhere. And sit we did. For about 20 minutes. He appeared to be the only employee working so we cut him some slack. He was running food and finally gave the woman in line her order. Once he was done he disappeared. He walked by our table about 10 times and we never received a menu, so unfortunately I'll never know what goodness I missed. If this place is too busy to pay attention to customers, I can go elsewhere.

fohwDn7QKdqs165jdVQiyw.text: WoW!  I've been a #1 fan of Greek food years, and when I crave it in Vegas, this is where I end up... First couple of times I was amazed @ the fresh taste, but couldn't understand the wait.. I peeked in the kitchen to see them chopping the parsley for my tabouli..."Could they be making it fresh evertime?" You bet'cha! and the prices are very reasonable, staff is amazing.  Don't miss it!!  Jason

NWPxuJ0hLFy18m42ODVkAw.text: I may not be Greek, but I have to say, this food seems pretty close to the real thing! The hummus was creamy and not overpowered by spices, you could really taste the olive oil. I don't even eat calamary, but my husband ordered it for appetizer so I tried it, wow it was crispy and tasty,  not chewy at all......I guess its True, depends how and who cooks it. The salad could have used more olives, but that's just me, the feta cheese in no way shape or form tasted like what you get at the store. We both had the gyro plate, wish I had known they offer big portions,  we could not finish it! The meat was very tender and flavorful. I can not comment on the baklava because we have not made it home yet so have not been able to take a bite. Cant wait! Definately will come back and try other dishes. The service, meh! Could have been better,  was never offered a refill on my drink, but considering they had two big families and the quality of the food we can't complaint

LhvfT03yyOJJUZmZOMsIOg.text: I stumbled upon this place on my way to the airport.  What a pleasant suprise!  I got there around 11:00 am and there was only one table available.  Within minutes there was a line out the door.  I ordered something safe - gyro with french fries.  I was disappointed with myself when I saw the entrees and salads being served to the other table.  In a few minutes I received my order and I was impressed.  The meat was tender yet crispy on the outside, the pita was soft, the sause was exactly what it should be and the french fries were delicious.    If I lived in Vegas I would eat here at least once a week.  Oh, and the prices are great!

amW5hBu6G_jEJ9g1kIO2Lw.text: My first time eating at a Greek Restaurant, I thought the food was good.  However, having my boyfriend saying it wasn't what he expected, I guess he was hoping the food to be more authentic.  He is from Greece so maybe more picky then the rest of us..  Thought to share in case any other Natives from Greece decide to give it a try would like to hear what you have to say.... :)

Icrny3GISSGetxAZDND79Q.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! The Fat Greek Gyro with chicken is my all time favorite. The spanakopita is really good and my husband highly recommends the chicken skewers. Delivery is always timely  (we've never visited in person, YET!) and always friendly. Food is always hot, fresh, and full of flavor. The pita is always warm and soft never hard nor stale. And we've never had a missing item in our order. We've ordered from here more than anywhere else since we move to Vegas in June.

dqEWjXVIf_59c-1AL-WqVw.text: It was absolutely delicious. Very reasonable. Great service, beautiful little restaurant. I loved all the art work.  The food was large portions and every bite yummy.

aPAACZHxInkdl35picESMw.text: My husband and I literally moved in this morning, .4 mile from the shopping center and wanted a nice lunch after getting up at 3:00 am to drive from LA and meet our moving truck here.  We were already very excited that the Spring Valley area has so much to do, and I started reading the list of places in our 89103 zip code. "Greek food sounds good", he said. Ten grape leaves, some kebabs, an avgolemono soup and spanakopita later, we were two very happy people splitting a very good carrot cake. My husband was a little sad to hear that the bakhlava was not yet ready but my waistline needed a little break before trying that item too. Very cute cafe, helpful staff and best avgolemono and dolmades ever. We did pick a great neighborhood!!!

In0hRxoyfyIhkXaYUhRYdA.text: This is my families go-to place for Greek food! It always has great service, friendly staff, clean environment, and amazing food. I always order the hummus, saganki, and Greek grilled chicken salad. The portions are large and they serve pita and other bread as an appetizer. Strongly recommend this place!

-OqS2JmFp5yKKhkPtSk5ZQ.text: I went in this afternoon for lunch with my boyfriend and was really impressed with the food! He ordered the Fat Greek Gyro and I had the avgolemono soup. Both dishes were large helpings for how cheaply priced they were. The bowl of soup was huge and came with warm pita bread on the side. Both dishes were flavorful and refreshing! We will be back!

I6DJBE1Y6AdHCgn_HJK2BA.text: I've tried a few greek places in town but nothing ever bowled me over. It was always "good" but nothing I bit into and just couldn't stop! Today I forgot my lunch at work and ran out to find something. On a whim I saw a sign that said Greek Food and a Gyro sounded good. After a minute or so looking through the strip mall, I found The Fat Greek and walked inside.   It's what you can expect from a Mom and Pop place, clean but very minimal and a little kitch. I grabbed a menu when a very friendly woman with what I'm guessing is a Greek accent asked me if I wanted to eat there or togo. I ordered the Beef/Lamb Fat Greek Gyro togo with fries. This was a slight upgrade from the regular Gyro as it had Feta and a few other things.  The food came out super fast and hot. I hopped back in my car and headed back to the office. When I picked up the gyro I noticed it was HUGE and the fries were delicious. One bite of that big wrap and I couldn't stop. If someone had walked by they would have thought I hadn't eaten for weeks. The meat was juicy and flavorful. The sauce was to die for and the pita was soft and warm.  I may have only had the Gyro and Fries but I'm definitely going to be a repeat customer and will be trying out their hummus and other selections.

L2QUml8R2wxkBuLA2kO0xA.text: This restaurant is pretty packed . It smells so good and I live the feta fries ( amenitas fries) so delicious ! Here today for lunch and I highly recommend coming here. The service is a little behind only I think it's becuz it's busy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The little dolls are real Greek dolls as decor.

f_GYtzgth6RDGgh_Trgaaw.text: Great place.  Good, solid Greek food. I had the chicken gyro. It was tasty, although I would have liked the chicken to have a bit more flavor. We also had the Athenian Fries; very good!! Everything was fresh, and great service!  Will return! Don't miss this one.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1fyy5xeUJpDyWZ0qqm4ZDg.text: I write this review with a heavy heart. This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in town. There's a lady that used to run the register, she was extremely nice and attentive. She hasn't been there the last few times I went in. Instead, there's a couple of guys who give really bad attitude, to the point that it's insulting. I've spent a lot of money at this place over the last 3 years or so, and to be treated so poorly by these guys is pretty mind boggling. The food is still great, but spending money to be treated like shit by a couple of slimy weasels isn't really my thing. Sorry you doofuses hate your jobs, but have a little pride in what you do, or find something else.   Hey management: Get rid of these guys and bring back the lady that used to work there! I hope she's ok!  EDIT: I've heard that the lady is back. Going to give the Fat Greek another try!

wKx4sGPkgCsopBTMfHSPww.text: We come here 3 times a week and this place is awesome. It is healthy and delicious. I don't think food can get better than this... Specially for this price!

JGk19HZRuVMdC3lqVvCFpg.text: Only giving 3 Stars due to the excessive wait time for my to go order and that the gyro's I ordered weren't in a full size pita. Instead the pita was two half slices. When I placed my order I as told it would be a 15 minute wait. I waited nearly 40 mins. While the food was delicious and my order was correctly executed, I'm not so sure I'd come here again.

r_Zw0DTt1VtpyXBtlQe_IA.text: wow.   amazing service and food.   i don't eat greek food often so the menu featured some items i wasnt familiar with.   Our server explained multiple items for us and sold us on two appetizers.. which promptly arrived at the table within minutes. Delicious.   i stuck close to my roots and ordererd the gyro plate.. it was damn good based on quantity of food and price..   this place is nestled into an older strip mall at flamingo and decatur next to the smith's.. I lived in the area for over a year before i noticed it.   I'll be back.

OpqYrdHGLejafW4Ec_mBSA.text: We ordered a bunch of stuff (soulvaki, spanikopita, etc) and ate family style. There was three of us eating and we spent about $50 before tip. The food was all fantastic, and the portions were very generous, we're just now finishing the leftovers a few days later. :)

dszmCvFK76DVY9RRNofRFw.text: Best quick Greek in Vegas? I'm a Greek/ gyro lover and I'd say so! I get the fat Greek gyro and a baklava for dinner. Best gyro and rice pilaf combo in the veg. Rice is perfect, prices are good, people are super nice, accommodating, friendly, and respectful. Makes me want to come back a lot. Get the baklava warmed up, it won't disappoint! Not cheap but not expensive, amazing!

yXiJ_5k79D2EGlA6cjDvAA.text: I came here last night on a whim after having not been here in almost a year and was a tad dissapointed. First the positives, my waiter was extremely nice and attentive when he was at my table, I ordered the fried calamari which was better than I remember, all of the food was extremely fresh. Now the negatives, it was fairly busy for a Friday night and there was only one waiter for everyone. The poor guy was running all over trying to keep up. The menu has changed and unfortunately they got rid of my favorite item, the shwarma. I attempted to order several things off of the menu and they appearantly were out, very dissapointing! This used to be my favorite Greek place but I guess I'm going to have to look again.

7hU6eDXE7AC3LJ2U3zv5Og.text: This place was delicious. After a few days of eating heavily and costly on the strip my sister and I were looking for a tasty alternative. A mere 10 minutes drive got us to one of our tastiest meals in Vegas. The avgolemono soup was just the right amount of salt and tart and the Fat Greek gyro was fresh, meat well cooked, and right amount of perfect tzatziki. We made our sandwiches a combo and were treated to a lovely crisp greek salad with impeccably fresh veggies, salty feta, and a deliciously lemony dressing.  All and all it set us back $12 a person and we couldn't have been happier. Definitely make it a stop on your next trip.

ch2kCe7Tm9WHjzsY_SJwFg.text: Super nice friendly people!  The shrimp souvlaki is great.  ATHENIAN FRIES A MUST!!! Will be back

ltoh6KX1pv4SHnsNDn5s6A.text: Really good food and service. No complaints! Salad was good, server brought out hot bread and butter, and I had the kabobs with lamb and chicken and it was delicious!

QV9_lnm2m0LWT7e2mhTVew.text: I had the pleasure of calling Las Vegas (among a few other cities) home in my pre-yelp days. Back then we tried Fat Greek at least once as we lived in the neighboring Chinatown, though I have no recollection of anything we ate there.  We found ourselves in Vegas again this week. When Fat Greek showed up on my yelp search with glowing reviews, I know we had to try it again.   It was Tuesday at noon with record high temperature (for Vegas) and this place was packed. As I noticed only two servers were working the entire dinning room with at least half of the tables having no food on them, I was a bit worried about the wait and service but it's too hot to go outside again.   We grabbed the last empty table, and one of the servers promptly provided us with the menus. I have always enjoyed the appetizer selections in Greek/Meditteranean cuisine, so I suggested to my companion that we order the appetizer combo (which offers four different cold appetizers of our choice), and he obliged (a rarity that is). It took the server a while to come back to us, but we could see how busy she was and how fast she was moving so we made no fuss about it. I asked her about some of the appetizers since no description was given on the menu and she was helpful. We decided to try the Tirokefteri (whipped feta cheese) based on her recommendation plus our old standby Hummus, Baba Ghanoush, Rice Dolmades. In addition, we ordered the Spanakopita.   We got our food 15 minutes later and the 4 appetizers were neatly arranged on two oblong platters with plenty of warm pita wedges around. I first attacked the Dolmades but I was disappointed because the rice was too firm to my liking. To be fair, my companion had no problem with the rice texture and he gladly finished the other pieces on the plate, so I guess it must be personal preference. I also like the filling to be a mixture of rice and meat but they did specify these to be Rice Dolmades on the menu. Hummus was very smooth with a nice hint of Tahini though I would not mind more Tahini in it. Baba Ghanoush was solid, but the real winner was the cheese dish Tirokefteri. We will have to seek it out in our future visits to any Greek/Meditteranean restaurant.   Most places just reheat their pre-made Spanakopita in a microwave when you order but their Spanakopita tasted like fresh out of oven.   We enjoyed our food but I was more impressed by the kitchen staff (a small one it is from what I could tell) and the two young servers for keeping it calm during rush hour. I did ask her if they were short-handed that day and she said not really just everybody came in at one time.   One of the great things about Yelp is to keep the memory alive. Now I can't blame on my early-onset Alzheimer's any more.

QsJqe_yXVd1iGI5tl74Eqw.text: In town on a business trip and stranded in my hotel room, I decided to order delivery for dinner. I got saganaki, a gyro, and the baklava. I haven't had saganaki in so long, and while this was not what I'm used to (the breading(?) threw me for a loop) it still satisfied my craving! The gyro was  perfecto. The baklava had a weird texture (but I'm also weird when it comes to texture) but it was sweet and fun to eat. 10/10 would order again

BnH4cbFMovWHYGCaTHrrbA.text: I'd give it a 4.5. Get off the strip and grab some good food at reasonable prices. Very clean and authentic. If you like Greek Food this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro platter

LkemQL7rdqKoSzi-f_yEsw.text: This place is great! It's close to work and my to-go order only took about ten minutes to be prepared. I had the falafel gyro but I've had the Fat Greek Salad numerous times before. Both dishes are reasonably priced and the falafel is amazziiinnng- full of flavor and very satiating. They have numerous plant-based options as well. Plenty of room to sit and dine-in if you choose. The Fat Greek is definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LsdMDADxNpizC1gw8917hg.text: Excellent Greek food at great prices.  We thought about going to a Greek place on the strip, but this place was ranked higher and much more affordable.  We both had the chicken lemon soup, which was hot and tasty with a little pita to dip in.  The gyro wrap was loaded and huge!  And, for only $7.50, what a steal!  To be honest, we almost didn't go in when we got there.  They had a display window at the counter and it was completely empty, which threw me off.  Why was it empty?  Where was the baklava?  It really looks strange and the owners should consider changing that as it reflects poorly.  But the way, I love that they had Greek music playing!  Nice touch!

YQHarA9AkefDG_MtD5qRIg.text: Ok, let me start by saying this is the the first and only Greek food I have had. I would never try it because I was convinced I wouldn't like it. My friend convinced me to go and it was delicious! I had a gyro and rice. We had a side of hummus with pita and he had falafel. He said his was good but I didn't try it. Now, about the gyro. Wow! I'm actually amazed about how good it was. I never eat tomato on a sandwich but chose to leave it to get the traditional experience. I also don't like the type of cheese on it or yogurt sauces but let me tell you, somehow putting them all together tasted fabulous! I can't wait to try it again and have been telling my friends to try it. The hummus was hummus. Nothing spectacular but also not bad. The rice I had on the side was also delicious!! It had garlic in it and was cooked perfectly. Honestly, it was good enough to go back just for the rice.   The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because the table was covered in a disposable paper table cover. It made it feel very cheap. You also seat yourself (which I tend to not like if I'm eating somewhere other than fast food). I think with just a few changes this place could be awesome. The food certainly is!   Quick note on the service. It was fast and timely but we were also the only people in the restaurant.

rcY1bCKholdCSJcuRQMGpA.text: Food is great but service sucks and the wait time is even worse. We arrived prior to lunch time to avoid delays and waited at least 35 minutes. The waitress could not comprehend me asking for fries vs. rice, yikes. Then I got attitude stating, "say rice or FRENCH fries" lol I dont even have an accent unlike her. Food is great but service sucks. Maybe I'll order for pick up next time.

U7TixQWe_vuQu350mr3M7w.text: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED.   My first order here was perfect, large portion, fresh, full of flavor.  My second order, slightly less than the first in all aspects. The following 7 orders, each worse in portion size, they consistently burnt my pita, and I mean BURNED BLACK on most of the pita, along with burning the already dry chicken.   I really thought I found something special when I stumbled upon this place. But they have continued to disappoint with each order I place and I refuse to keep consistently spending my money on a place that doesn't consistently put out good food.   Also, extremely upset with how management talks to their customers when said customer is voicing concerns over quality of food and timeliness.   I was spending 20$ 3x a week here for the past 3 weeks. But I'm so done with this place. Taking my money elsewhere, where my consistent business will be appreciated!

zQ2nGTooad9ww_ifPU2Zgg.text: So glad I discovered this place, tucked away in a mall on the NW corner of Decatur and Flamingo. It's sort of near the supermarket.   A really great menu with lots of items and all of the classic Greek dishes, including avgolemono, one of my fave soups with chicken, lemon, and rice. Prices are very reasonable, especially considering that the food quality is good and everything I've had so far is tasty. The dining room is open and spacious--easy for large or small parties.  I definitely recommend this place. It's not for upscale dining, but it fulfills the need for a good neighborhood spot. And it's suitable for different eating types--vegetarian, keto, etc.

xsxkAwJYoOa6OTwQjPyxQg.text: Authentic Greek food. The food is reasonably priced and so good. I come here every time I visit Vegas.

VjD2tvivp3gttqcuYDS7cA.text: Excellent, low prices , very bright & clean. Although seems like always just 1 cook in the kitchen and 1 waiter out on the floor, your food will take a lil time and arrive staggered if you have a large part of 4 or more . Luv it though

CpdXwbI9DddJH5TvbCn3Aw.text: Authentic, delicious, real food. So glad we found this place. My go to on Sundays when I don't feel like cooking. Homemade food, I like, that I didn't have to cook

zJTSSymg_TDe9TAn8_OIDw.text: Service is almost always bad. But the food is worth it.  Can't stand the plastic table cloths. It's like they don't Trust me. Plus they are always sticky

4XprzDhHl5gUoZAt7ebNbg.text: We ordered dinner through Grubhub a couple of times recently and The Fat Greek food we ordered was outstanding. I ordered a Greek salad with grilled chicken, some falafel and pitas. The dressing  on the salad was perfect and everything tasted fresh. The grilled chicken is seasoned and has great flavor.

bquZuy3PcGupr_Qgi-VArQ.text: The food was excellent, and the wait was not long for take away.  I had the fat gyro, and a Greek salad.  Portions are good sized.  Customer service was also great!

fro9YJZKIU2SaediZK9lYQ.text: Recently took out- of-towner friends to the Fat Greek on a weeknight because the wanted lamb & it was reasonably close to their hotel and the Yelp reviews seemed really good.  Although there was only one very busy woman taking care of the front of the house, we were amazed at the fabulous food and service provided.  The lamb dishes, shank & kabobs, were cooked to perfection, flavors were delicious and spot on for the rice and grilled vegetables provided with the meals.  The hummus & feta were the best I've ever had, and the wine was delish with the lamb.  Definitely will be repeat customer as long as they continue to match the flavorful consistency we experienced. Well deserved 5 stars for the flavorful mouth explosions we all experienced.

9CbAlWSUrBxAuEZ15vrOmg.text: The front and inside of the restaurant make you a little hesitant to walk in and try it out but the food itself is very good. I got the shawarma gyro and the meat was tender and full of flavor. Everything I ate here was great and I would recommend for people to try it out when they're in the area.

Iq65SoT56v-dStNqCc2JMw.text: Ordered the app sampler- you got to pick 4 and the fat Greek gyro...   lots of tasty layers, garlic, lemony, etc...  Cute and authentic sit down restaurant. Service was a little rough around the edges but the food was delicious!!!  I'm still giving it 5, cause the dips were that good!  Looks like a family owned business. I live on the other side of town, but will definitely be back!

A8q8-ZbElbJRbcSJz0-aNA.text: Always love this place. The food is consistent every time. We don't live on this side of town but my kids sure remember it from when we did and require me to drive out there for their gyros and chicken lemon soup.

GlL3Kv4aZZzDFZcGLr0aNg.text: The Fat Greek is something I like to call a hidden Mediterranean gem! Its always the best of places that are located in weird setups like shopping centers or even behind random buildings or plazas.   The Fat Greek is no different! I've been here several times and I could just kick myself for never doing a review! Most recently my co-worker and I were out on a business appointment and couldn't decide on where to go for lunch. I was in the mood for some Mediterranean type of food but a dish that would be light at the same time. Craving a salad of some sort I couldn't put my finger on exactly the type I wanted though. Based off the area we were already in The Fat Greek popped into mind and we both said "YES!!! I Love that place" (At the same time).  Around lunch time I was expecting for them to be busy especially based off the amount of cars that were outside. These people must've been at the grocery store or some of the other places inside of the shopping center because when we walked in there were a fair amount of people but definitely way less than what we had anticipated! Once we arrived, we were greeted immediately by a couple of the employees and seated right away! Talk about a SCORE! So what was for lunch?  Appetizer-  Two of The Avgolemono Soups: Chicken, with Lemon and Rice  Lunch-  Two of the Fat Greek Salads w/ Grilled Chicken: Crisp Romaine Heart, Tomatoes, Cucumbers, Crumbled Feta, Red onion and Kalamata Olives  Overall lunch was super delicious and the service was great! I have to stop forgetting about this place and visit a lot more often. I forgot exactly how good they are and how fast the service is when you want to grab a quick bite to eat on a lunch break.

Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tF-MGwnFYiFKLUX3WcrW1g.text: I have eaten my fair share of falafel but this place has the BEST I've ever eaten. Crispy and so savory, and they toast the pita just right. Can't wait to go back and try something else :)

mEAPgOTjblNHuFru2t2nBg.text: Please don't support this place! Worst service ever!! The Owner answers the phone saying... 'what did you want?' Incredibly rude tone and didn't even try to help me. I simply wanted to let them know the website shows fries beside the sandwich, not in the combo or mentioning a combo, nothing saying sandwich only. Instead of trying to listen he said it common since it doesn't come with fries. He refused to remove the tip!! Refused to refund the tip even and basically calls me stupid! Wow the owner!!!   Now to the food. Gross!! Some meat is cold some hot, some is chewy some is soft. I asked for easy sauce and got way too much. The cheese is just splattered on top, the back half had most of the cheese so you need to spread and rewrap them.   The soup was mostly water!!!! No chunks, just very minimal shreds of chicken. Decent flavor but bad value.   2 star on food but the owner made it a 0 star experience. He was the rudest thief I've ever spoke with. Never again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The spendy bowl of soup is so watery and only half full!? The owner pulls ever corner he can to make a buck. Sad
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I asked for easy sauce and got a lot still so maybe on the side is what I should request.

UB0u_1bsy6lt64J-vWT_oA.text: For our recent Vegas trip, we decided to focus more on food than anything else. We love Greek food, so we decided to hop on Yelp to try a restaurant out. The Fat Greek was the main one to catch our attention. Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted and sat at a table quickly. We went around dinnertime during a weeknight, so the place wasn't too packed. But, apparently when you dine there for dinner, the pita bread and what ever that other amazing bread was called is complimentary. And just like any other, well I should say most, Greek restaurants that I've been to, we were given large portions for our meals. The food was delicious and our waitress was very attentive to our needs. I feel like the food was decently priced and you definitely get what you pay for. I highly recommend to try this place out if you want to avoid the high food prices from restaurants on the strip and/or if you're hungry and want amazing Greek food!  5/5 from me for the food and amazing service!

Rfj9yLDltBLL4IIOD40gKA.text: My husband and I tried this place out because it smelled great as we walked out of the grocery store. it was around lunch time and they were pretty busy  The food was amazing!! Only down side is it took a while for our food to come but everything was really fresh and hot

iQAz6h-Cqnxwf3ktW_QylQ.text: Had dinner there last night. I had the gyro and Athenian fries. Everything was amazing. Even my picky 2 year old loved it. Best Greek food I've had in quite awhile.

YYWE9nbEyGgfmeqQyxgdlg.text: Came in for lunch and was seated quickly. I ordered the beef / lamb Gyro with salad and a beverage.    My food arrived quickly and my Gyro lamb & beef meat tasted on the dry side and the pita was overcooked to crunchy - but edible. My salad was fresh and I finished both items.   On a side note I used the restroom and it was spotless clean as is the dinning room.
