2zu6lo4ngRWfX_oyfBo8CQ.text: I love eating at this place because it's quick and delicious.  We order from the restaurant at least once a week for work.  Their gyros are so yummy and generous. I would suggest trying everything!

JEoMR2S_kt9sQk_ejn1z9A.text: Best Greek in town. Their gyros have blown the heads off every other place in town. I wish this was available 24/7. I crave it every single day of my waking life. They are literally perfect in every single way. Took me 10 years to find the best gyro in Vegas.

wSU2V4NYnfalG7EICpAyQg.text: I debating waiting to post a review for The Fat Greek, mostly because I have only gotten take out orders and service typically factors heavily into how I rate a business.  (and I have heard from friends that service here isn't the greatest when eating in... )   After a handful of visits, which I was helped by the same sweet lady each time, I feel comfortable giving The Fat Greek 4 stars. The Fat Greek is in the shopping plaza on Flamingo and Decatur, near the grocery store. I have been to that plaza dozens of times before I noticed The Fat Greek, it's a bit hidden where it's located.   A quick rundown of what I had had:  The Fat Gyro - So fat, it was multiple meals. They do not skimp on the meat, and the veggies are super fresh.   The Fat Salad -With chicken added (at an extra cost) this was also a huge portion that I was unable to finish in one sitting.  Souvlaki - Chicken, lamb or beef kabobs served with rice or fries. The beef, cooked medium rare, are delicious.   The hummus and pita bread here are solid choices, not the best in town in my opinion but close!   For takeout, I highly recommend calling your order in.

OySL2JOZZXg-kPif6Gdb7A.text: so DELISH!! literally everything is so yummy, i get the fat greek gyro, and Athenian fries, and i always get hummus and extra pita for an appetizer. You wont be disappointed, i love this place! Im so full!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek gyro, and make sure u ask for Athenian fries, they are so bomb!

nH0dwkdYC8aGpRNMwgiAXA.text: Probably the best greek salad in town BY FAR. I have yet to try other things but I'm sure they're great too. Love their greek salads with chicken mmm mm good.

xHmoVEFyxioZsE9Ml_g10Q.text: First time eating Greek food and it was average overall experience.  It didn't leave a "wow" factor or wanting for me to come back anytime soon.  Some of the food was good, some is average so order with care. The service was good and food arrived in a timely manner and was well priced.

BG34Cmhkht7aL5Z5LRrLWg.text: Great food great employees! Their delivery company is top notch as well Www.Onlinerestaurants.com

C96qN4Obimk56pHADheANw.text: I'm not one to write reviews normally but I feel this is needed.   I've been coming here since my dad and I ate here a few years ago. However, the last few times I've ordered food to go from here it's been disappointing. Normally it was always good. Yes I've always had to wait a little bit even when I called before I would pick it up. Now they tell me it's going to be ready in 10 min and every time we've ordered I've asked for them to not put the pepper things in our to go boxes because we don't eat them and they've put them in there. This last time they even put 2 when I reminded him I didn't want them and they could save them for someone else. We order just the gyro combos that come with fries and a drink and these past few times they just haven't tasted the same or as good as before.   Not sure if they got new owners but it's unfortunate because we really did enjoy the food. We'll be looking for a new place to get Gyros from.

qUzHea5aiaMB8selQ7UKlQ.text: We love this place not only b/c of its delicious food but the nice staff! I don't remember everyone's name but it is always a welcoming feeling when you walk in! The place is very casual nothing fancy and our favorite is the avoglemono (lemon rice) soup!! The falafel is excellently made and the service is very quick even if the place is full. Everything is fresh and we always make a point to come when we are near this side of town! Please don't ever change!! Great food, excellent service!

IXnF3jkoKQICeYY-VwvNPg.text: Las Vegas Yelpers!!!  Thanks so much for the reviews! I recently moved to 702 and I wanted to see where I could find a yummy greek spot! After doing a quick search on yelp... The Fat Greek was on my hit list!  I'm a huge gyro fan and after eating at Papa Cristos in LA numerous times over the past 2 years... I was hoping to find a spot in Vegas that could fill my void of having Papa Cristos withdraws.  Came here on Valentine's Day for lunch with my friend visiting town from San Diego. We both ordered the Fat Greek gyro (lamb/beef)... be prepared to get messy! I had feta cheese and talziki sauce on my face the whole time! gyros are super messy! haha.  I'm a huge fan of their fat greek gyro!!! love the feta cheese :)) pita bread and lamb/beef were on point. Super huge... you can split it with someone if you're no that hungry!  I will be back when I'm craving for a gyro!  Indoor/outdoor seating (no wait). casual dining (love the classic bright blue and white theme). private parking lot (no problems with parking). Decent prices.  If you're a Vegas local or visiting... and hungry for greek... stop by The Fat Greek!  -Miss Yelp 2011

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CC5YOgIOYLCuVWuWSzQnrw.text: I have a 6th sense. When one of my girlfriends are pregnant, I get the cravings... long before they even disclose their little secret! So girls, whoever you are - SPILL!!! I've been craving Greek lately, and when I say "crave," I mean I want it every meal and every snack of everyday. And this has been my life for the past three weeks. So, while on a business trip to Vegas I turned to YELP to feed my addictions. (Food.)   Such an unassuming place in an off strip shopping center. I was a little hesitant when I walked in and only 1/4 of the tables were taken... but I was hungry, and I have a lot of faith in yelpers. =)  End result - HAPPY TUMMY. Really happy tummy. It's a mom n pop type joint, with all the home cooking "made with love" flavors. Here's the rundown:  Hummus: Homemade, and awesome. So many times hummus comes out runny, oily, or slightly gritty. Not here - it has the perfect consistency, taste on point, and made my taste buds sing. Maybe even RAP a bit, that's how good it was. ha ha.  Chicken Lemon Soup: I have nothing to compare this to, never had it before... but boy was it good. You would think I haven't eaten in weeks the way I slurped it down. In all honesty, I think I slurped it a little too loud.  Beef Gyro: So good I didn't speak. Not one word. I didn't put it down for a good 5 bites.   Greek Salad: Good, but didn't blow my mind. I added chicken, and was pleased with the portion size!  Falafel: Soooooo glad this wasn't the greasy mess I'm used to. Great infused flavors, crispy on the outside, perfect on the inside!  Baklava: Good sized portion, but not the best I've had...  Ready for the star of the show?  Chocolate Marble Truffle Cake: I have no words. None. Order it, eat it, and then get one to go. Period. You're welcome.  Needless to say, I'll be coming back!

F2qB7Tf2mHebs9Sr33QX8A.text: Removing 2 Stars.....1 for spotty service from the Greek waiter. Homeboy acted like he had a BIG stick up his behind... no customer service skills at all.  We shared the Avgolemono(Egg and Lemon Soup with chicken and rice) good flavor, came with warm pita bread, so far so good.  wifey orders a Chicken Gyro, I go with the Chicken Shawerma, and we both share the Athenian Fries. Fries were good, But I still prefer Greek Bistro's Greek Fries seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, and Zatar, served with a yogurt dip.  Both the Gyro and Shawerma  were made with chicken breast that was definitely grilled and sliced WAY AHEAD OF TIME, and was borderline room temp./cold( probably from lunch), and our pita bread was cold and tough! The pita that came with our soup was hotter! For dessert, the nice waitress (who got my to-go order in my first review) was much more informative about the menu and very personable. We get the Baklava and the Bugacha.(Greek puff pastry dessert filled with vanilla(or chocolate )pastry cream. Baklava was overly sweet, but the bugacha was crisp, warm, and not too sweet. Decent ending to our pretty disappointing meal. Bad first impression for the wifey and I felt worse after "hyping" this place up after my first visit. Hard to say if we'll be back...ALOHA!!!

I love Greek food  and Fat Geek food is amazing , but when we start talking about Delivery service ...one of the worst in Vegas .  I'm ordering from Fat Greek every week ....more than year already .... everytime is my last time :-) but keep ordering .... i guess this is going to be my last time now just because every time the food is late and the drivers are horrible... way far from professional , most of them can't answer simple question - no English ...funny and few times very very dirty ! MaXyCoThqyCWWvP68NvZVQ.text: If you say I ate like happy like a Fat Greek ! Would I be insensitive?   Maybe? But I ate like a fat Greek today. I had a bit of the fries and a Giro sandwich. The giro was Fat Greek certified (bigger that my hand, and I have big hands) super yums, lots of meat, and tasty feta. The fries we're perfectly seasoning and had lots of cheese, you can't beat that combination.   It's nice finding a stablished casual restaurant. Specially one that allows you to bring your loose pants! :) You too can be a Fat Greek. It's Ok  it's in the name.

Su5hoC4wDnxzVO32xLcrfw.text: Service from the lone server was 5 stars. He was impressive as the only one working the floor with 5+ tables, phone orders, and to go orders.   Shame on the owner/manager who's greeting to us was "Sit anywhere" and disappeared when it got busy for his server.  The food was plentiful and delicious. I would return for the food and good service but I will not make this a regular place simply because I do not like when companies do not treat their employees well. This is my perception and I might be wrong, but appearance is totally in the control of the business.  No simple black iced tea lost me on beverages but the water was actually filtered and tasted good!

RBDIMAq_yvjNPm8xyniH3Q.text: I walked in and I was expecting to be served a little quicker.... But I was paitent because there was only one server. I decided on the Greek Side Salad with a  small side of gyro meat. Wow - that was a real surprise . Super delicious. Then for the entree Lamb Shish Kabob - mercy that was delicious. Highly, highly recommend. Be paitent if their busy - it's worth the wait. Very ample portions as well.

HNJcr3rQlrXTvzDHc3zCog.text: Gyros the way they should be.... deconstructed with all the accoutrements and loads of that tender, savory, delicious gyro meat.   When you order the gyro plate, you get Greek potatoes and a Greek salad to go with.  Let's start with the Greek salad... house maid lemon vinaigrette simple and easy, but delicious with crisp cucumbers throughout and fresh juicy tomatoes.  That bite of feta finishes the salad off with just the right amount of creaminess.  Now for the Greek potatoes... served piping hot!  Three huge wedges perfectly fried and perfectly seasoned.  I love this place and I will be back!  Oh extra... if you love spinach as much as I do, try the spanikopita!  Delicious spinach, garlic, spices and cheese between the most delicate, wonderfully tasty, tender layers of phyllo and a little crunchy on top... yum

7XyW25zauRsmgTH3gLd-lw.text: Yum yum yum! Found on Yelp. Was a bit underwhelmed that the restaurant was in a strip mall but the restaurant was clean and spacious. My waiter Joaquin was patient, Friendly and attentive. Had spanakopita that was delicious. Greek salad,could have had more chunky feta and I would have like some pepperoncini peppers.  Had the saganaki'  and was tasty but sadly was not flambeed. Fire code violation?  I had the pork chops--totally blew my mind delicious! I absolutely reccomend and will no doubt be back for it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mind blowing Greek pork chops (the sauce I could bathe in!) lemon potatoes, roasted vegetables. Greek beer.

QgEeLuCLs6MZ64W0RxUa5Q.text: The Fat Greek is nestled in a strip mall so look for the power blue signage so you don't miss it.  We were hoping to sit outside since there's a patio, but after a quick glance at the state of the patio I could guess that it wasn't a viable option!  The inside could use a little sprucing up, but it's not all that bad. The menu has traditional Greek options and "safe" options for those who aren't a fan of traditional Greek cuisine.  I ordered the Fat Greek gyro and I was more than pleased with the abundance of the lamb/beef meat combo and flavor.  The gyro was well dressed with fresh lettuce, tomato, and tangy tzatziki sauce.  It comes with a plate of fresh, crispy fries too.  I'll definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X24S6AmmK5Wu46UWnO76BA.text: Yum!  Had a hankering for some greek food and this hit the freaking spot.   Since romaine is safe again I decided to get a salad and spanakpita.   The house Greek side salad was generously portioned and covered in feta. Yum!!   The spanokpita was flaky, cheesy and savory. I recommend this to anyone who comes here. Such a solid appetizer that would also make a kick aas breakfast item. Seriously try it.  My partner got a chicken shwarma pita with hummus. That was awesome and generously portioned also.  I'll be back to try more here. This place is a gem.   The inside is the colors of the Greek flag and it's beautiful. The prices are reasonable especially for the portions.

There was one waitress for the entire restaurant- and despite rushing around to help everyone, she kept a smile on her face and an upbeat attitude. The experience was pleasant due to the wonderful waitress. The food was- "meh".

AUUAqVnkT30jpgKgEeCSkg.text: Good food. Good price . The avgolemeno soup may be a little over seasoned for some but was still very good . Gyro was good and the satziki sauce was mild . The back kitchen cook and one of the servers shared too much info and personal conversations that could clearly and loudly be heard in the dining area. Also puzzling why the big screen tv in the dining area is tuned to the food channel. I began watching and wondering why I wasn't going to a different restaurant to eat the food that I was watching on tv instead of what I had available at this restaurant.  Summary - good food good price - update the seating and cut back on the loud kitchen conversation.

Ox2Y8_pq_2rM16oA5_swtg.text: Excellent meal. Baby lamb chops med rare with delicious lemon herb potatoes, grilled veggies & pita bread plus a Greek salad for starters. Wonderful lamb. I haven't had lamb besides the Gyro in years. Although I do cook them at home with mint jelly. This was our second time here & we will continue to return for excellent Greek food.   11/05/18  Here we are again. Gyro sandwich, shared feta fries iced water. It's Monday only another couple. A very healthy portion, and I'm a big dude. Very clean, excellent service, and one of my favorite things in a restaurant an open kitchen so I can see my food being prepared. Fkdt-gCEpm1IVc-YH8qX4A.text: i had a good time eating here for lunch... i had the beef souvlaki that was a 3.5.. the baby octopus tho? 5 easy.. they didnt have a full order, so they just hooked it up with whatever they had available.. i could easily do 2 orders...

j6nRq_4YglurZdwLehG1BA.text: Love it! My favorite thing is whenever I'm in a bind for a potluck, I run over to these guys and grab two or three of their gyro salads. They're always a huge hit! Their homemade hummus is TO DIE FOR, and their steaks and lamb chops are always seasoned/cooked to perfection. It can be either very reasonable, or a little pricey, depending on what you order, but always worth it. The atmosphere is great... I've never been to Greece, but I totally felt like I was transported.

S9cjP2RKXHGyd-60008dwQ.text: So. This is the next best thing to my mommy's home cooking [which is currently 500+mi away :(]. Souflaki (lamb shish kabob) was soooo good! They cooked it exactly how I asked. The fries that come with it would super good for some reason...pretty sure fries aren't a Greek specialty haha. Tiropitas (cheese pies) were pretty good. Nothing to write home about, but I'm too lazy to cook I'll definitely pop in here for a couple orders! Service was good. Casual dining but good food and reasonable prices.

epEaf_u9EO03PwrcaqXK1g.text: Nice Place! Good service (they were extremely patient with us and our baby). We had the Lavash wrap and the Falafel wrap and both of them were good & fresh tasting. The falafels were good, but not great. The fries were the best. We would surely visit again.

fCcYrlAOVmLVfWuoRgXsBw.text: Love this place.  It's got great authentic Greek food.  Best in Vegas.

ni_wG0uXCEj8khfKDN_2mw.text: We were in Vegas for a convention.  Yelped good Greek and came up with the Fat  Greek.  We decided to go there for dinner.  The outside did not look too welcoming but we went in anyway.  We are glad we did.   There were 5 of us including children.  We were hungry so we started with the hummus.  Delicious.  Could always have more pita.   3 of us ordered the Gyros plate.  We should have only ordered 2 because there was so much food!!!!   The avlogmeno (?) soup was Real, not chicken condensed soup with shredded chicken, rice and lemon.  This was the Real Thing and it was delicious!   The salads that came with the plates were huge and very good.  The homemade dressing was not overly spiced with oregano like some places make.  It had multi lettuce, tomato, cucumbers, and feta.  It was really good.   My husband, being very hungry when we ordered, ordered the Pork Chop.  OMG!!  It was, by far, the most delicious pork chop we have ever eaten.  Perfectly spiced and cooked to perfection.  The potatoes and vegetables that came with it were just as good.   They do need to employ more help.  Our waiter was practically running the whole time, so management, listen up!  Hire a buser.

2L5Aw7EDiuOxv7Ew4aJSjw.text: been to the fat greek several times, most recently for din din tonite with the gf.  ordered the usual starters - hummus and stuffed grape leaves - enjoyed both.   gf went with the standard gyro, i tried the lamb shanks with orzo.  total price with drinks $35.  unfortunately, due to time constraints, after the apps and the soup that came with my dinner, we had to take the rest to go.  btw - the soup, a chicken and rice with dill and a little citrus-y tang was delicious !  after dropping the gf off at work, made it home for the shanks - 2 huge chunks of lamb and a big 'ol pile of orzo.  the lamb meat - tender and plenty of meat on dem bones !!  only prob - didn't  have anything to scoop out the gold in them thar shanks - actually used a toothpick !  surprised to see a little italian cafe next to FAt Greek - one more place to try !  happy eating !

6zjD-J32Do1Lt5nge1x2oA.text: Everything Was Absolutely Perfect! Our server, Radoslav, was polite, informative, and funny. The food was phenomenal, and the atmosphere was relaxing and comfortable.

Zi6CTLOiuDg5gMjgjv1-Cg.text: Our new "go to" Medi place. The service was great. My sig has a food allergy and the chef came out to discuss it with him. Everything was fresh, well prepared and high quality. Usually I find Greek food to be too greasy but not here. Highly recommend.

F0g46RFI2Tjm1oBqfJRKoQ.text: Yelp to the rescue, once again!!  This place is an AWESOME off-the-strip find.  High quality, delicious food for really reasonable (almost cheap) prices.  We went in the afternoon and it wasn't busy at all, so we had excellent service.  It's in a strip mall, but nicely decorated in the standard blue and white Greek style.  A huge menu, lots of options and you get sides with most of the dishes (a plus for me).  I had the flatbread sandwich with veggies, feta, and tzatziki, and my pal had the gyros and fries.  Everything was flavorful and delicious.  I wish we had a Greek place this cheap and good in LA!

hN3s_OZH3O9tPY9E4BcD4g.text: Great place, reasonably priced the food was really good everything was fresh and the restaurant was spotless.

fKsZfxPf5bLVH-_k7Ygm7g.text: I was hungry for Greek food, and thank goodness for Yelp or I would never have known about this place. Pleasant, soothing atmosphere. Best Tsaziki EVER!!! Nice big portion, took some home, just as good the next day- waitress said they add a drop of ouzo. Whatever- we LOVED it! Saganaki was a little disappointing- nice flavor, but it was not served flaming and the cheese needs to bubble or it's just not right. Greek salad, chicken skewers and moussaka were great. Service was kind of funny- 3 different people waited on us. All were friendly enough, but they didn't bring the salad (got it to go_, didn't refill drinks without frantic waving, and took forever wiht the check. This place is small, and it wasn't crowded- shouldn't have been so hard to get their attention- they were all standing a few feet away chatting. Regardless, we will be back!

f8RLPTRcBEdPNt3RwSFtrw.text: The service was surly. So, then the food. Just OK. Nothing special. The calamari was overly-breaded. It was all I could taste, even after drenching with lemon. The Gyro meat was sliced carelessly, leading to an inconsistent texture. It wasn't terrible, but this isn't a place where I would return for more. I ate and then felt dismayed at the fact that I had eaten sub-standard food.

jTinESmLa-cVay6KJWhIoQ.text: We had a group of 3. Leisurely start for service since one waitress and many tables, but good we it started. Great food, not disappointed with the lamb. House salad surprising good. Good baklava. Pleasant greek  decor  our fan list.

6M7S-_YTdreAYtw26G9HBA.text: This is my first yelp review. We went to The Fat Greek, based on the yelp reviews, and were not disappointed. This is a small restaurant in a strip mall.  The food was very tasty and reasonably priced. Large portions served by a charming staff.  Bright and clean is the best way to describe the ambiance. This is the best Greek food I've eaten in Vegas.

YzAxbrmK3prpqVH1dCizjw.text: This place has the BEST Greek food in the entire city & my favorite tzatziki in the country. (Hummus Factory does have better hummus varieties... LOL)   This is my go-to takeout place when I want something not overly-processed, really delicious & quick. The food is all packaged separately, and tzatziki left on the side so it travels well. The gyro plate could not be a better deal, or lamb/beef quality. The gyro plate comes with side of soup/salad, french fries or rice, and your traditional Greek lamb/beef gyro. SO GOOD!   The Fat Greek is also a great location to dine-in (nice traditional interior), and receive great personalized service. There is a female who works here (I do not remember her name) and she truly takes the time to get to know her customers. We frequently order an extra side of gyro meat (for our dog), and she became aware of this. One day we did not order any extra gyro meat (our dog had traveled back East) and she asked if our dog was okay! She truly remembered & this meant so much to us. She has become a friendly acquaintance, and truly enjoy seeing her every-time we go there.   Besides the gyro plate with greek salad & fries (I always get), the Moussaka is traditional and cooked perfectly, and the pita bread is home-made/ always fresh. The Athenian fries are deliciously savory & the Spanakopita is never burnt/over oily. I always order two pieces of baklava, & my boyfriend loves the rice pilaf here. Truly a great place for traditional treats, and the mid-week i-do-not-want-to-cook blues. Love this place & will continue to be a frequent customer! Give it a try if you love Greek Food!

L3TasjK1d3y3oCgh6A6Qmw.text: I just love Greek food and the Fat Greek has my favorite item - the Gryo Plate.  Theirs come with a good amount of meat and we chose rice and salad.  Unlike another spot we have been too Fat Greek gives you a hearty amount of rice and salad each packed in their own container.       We also got sides of Gyro meat and the ever popular Athena Fries.  The fries were a delight and were devoured quickly.  The combination of spices and the two cheeses was so good.  The rice was very tasty and the salad was really good.  Fresh Romaine lettuce tomatoes, cucumbers and lots of feta.      I have eaten in and now taken out.  I think I prefer take out.  The dining room is basic and although clean has a tired look about it.  The lady who has taken our order isn't very friendly and lacks in her customer service skills.  I didn't take it personally and think it is just her demeanor.      So far Fat Greek is the best Greek place for Gyro's that i have found in Vegas.  In comparison to Sharma Plus you get near twice as much food for the same cost.  One thing that also stands out is the Tzatziki sauce is very good and plentiful.  A great price for a plentiful Gryo Plate.  I will definitely be back for my next Gyro fix!

VzGH89Ak_qdFnQT2VF5PDA.text: Not a good adventure.price and not taste good.first time taste greek food may be they like the food.but it is so so for me.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jnk5mh0YlJqLCWLrrVC8qg.text: There is not a whole lot of Vegetarian/Vegan restaurants that I know of that isn't too far from the strip but thanks to Yelp I was able to enjoy dinner with some buddies.  I had their Baba Ganoush and Falafel plater. I thought the food were remarkable. I wish the salad came in a little bigger portion, and besides the chick server and the boss in the back kitchen I find it hard to believe that this is 100% authentic..  Good service, good food, and reasonably priced nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good Falafel

saLDf-9I9DpCvVdcw4VcuA.text: Food was great and portions were big! Very filling and fresh tasting. Modest exterior with a Big Bang of flavor inside! :)

zlSb_qAK1LVyQpbnKTjK1w.text: Been here a few times and the food has always been great and the service top notch.  Everything tastes fresh.  I would definately recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad and bread that came with the meal, very good
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and chicken combo, excellent!
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad with chicken

-sEDK-RSOCvUgICTVn8obw.text: We have tried different places for gyros in Las Vegas and this was probably the best experience we've had! The food was phenomenal, the service was excellent, the prices were reasonable, and the environment was clean and alluring. We will be back!!

wRDmgWFX4CMeNhanzebAuA.text: Excellent food and great quality ingredients!! Prices are affordable and it wasn't salty like a lot of places.   We wanted to keep it healthy so we got the fat Greek salad plus gyro meat. So good!! We'd come here many times if we lived here. Check it out and leave a review! You won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Keeping it healthy!!

a0yDy7FryHYzwk13SYQw-g.text: I was referred to this place by a friend and I must say that I enjoyed my whole meal. I had the gyro with a side salad. The atmosphere at the time I went (4:00pm) was quiet and service was very attentive. I had ice tea and although it was made with tap water, it was still good.   So there you have it, I would recommend this place and I look forward to returning to try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro and side salad

lOvK2WWgwWDI3TEB8a2w4w.text: I wrote a review for this place back in 2012.  We are still going, we still get the family platter and it is still excellent.  I am still very happy with this place.

PWLxYdPKEBmoX3qg46uK6g.text: I have never experienced this nadir of service in my entire life.  My lady and I stepped into this restaurant with high expectations after seeing the yelp rating and reviews. We stood there awkwardly for about a minute watching people eat and look in our direction before a waiter asked us to choose any seat. Slow considering we were the only ones standing and waiting to be seated, but not so bad.  We sat down at our seats deciding what to order. For 15 MINUTES. No one came over to take even our drink order. We may as well have been invisible. Right in front of us there was another couple who had arrived just before us and had already ordered and RECEIVED THEIR FOOD.  This is beyond poor service. "We were busy" is no excuse. I have been to much busier and hectic restaurants and received prompter attention. There was no one else waiting in line before or after us and everyone else was just eating or waiting for their food.  If you want to feel like a minority before the civil rights movement, feel free to drop in for a bite. You won't be disappointed. I "wasn't".  We drove 1 mile to Thai Style Noodle House and was eating our delicious Pad Thai and Papaya Salad in less than 10 minutes.  TLDR;- Ambience - 0/5 (didn't get to experience much of it) Food - 0/5 (no food ordered) Service - 0/5 (easily my worst experience at any restaurant and I'm usually very understanding) Overall - 0/5 (yelp doesn't allow zeros unfortunately)  We walked out after 15 minutes of waiting at our table and didn't look back.

MS9AIlkUtn0eEqgDTOb_-g.text: The Fat Greek Salad with grilled chicken was awesome !  Loved it !  The waiter was very attentive and good customer service .  I recommend this place .

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek Salad with grilled chivken

h413B-E-V15N2qDUgw48Cw.text: WOW. THIS IS A MUST VISIT. There is nothing better than good meat. And this place has it down! The portion sizes are pretty big, so I had leftovers. And I'm an eater.  I got the Fat Greek Gyro (lamb/beef) and WOW. So much flavor.  Hubby got the shish kabobs (one lamb one chicken) and the meat was unbelievable.  The hummus is the bomb. And to top it off, so well priced! Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek Gyro!  and Shish Kabob plate!

NRtis4guhemheemEUXYdOQ.text: The food here was very mediocre. The nice warm bread and butter they bring to you was good. We ordered the Gyro sandwich and it was ok. Not the best I've had. The spanakopita was not what we were expecting. It had cheese on top of the pastry crust which I believe caused it to burn a little leaving a very bitter taste. If it wasn't for that I think it would have been good because the filling was tasty. The chicken souvlaki and fries were good. Overall the food was ok but gave an extra star for the service. Our waiter was very nice and attentive.

Gw52xywKqm4ZvPt7P8BpcA.text: I used to frequency this place many years ago when it was owned by the "fat Greek"...the food used to be on point and so was the service.  Not anymore. I went several months ago at 8pm, they close at 9 and I was told that the kitchen was already closed and they refused to serve me, even for take out. I had just gotten back into town and was starving and wanted a delicious Greek meal that I craved for so many months away. NOPE!  So anyway, decided to give it another shot. Bad idea. It was empty but service was still slow, no authentic Greek music playing anymore and the food was terrible. I ordered the saganaki, it came to the table COLD and without any lemon and it is also a different type of cheese. Then for the entree, the gyro was SO dry, I wasn't even able to choke it all down. The plate didnt even come with tzatziki, which is a traditional accompaniment to gyro. Then when I asked the server for it, he had no idea what it was (Hispanic server). Then a few minutes later a cook came from the back and gave me a mean face.  I'll never go back here again...there's a reason why they're totally empty on a Saturday night.

K1sjiIRGM5UkAKVi6Zj21g.text: Awesome customer service. Very clean. Very nice to my daughter. Food was outstanding. We got  the  1. Fat Greek Gryo  2. Hummus  3. Shawerma   It was rich with flavor good texture.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daughter loved everything
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My man loved his food
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hummus was perfect

ZHt10GFS2o4U3rAtzkqZhg.text: I love Greece and love everything that has a connection with this country and their culture, their dances and especially their food.... THE FAT GREEK!!! What can I say? This is a real Greek restaurant that serves tasty food.The atmosphere is really Greek. Last time I came here for an early dinner and was surprised ,because the restaurant was empty, but some time later the place filled up. You can have delicious gyros, an amazing hummus, authentic Greek salad, great homemade lemonade here. The food is fresh, tasty and best of all reasonably priced. The service is pretty good and the food arrives in time.

NUH-7Z8ulJ5_2llWkzBgsQ.text: I ordered the chicken greek salad and it was amazing!! Loved it!! It had lots of chicken and veg, I want another one!!

ydNGn23H6tuGpgI2arIGsg.text: This is the best Greek restaurant in Las Vegas I've had so far. The location is only strange until you walk in the restaurant. The prices are great and the food is incredible.   Pros: Grilled octopus - perfectly marinated with olive oil, lemon and parsley.  Gyros plate - large portion of tender shaved gyro meat, pita, tomato, tzatziki  sauce, fresh onions and side dish of fries. Baba ganoush appetizer Avgolemono soup - Chicken, lemon and rice "Fat Greek Salad" - fresh lettuce, tomatoes, onions and the best feta cheese.  Cons: There is only one waiter and it can seem like he's ignoring you. He's just busy doing everything.

7qeqgy-A4jFsw6TqMbXhAA.text: The fat Greek gyro is the best! If you come for lunch you can make it into a combo for a bit more to get a drink and a side with it. We love the gyro with a side of Athenian fries or Greek salad with it! It's a really huge sandwich but doesn't feel so heavy. It's packed with meat and veggies so it's nice and refreshing. The pita bread is soo soft! My husband has tried the Greek burger and it was good as well, reminded us of a chorizo burger lol my sister tried the beef kabob platter and the meat was delicious and tender. The service has been nice every time we've come here. They're very polite and friendly. We have yet to try the desserts because the entrees are so big we never have enough room!

xdTsCkeIorVYKf7z0RZHpw.text: This is one of our go-to restaurants in the area, the food is always good and fresh, the gyros are amazing but my new usual is the souvlaki, the chicken is moist and flavorful. I get it with the Greek rice which complements it really well. We come here at least once a week, the staff is nice and friendly. Love this place!

Z1_Ff7L8J2IIw9_a2uJj9Q.text: This was our first vist.  Our first impression; restaurant was very clean and tastefully decorated!  They brought warm pita bread, which was very good. I ordered the Pasticcio, which was baked pasta with a bechamel sauce and red sauce.  It was similar to lasagna with a slight kick.  I found it very flavorful.  The cheese was creamy. My partner ordered the gyro plate.  The strips of beef had nice flavor and was very tender.  The sauce was tasty. Bother portions were large.  We had plenty left over for lunch the next day. Other menu items looks good as well.  We will be back!

pdJiGFJC5wFJAs48lXB04g.text: I dont think I am every going back again to this place. We walked in around 5:30 PM and the restaurant wasn't packed that much - they had may be 3-4 tables with customers.   But still their service was horrible. We sat down and had to wait literally for about 15-20 mins for the waiter to drop by. Our food took about 30 mins+ to get delivered to our table. It seems like there is only 1 person waiting the tables - instead of waiting for the waiter to come, we decided to walk upto the counter and pay our check. But the owner told us that you have to wait for that 1 person who is also serving others. I couldn't believe it - as a owner, you should be able to do the job yourself and not rely on the hired help so much. Anyhow, we wasted our time and money for a less than mediocre experience.

etI2ndpxloJYpkar4KeWbA.text: Wanted something different for dinner last night.  Read some good things about their food so drop in for some take out.  The restaurant was bright and clean.  There were two occupied tables and a small group of people standing close to the tables.  There was a gentleman standing in front of the counter waiting to be helped.  There was a worker behind the counter talking on the phone, and another worker standing next to him. I was not acknowledge by anybody in the restaurant, matter of fact, the person on the phone turned his back to us and continued to talk on the phone.  The other worker walk out from behind the counter and walked over to the occupied tables and had a conversation there, then returned to the counter, still no acknowledgement of our presence. After waiting 5 minutes, I walked out. I am sure their food is delicious since the reviews were good.  Unfortunately, I will never know.

UvjUEZEU5JkmPl9R8-v-NA.text: Waited over 30 minutes for a simple pasta salad and a gyro. Filled up on the complimentary bread which was the only good thing. Sad that the bread and butter was the highlight of my evening. Decided to get my order to go and once I got home the portions were just pretty sad..A child could easily eat that! Payed 30 dollars for a mediocre experience and food. Will not be coming back. Papa Cristos in LA all the way!!!!

smmm8_XcVCl5ZV3W6nzNjA.text: I really love the food here. I tried the beef/lamb gyro with the Athenian fries for lunch. Soo good! For dinner I tried the gryo plate (huge portions in my opinion) , the hummus (super silky smooth, best I've ever had), and grilled octopus. The atmosphere is very clean and friendly. Next thing going to try is some dessert!

fJOEBUgdgwOoFDyjI188EQ.text: We were looking for a mid afternoon "late lunch" we could pickup and bring home to eat with our own wine, and we struck gold with the Fat Greek.   I had a rare and sudden craving for Greek food and but have no experience with nearby Greek restaurants.  Found them on yelp, looked at the solid 4 star rating and ordered by phone from their online menu without ever reading a review. I picked it up 15 minutes later.  I barely had to wait at all as the order was just being packed up as I arrived.  We got the small Fat Greek Salad.. (not small and very good) a order of Tabouli that was delicious, and split a skewer each of marinated chicken/beef Souvlaki, that was very tasty.  I order a Pita and Hummus side and then when picking the order up added in a Tiramisu desert.  The Tiramisu was a nice surprise! My wife who is European thought it was a bit too sweet, but I, being very American, thought it was perfect! :-)  We will definitely eat there in the future.  The restaurant itself, being mid-afternoon had nice window lighting and was bright and cheery in blues and whites and looked spotless.  They have an outside patio and are in the corner of the center, easy parking. The dessert selection (a weakness I admit) looked great, and we really enjoyed our afternoon meal at home with some great Greek food

KlFrkwIBaG8a5DYUciMm0A.text: If you are tired of overpriced food on the strip, this is definitely the restaurant to come to.  It's a 5 minute taxi ride from the strip.  And you can stop by Food 4 Less next door and stock up on snacks and drinks.  The restaurant itself is very clean and has a nice ambiance.  The food is excellent and very reasonably priced. I've been there twice.  The first time I had the greek salad with grilled chicken and the second time I had the gyro plate, which is a ton of food.  All of it great.  Definitely recommend this restaurant for a chance of pace from Strip food.

pgd-VK0I2BVO-kXrveOLeA.text: Very excellent food . Great place to come down and enjoy a great lunch better than you're traditional burger, or half ass slapped on subway . Best gyros I've tasted in a while , top quality of chicken used in they're chicken salads as to many other dishes . Pastas are to die for . Over all great food, good service, clean place.

RnR5m-YpZao7JuR59eL7Tw.text: I have been here often. it is usually a delighful little break during the day for lunch and a couple of times I have ventured over to take part in an evening meal.  After my experience tonight I will not be back. My father, in from out of town, my boyfriend and I sat and watched as every table in the place recieved their orders....we waited and waited and waited.   Our glasses ran dry, our bread all gone, and still no entree. At 1 hour 10 min wait we walked to the register asked for our check for our drinks and tried to leave. At that time the server argued with us then....then the manger came out to tell us we were wrong and had only been waiting 50 min. As much as the food is ok....the service is/was awful!

c8y2wqh27qJkz2DcyoazHQ.text: Best part:  authentic and delicious dishes you won't find at crappy Greek food chains!  The Place- ...will make you wonder if you're in the wrong place.  Run-down strip mall, corner-deli-style building.  But the FOOD will make you forget all about this. :)  The Service-  Authentic Greek!  Sweet.   Um... but... there was only one server, and once the lunch rush started we were kind of ignored.  He was very patient and explained all the foreign-sounding dishes to us, though.  The Food- Awww yeah.  Reasonably priced enough that I could justify ordering one of pretty much everything:   --Tzatziki (yogurt + cucumber) was fresh and delicious --Baba ganoush and hummus were also right on par --Tirokefteri (new to me: creamy cheese spread with spice) was delicious! --Saganaki- salty fried cheese, went well with the milder baba ganoush/ hummus...but *very salty on its own* --The soups were good, but I'm meh about soups --The lamb gyro was delicious!!  Gamey and cooked just right, with a great combo of flavors.. With all the soft fresh pitas we ate as appetizers, I didn't really have much of an appetite left (should've ordered the lamb souvlaki/skewers) but I ate the gyro afterwards, cold, and it was still FANTASTIC.  Take that how you will.  GO!  For a great meal in Vegas at a GREAT price, this is IT.

ByzAEnaZmMHaBB5LOS-biw.text: This place is really good the food is amazing and the staff for the most part is very nice but I will say there is one female cashier that's a royal bitch she has so much attitude.  I would love to give this place five stars but until they find some competent nice help it's going to happen.

FIPNxRJGYiKeaBk9ZpJJZA.text: I've been here twice, both times my boss and I saw co-workers, it's a favorite spot.  The service is great, friendly, the food is great, not a huge menu filled with endless options.  The Gyro is delicious, and hits the spot and then some.  The humus is tasty has a great consistency.

71aMYI3PWWYNdIRQ5-WKtg.text: What a delightful little place!   I love Mediterranean food, and this is my go-to place for tasty Greek cuisine. It's tucked away in a corner of the Ricardo's/Food4Less strip mall on Flamingo & Decatur, and conveniently located a few blocks from my boyfriend's apartment. The inside is clean, bright, and has a charming blue and white Greek theme (go figure). The service is friendly and more than adequate.   After getting food here at least a dozen times, I can say that dine-in or take-out items are equally delicious.  I would rate the prices as being moderate, ( Apps run about $6-$11, Dinner entrees range from around $13-$20) but the quality food is well worth the extra few dollars you might save by going to a chain such as The Mad Greek (mediocre at best).  I particularly enjoy the gyros, but my favorite way to eat here is to bring a few friends and order a bunch of appetizers and sides to share. I regularly order the hummus, tzatziki, spanakopita, and a few side order chicken kebabs for a quick Greek feast. I also highly recommend the desserts. I'm not sure if they are house made, but they are delectable! (Try the galaktoboureko if they've got it - it's a scrumptious pairing of phyllo pastry and custard)  Overall, I love this place, and I think you will too. Stin Iyiamas!

uLad-lRIaZAdfnFv0KGKVQ.text: Had lunch here today. Was pleasantly surprised with the large portions. I ordered the Souklavi, Half Chicken and Half Beef, it came with a greek salad. The food was delicious and the service was great! Will definitely be coming back!

P7HQWZ1Y9t6wXHPSCgmA_w.text: This place is good for Greek food. Most Greek food places are overpriced and this place is not.   About $12 for a Mousaka or Pastichio plate (both are kinda like a Greek lasagna). Different from my mom's, but still tasty.  The baklava was pretty good...they had like three varieties.   I don't like the location, even tho it's close to my house. The Food4Less parking lot that they share is shady and you can't really see your car from the restaurant. That crossed my mind the last time I was there, and indeed someone tried breaking into my car whilst I was dining. Left me with some nice scratches on my driver-side door.

Qt_Qh7IsfdK7dA3Ya8eVxA.text: Just stopped in for lunch for the first time and it definitely won't be the last! Delicious gyros (got the beef/lamb and the chicken-both were amazing!) and the Greek side salad is divine. Just the right amount of everything. Service was exceptional. It's a great find for our otherwise dreary food choices in Vegas.

2TW716W0Nicyhjz70QCgfQ.text: Came here while on vacation and sat outside on the patio.  Didn't know what to expect but was pleasantly surprised by the amazing taste of our food!  I got the gyro and fries and it was huge.  Loved the feta on the gyro!  Everything tasted fresh and the price was decent too.  Would definitely come again next time I'm in Vegas.

MEYaWtRu9ZVZx2iLhC_DFw.text: super good food!!!great service and super great waiter Miguel was awesome!! will def come back and have some real good food!!

LiAOg1ladGm_aiOXffSWBQ.text: Authentic, really good Greek restaurant!  I had the Spanikopita appetizer for my entree and the side Greek salad.  They were both really large and more than a meal.  My only wish is some sort of veggie combo, i.e. one piece spanikopita, one tiropita, salad. Two things that are a disservice to the great food:  One is so-so service, the other is location.  It's in a crappy strip mall and out of the way.

nFRNNQ-AxnCmmdVV1OExNg.text: My review is based on the bad customer service I walked in restaurant 39mins before closing for take out. A male waiter sat down two plates of food to a customer while telling me they were closed. Didn't offer a reason why or apologize. Very rude. I discovered market grille cafe they have very delicious Greek food.

dT2q6vxHON4URZ0wiki_fA.text: Just as yummy as the others have attested. Located in the corner of a little plaza. Very unassuming and light and bright within. Service was great, food delicious and reasonably priced. Full bar is available, including retsina wine. Las Vegas is not a routine stop for me, but should I find myself passing thru here again (only passing), this will be my go to meal place

eHUE1v8JNgPyD51UU6tWCA.text: More like big fat zero! Customer service absolutely sucks!!!. What a shame because the food is good but they couldn't get our takeout orders right twice. First order, get home with a salad but no dressing. Second time ordered hummus. Get home and no pita bread! I called and spoke to a woman who was barely apologetic. I said I thought after two mistakes and also having to drive all the way back to get the bread they should give us a meal on the house. She agreed and would take my husbands name down. Tonight I call for the so called free order and was given third degree questioning like I was lying. Still no apology by the way. Then he tried to bargain by only giving me a portion of the order free. Just lost a regular! Check your take out orders people! Guess they have enough customers not to care about one.

jdbCPyN2XtBxak_FYk7R0Q.text: This place is just GREAT! The food simply amazing. Everyone in our group was extremely satisfied with their order. I ordered the FAT Gyro and it was by far the best Gyro I've ever had. The size of the orders is quiet large also, especially when considering the relatively low prices on the menu. Highly recommend to anyone who likes greek food.

FYi7_ddtnAg2NwrrRDh4Bg.text: Great hidden gem in a strip mall tucked into a corner.  From the outside it looked a little random...but the lunch and dinner menu are full of great Greek favorites.    We ordered from the lunch menu for dinner and upgraded to a combo.  I got the salad he got the rice.  We both enjoyed the souvlaki and the shwarma.  The family platter looked and smelled amazing.  Next time we are in town, we are coming back hungry!

tovY9lS3iT-j3HnnFKc4hw.text: Just did a order to go, food is very fresh and very taste! The soup with lemon, chicken and rice is one of the best that I already had. Hummus was pretty good and the lamb/beef gyro also!

SeCe3lgNhnpmQAtOFZ9h2w.text: I come here all the time and usually it's nothing to write about. The service is always meh but the food is pretty good and I live close so I come back. But this time the service was just awful. We came in at 8:30, and sat down. We ordered maybe 5 minutes later. All we got was hummus and lentil soup. They dropped the food off and then didn't check up on us. We needed pita bread and had to flag someone down for it. Then I needed an iced tea refill but again no one came to check on us. All I saw was Gina standing at the counter a lot. Gina came to drop our bill off and asked if we needed anything else and I told her how disappointed we were with the service and that yes I did need a refill and even more pita bread (they give a lot of hummus and not a lot of bread). She goes on to inform me that we walked in when the kitchen was closed. OKAY why would you not tell us that when we sat down then??? She was very rude and I couldn't believe the way she approached the situation. I will literally never come back here again. Which is sad because I've been coming here for years. Y'all need to work on your customer service.

sLDtyu1JMXdwoSRVGBNbjQ.text: Googled, 'Best Gyro In Town.' The Fat Greek popped up in Yelp. Google, you have done me well. I applaud you sir, as well as Yelp and this Mediterranean heaven of a kitchen. 5/5 stars, although they need to add Hummmus Schwarma to their menu! Their hummus to my knowledge wasn't home-made or anything special, which was disappointing and didn't match the great quality of my gyro. But because the gyro was so good, I'd definitely return here. A+

eWz4fpuftNh6U-AQUbvzaA.text: Very accommodating for a party of 28! And the food was delicious...big portions and the price is right!

GrRNsS9RRyfIlpE6rN1-mg.text: Ok this place is amazing. My picky eaters (kids) love it. We had the Souvlaki and the kids ate it all! That never happens. Don't miss the bread! Yum. The waiter from Bulgaria was by far one of the best waiters I've had in a long time.

gxEEJGcVWmqufb7HuLnPJA.text: Casual fresh Greek food at its best. Very reasonable price and solid traditional Greek food. Open for lunch and dinner - a great place for a quick meal of the strip

WfO_8dTLosBgZDA0zz4Bsw.text: I think this may be the very best Greek food in Las Vegas! And best service! Please give it a try!

jzX585VPqS5kISrATTYjZA.text: Great food and service!! Radoslav was our server and was considerate, giving us plenty of time, without feeling rushed, to look over the menu. Once he took our order, it came out very quickly. We had the hummus and the fat gyro. Very tasty!! Definitely recommend trying this place when you have a gyro craving!

ayKF9RaHjzNs8_FURCeZ-A.text: This place was delicious. They use real meat. Not the steakum crap. Rice was lemony good and the ice tea was fresh tasting too. Def will be back!

3fErQq0qpYIPF2lgIVCv7A.text: Looking for a decently priced, generous sized-portion, great tasting, authentic Greek food? Look no further, this is the place to be! One word, Moussaka. Their baklava and other little desserts are great too!  BTW, they're closed on Sundays.

cKIPiRCYJ8aqXZd6GbxQsw.text: I was on the search for a good gyro for lunch and I brought along two of my friends for the journey. I like this place and the fact that when you walk in and its decorated with "Greek colors." I came here on a Friday for lunch and it was pretty packed. That was definitely a good sign! My friends both ordered the Fat Greek Gyro and I just ordered the Traditional Gyro. The Traditional Gyro was tasty, but I felt the pita bread was a bit too tough. The rice pilaf was good, but extremely buttery. My friend ordered the "Greek" fries and it came with melted feta cheese on top. It looked good, but I was too full to even try it. Overall, I think the lunch combo is decent deal and I will be back when I need a good gyro.

Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fat greek gyro
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. traditional gyro w/o onions and tomatoes

zt9PPo9yxMmrDaOCD8euGA.text: I love this place! The food is amazing. I have eaten almost everything on their menu and never been disappointed. I even got my boss (who is hesitant to try new things) to try it and now he is hooked. It is very reasonably priced and the service is always great. The place is really clean and has a nice bright environment because they always have the windows open. I recommend this place to everyone.

irFe3W9xEOzYTBf3KApe0A.text: I love this little gem!!  I haven't had many things on their menu, but I do LOVE what I've had so far . . . fat greek gyro, soulvaki pita, the chicken greek salad, tabbouli salad, and falafel.  Each time I think I'll try something else, but I always end up right back with my fave, the orginal fat gyro!!   The GYRO with LAMB really satisfies, it is delish, the meat is perfectly flavored and in my three experiences, always prepared perfectly!!  The lunch combo comes with the gyro and a side (I had the greek salad, but you can also do rice, I think) and a drink all for just under $10.  Not bad.  It gets a little busy at lunch time, we always try to sneak in at 11:30 to avoid the rush -- just a little tip.  By 12:30 when we leave, it's full.    Service is great -- very casual, but very helpful and kind.  They are quick with your order, refills and the check too!    If you're in the area -- definitely stop in!!

RBgiu_Vmc4R4zOnDcu3MAA.text: Excellent flavors and some of the best greek food I've had in town. The octopus here is my favorite dish and I highly suggest any of the salads as well. Good location and pretty good staff makes it great. Lunch is super busy here FYI.

16LOb8H8S3-8ovKBmR3iNw.text: This is our favorite Greek restaurant in town. I have never had a bad experience here. The food is authentic and consistent, the staff is friendly, even when they are busy the service is always good.

Ee-IsRs4bwwzuAXYEC0UaA.text: This a a full service casual restaurant that serves quality Greek food that is freshly made at a reasonable price. The food can take a while from kitchen to table, but that's because everything appears to be made from scratch.   The gyros and pork chop are tasty and well prepared. Dinners come with greek salad or soup and plenty of warm pita bread. The humus could have been a bit thicker more savory, but everything else was on point.

h1006HfkZM6dXL-Px0Ma-Q.text: I've tried a lot of Greek Restaurants before and this one is the BEST I have ever had!! everything so fresh and flavorful! Service was amazing! Definitely my first choice of restaurant to go to when i'm back in vegas! best restaurant here!!

sU3-CriGbBh0r21uABFRTQ.text: This is a cheap enough place to get rid of your shawarma craving. Meat is tender and seasoned well and topped with fresh veggies.

Opdu_zSDtqbZsfrnJ53ghA.text: I really liked how The Fat Greek was nicely decorated.  I ordered take-out and the food was ready very quickly. He said 15 minutes but it felt like 5 minutes.  The restaurant wasn't busy which probably has a lot to do with the brief wait time. Walking up to restaurant the first thing I see is a sleek motorcycle. This made me chuckle b/c my cousin in Greece posts a lot of pictures of motorcycles so seeing one made me think it might be a Greek thing. In the restaurant there were a few people seated for full-service and then 2 couples waiting for take-out.  The man who took my order was unenthusiastic. Efficient but slightly unfriendly. I order The Fat Greek Gyro, beef and rice Dolmades, and baklava. I also wanted spanakopita but they were out. During my 30-minute drive to home I ate the baklava.  It was good but could have been better with more nuts. I tried one of the dolmades and it lacked seasoning and "zest". I was worried that the gyro might be disappointing. Fortunately, I was NOT disappointed by the gyro.  It tasted great even after 30 minutes of sitting in the car during my commute home.  The Fat Greek pulled a lousy review "out of the fire" by providing an excellent gyro which was the one reason I went into the restaurant.

DZAEtUaXbZNv5c4iepiawA.text: We wound up ordering take out from here -- the first time the food was fabulous! Everything arrived hot and perfectly packed!!!!   From the time of order, to it arriving in the hotel lobby was about 40 minutes.... not bad.  The gyros, like previous posts, was off the charts!  I love lemon avegolemono (I know I spelled that wrong) soup -- this was so lemony and silky!  My kids thought it was too tangy, but they still ate it.  The salad was also well done!   Amazing.  THe next night, we ordered from here again (we are in from out of town and my daughter had a temperature, so we spent our vacation in our hotel room).... this time, it took 95 minutes to get here.... the food arrived leaking and they were missing a soup... I didn't want to call back and wait for another 95 minutes, we ordered plenty and the soup was just part of a meal.... there was just salad dressing all over the place.  And the food was tepid at best.  The food was still great, but this put a real damper on everything.   This time we got shrimp skewers, and my son devoured them... he loved them and we also ordered the baklava.... it was ok... but the real star of the show are the gyros....and for me, the salad....

2W4SWjO0qyK-qmzIbArqWQ.text: Ordered from The Fat Greek from Eat24.  I was visiting some friends and we didn't feel like going out in the rain to get our food, so we ordered in.  Ordering was easy and I received a text almost immediately from them to let me know they were out of two items we ordered and would we like something else.  I adjusted our order by text and they said they would have it to us shortly.  They took FOREVER to get our food to us, over 1.5 hours.  They also must have been out of rice, since none of our dishes had rice.  They substituted it with veggies.  Not happy about that, but the quality of the food made up for any upset we had.  All four of us ate ALL our food and enjoyed every bite.  We ordered lamb rack, lamb wrap, beef kabob plate and sauteed shrimp.  The shrimp was devine, perfectly cooked and delicious.  All our meals were super tasty, the meat cooked properly and the veggies were very good too.  Definitely on our list of eat in places in Vegas from now on.  Everyone employee we spoke with including the driver was friendly and personable.

4QDcz3-r_TEs_HwOqUM6Rg.text: Came here because I had a Mediterranean craving and wanted some buttery rice. The normal place I go had a wedding party so we couldn't go there.   Their rice pilaf is not buttery it's very lemony. I wasn't a big fan. I think it's funny how they have the food network playing while we eat but on mute. Kinda not a good thing when they are showing stuff that looks so moist and yummy and I get my falafel and it's extremely dry. Mind you it's my first time trying it and I am not a fan. It comes on top of hummus with a big pile of diced up tomatoes, onions and cucumber. My friend who loves falafel said it was a bit dry. I ordered the gyro meat plate and it came with the rice pilaf. Some of the meat was very dry seemed like it might have been there a while. The taziki sauce was a let down I was expecting some cucumber and hoping for a bit of mint. It was just yogurt and dill with some lime or lemon juice. My friend had the lamb shank he said it was good. The hummus was good and the pita bread soft.   It's not a place I will be coming back too anytime soon. If I do I'll get the fries.

Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb shank

TKtjiHCbPYt0XNHaqtEDzw.text: Food was really good, a tad slow coming out as they only have one cook. Had skewer plate and it was cooked perfectly. Will return

u_L3uMGhsQ2vc2zF7FlStQ.text: The Chicken Shawerma is the best! The sauce that they used to top it off tied in so well with the grilled chicken and vegetables. Full of flavor and yummy-ness. It's super filling and delicious. An absolute must try for you chicken lovers. I think I found my new favorite Greek restaurant in Vegas. Cheers!

Zvp216cVWuzYR9jQgi1rAQ.text: Service was good and food was good. I ordered the beef and lamb kabobs which were really tasty. Our table ordered a plate of olives as an appetizer and they were good too. I would have given 5 stars but I found a hair in my salad which was pretty gross.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb/beef kabobs

gGw-sKmn9ubRaudPC3RyiQ.text: I have spent 10 years in Vegas looking for the best Greek food and have eaten here several times.! Vegas has several excellent places but this place tops them all.  The last time I went for lunch the food came so quick I was shocked and they were busy.! Brought a visiting friend from California here and he loved it as well. Never a complaint here..!

sc0ugWyNfQaiepvx8rsE6g.text: Great gyros. Reasonable prices. Fast.   I finally got around to try this place out and it was not a disappointment at all. I ordered the traditional gyro, side of salad, and side of sliced gyro meats.  Everything came out in 3 minutes! The traditional gyro itself was huge. The meat was juicy and tender. They also gave a lot of it in the pita. Everything was delicious in the gyro. After I ate the gyro, I was too full for my salad and sliced gyro.   Will be back soon!

rxYGXVXCQZxK5MvLRDDayg.text: Love the food but Horrible Service!!   I used to come here for lunch often since I work close had have spent a lot coming almost weekly.   They need new management/training!!  If you are patient the lemon chicken rice soups and Salads are great...Im just disappointed in the service. 10-20 waiting for a carry out order is unacceptable when you have a short lunch period.

70CtZOQ6EY-SYnc6LMBRvQ.text: Lule is over cooked   Steak kabob is was luke warm  Grape leaves are meh  Service is slow... Someone left as the wait for their food was too long

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jJUCcGoExjObT6xs25cw3w.text: The food here= AMAZING! So good!! I went during lunch time. It wasn't too busy but it took forever for us to get our food. I ordered the fat Greek salad with chicken and my friend ordered the fat gyro. I wouldn't think it takes that long to make.  We didn't get refills on our water either.  3 stars goes to the delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek salad with chicken and a fat gyro in the back!

TI2LV2fPMWe7QUQdvKN41Q.text: The Fat Greek is a great spot for Greek and Mediterranean cuisine.  Gets pretty busy for lunch during the weekdays since it's conveniently located at the northwest shopping center off flamingo and Decatur.  The food has stayed consistent since the original owner passed away and I almost always start with the avgolemeno soup (lemon chicken rice).  You can't go wrong with the gyro selection and I recommend the traditional, fat Greek or kefte kabob sandwich.  The desserts are freshly prepared and extremely delicious especially the baklava.  My favorite is the Napoleon which can be made upon order.  The decor is very Mediterranean with light blue painted walls and accents reflecting traditional Greek colors.  Definitely a hole in the wall cafe that has expanded since opening many years ago and become a staple in my diet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of avgolemeno soup
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek side salad with gyro meat on top!
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional gyro with French fries

Rv-g9SY9DfhkS7EGe71cdg.text: THE FAT GREEK - THE //Freaken.Addictive.Tasty// GREEK  As you walk in it seemed like a place where you order up front & then wait for your food... it is a sit down resteraunt. I was stupid & tried to order at the register my first time.   The inside is petite but the tables are well spaced with enough room so you don't feel so stuffy. Like  most greek resteraunt the interior decor was all blue & trims of white with random white pillars placed all around. The location for this place is easy to miss but it is right next to Ralphs grocery store in the same plaza as boiling crab.  Staff was friendly & I had to see the most halarious judgemental facial expression our server gave us when he saw that we finished our food... it was a look of surprise & just dumfounded ahahaha Also the comment of the lady that dropped off our food was "O my you guys ordered too much food"  for some reason because it is more of a family owned & the reactions were sincere & cute in my opinion ahahha but also used to the expression since we get it a lot...  HUMMUS & PITA 5.75 - Enough citrus & enough garlic to actually taste it. I would have to say the BEST hummus I have tasted thus far. The pitas were also nice & hot although not enough... but you can get another side order for only a $1  FAT GREEK SALAD 7.95 - my mommy used to own a salad shop so there is a specific flavor profile I expect from the dressing for a greek salad & this place brought back my childhood memories! Also they give a great amount of feta cheese to go w/ every bite you take.  GRILLED CHICKEN BREAST 11.95 - a little too healthy for my taste buds but my fiance really appreciated since he likes to be healthy when it comes to choosing dishes. But still the chicken was tender & the pilaf rice was perfect. The dish also came with some fat fries which were soft on the inside & crispy outter.  CHICKEN FAT GREEK GYRO 7.95 - they don't lie when it says FAT gyro... i literally have to take out half of the cut grilled sliced chickens so that I could actually pick up the gyro & eat it instead of trying to fork & knife it. The rest of the chicken I add to the Greek salad =]  BEEF FAT GREEK GYRO 7.95 - juicy pieces of meat & no need to pull it out because the are more flat pieces... but absolutely flavorful and juicy... although I wasn't sure if it was a beef & lamb mix or not.  FRIES 2.00 - fat fries & boat bowls worth which is a lot for only $2  BAKLAVA 4.50 - it had enough crunch to every bite... but i also have never had bad baklava =]

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; beef kabob
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries 2.00

W8V1mAPsxVdSaWKXdq_H2A.text: So the first few times I came in the service sucked. It was lunch hour and it was busy, and I was ignored for a good ten minutes. I do like the food so I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt. I came again last week around 1 and it was dead. There were maybe 4 other tables dining, and I received excellent service.   I had a cup of the Avgolemeno soup which was very tasty and lemony and came with a side of warm pita. I love this soup, but I just wish it was a little hotter in temperature as it was served lukewarm. I also had the fat gyro which is a gyro with feta, lettuce, tomato, onion and tzatziki sauce. I love the addition of feta to any gyro. It adds a salty element that just enhances the flavors. I asked for the tzatziki sauce on the side and while it was a nice complement to the gyro, I didn't particularly care for the flavor.   I really like this place and if they just had one more person working the lunch rush, I think this could be a 5 star establishment.

Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat gyro

avrFMJwxODOjjs0_Y4DYww.text: Have to say , been coming to this place for a few years !! Food has been good for a long time , but I feel things have been off lately , maybe new cooks but my chicken was really cold and over cooked today

8KAyR5HxKMlQPw9ZOtaKPQ.text: This is by far the best Greek food in Vegas.  Portions are generous and price is great.  Love love the Greek salad with Gyro meat, the avlomeno soup is delicious. Must try this hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

75meBmky4sNIQy5xOtZzbQ.text: I shall call this review :  GREAT BALLS OF FIRE  We were craving falafels. Having been way too long since we had a falafel we went to The Fat Greek, seeing as the the Greek is fat he may make a pretty good chick pea ball. Oh boy were we wrong.  The falafel balls were ginormous. Crispy on the outside. But the inside had a mashed potatoe consistency.  Marjie think yucki. Not yummilishous. And. The falafels were hot. As in hot chili pepper hot.  Not yummi when mouth on fire. Inedible. Marjie not happy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Falafel ball from outer space. Marjie no likie.

HBwB4b1cQ-I77TWtaSeD9g.text: Place is amazing!! Started with a cup of the lemon chicken soup, sooooo good. Savory and just the perfect amount of citrus to make this wpup clean and hearty. Next I had the lamb-beef gyro with the greek lemon potatoes foe the side. It is an update for this but DO it! The potatoes are crispy potatoe wedges with lemon and greek spices on them. The gyro was huge and they gave me plenty of feta and tzatziki sauce on it. I was stuffed and the prices are really good as well. My favorite greek place in Vegas hands down.

3z7SW85nQXjEonLcUJ02Tg.text: Best gyro hands down. The meat to vegetable ratio is perfect! Only place i will go. Everywhere else has been a disappointment.

3ATgSZpVjneRqf5nzHlQHA.text: I come here at least once a week!  Best Greek in Vegas.  Love the Fat Greek gyro with chicken.  Also  a fan of the Spanakopita.  Food is consistently great!  Never an off day!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OatFcZpbg8SmwLuA2KVEWw.text: I'm sad to be leaving this review.  My family and I have eaten here for a decade and loved it.  The last two times in the restaurant, we were completely ignored, food took an hour to come out even though we saw delivery bag after delivery bag leaving the kitchen.  When the  food came it was served by a grumpy waiter and it was cold.  I figured we'd move to ordering delivery since that seems to be their focus.  The food was good but, unfortunately, this time left all of us running for the bathroom the rest of the afternoon.  When I called the third party delivery service to warn them, I was treated like I was trying to get a freebie when I was just genuinely concerned for their customers.  Evidently when three customers only complain it's our issue, not theirs.    The message was "I spoke to the owner, you're the only ones who complained, and he's not going to take anything off your bill so we can't refund you either."    I expressed the fact that I wasn't looking for a refund but was concerned for their clientele.    Sad that customer service has gone out the window, at least there are other great greek options in town.

AmAR1ryTvPcS8w4MwZ-trQ.text: The food and prices are both amazing! For lunch I ordered the Falafel Plate which included 4 large tasty (and not greasy) falafels on a bed of hummus, 4 slices of warm grilled pita and a large side of chopped simple greek(ish) salad. That large entree was only $7.50, I could not be more thrilled with food quality and the price. My co-worker got the Greek Salad w/ Grilled Chicken which are was HUGE and almost had two chicken breasts worth of chicken along with 4 slices of pita. Even the sides are very reasonably priced at $1 (like tzatziki sauce, hummus..etc) and come in a larger condiment container. They apparently get quite a big lunch rush but it looks like they have plenty of seats to accommodate. I can't wait to go back and try more items off the menu!
