Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad with grilled chicken
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu October 2017

5CreeCGQ7QxtileS9bxlUw.text: One word:  horrid. Worst food I have ever had and I won't call it Greek, because it isn't. You don't deep fry saganaki. It is flamed in ouzo. And why they had only one server is beyond me.

9wFKVmaICKWofrBvPV4wtg.text: I mentioned in another review that I'm a big fan of Greek food. I love the flavors and unbeatable freshness... when done right, and this place does it right.   I stopped in here after a workout and despite my sweaty appearance they were really friendly and allowed me the freedom to sit where ever I wanted. Once seated and beverage in hand, I took quite awhile to decide what I wanted to order because there were so many good options from which to choose. I ultimately chose the grilled pork chop but because it would take up to 20 minutes to cook and I was hungry, I settled with the gyro and Athenian fries. Although it wasn't my first choice it was still a rather good one! The pita and meat were the perfect temperature, the fresh veggies had the right bite/crunch and the feta was very creamy. The fries were great too, they definitely don't skimp on the feta and because I like a lot of lemon, they let me douse them in as much lemon juice as I could take. (quick tip, they broil the fries in the same dish they serve it in so don't be like me and touch the plate!)  This place has a great atmosphere, not too loud and serve a nice selection of alcohol so it's great for quick bites or a nice relaxed dinner out. I'll be returning to try that pork chop again when I'm not as ravenous from a workout. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro and Athenian Fries

5sbcpl_C2BDwU7cWpmCQQA.text: This is my first review ever on yelp, but worth it. After we came in the waiter stood at the table and refused to leave before we order right away. Didn't have 3 plates that we wanted, then when we ordered the family plate which is different types of kebabs, the waiter came back and told Us the chef doesn't want to make that plate and we can only order small plates from the LUNCH MENU (AT 7 pm).  I've never been treated this bad at a restaurant before.

18KrCX0XqM4rDm3977_w6g.text: The lunch specials are decently priced for las vegas. You can get a gyro, a side, drink and soup for less than $20.00.   The beef/lamb gyro was perfectly seasoned and layered with tzatziki. The side side was also fine.  The lemon drop soup, which I'm normally a huge fan of, was a miss. The soup was too dilated, and there lacked the lemon creamy punch that I've had at other restaurants, even with the extra effort to add in lemon juice with fresh lemons.   Verdict: Stick to the main courses and you'll be fine.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Needs more lemon

g2fdfy0E9Y5Pmu-NfoXamA.text: I come here every once & a while. Their lamb souvlaki is amazing & you can't go wrong with a fat greek salad either! Definitely quality food. There hasn't been a time where I've been disappointed with their food. Where they do lack however is in service. If you get your food to go it's not that bad, but if you're dining in expect to wait a little more than necessary for a refill. They do get very busy during lunch time so plan accordingly!!   Food: 4.5 service: 3.   I haven't gotten a chance to try their dessert, but they do a have nice display of it in the front.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Greek Salad with no onions or olives with extra cucumber.

Pu3RTpBGrmtjpkQPTm-aOg.text: So good! The gyros are amazing and the Athena Fries are a must try! Reasonably priced, Clean, & Tasty! They do get busy for lunch but worth the wait if you have time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing, Healthy, &amp; Light! Beware of the seeds in the olives though,  I damn near shattered a molar biting into a olive!

skeEc7WDPxuokxE1CHB60A.text: We were looking on Yelp and found this place which shows a 4 1/2 star rating and decided to give it anyway.    First impression the place looks clean and since it was between lunch and dinner it was basically empty.  We were greeted right away and told to sit anywhere.   We were brought menus and offered drinks.  While we waited on the drinks we looked over the menu.  When the waiter returned we attempted to place our order but unfortunately several items on the menu they no longer had???  Why bring us a menu with all the items on it that you do not have?  It took several minutes to find some items they actually had and can serve.  If you are updating the menu, cross off the items you do not have instead of having customers pick items and have to be told sorry we no longer have that, this makes the experience so uninviting and hard to recommend to others.  Once the food arrived, the food was actually good but was different from other greek places.  We decided to order some food to go for our daughter which he brought in a bag and we never looked at it to make sure it was what we ordered.  Of course this was our mistake because once we got home it was not what we ordered or our daughter wanted.  She tried it and could not eat it so that was a waste of money.    The entire experience was kind of stressful even though the staff is really trying and they are nice.  It just stinks when they miss the mark and cannot deliver when you are there and they cannot deliver on something you order to go.  I don't know if we will give this place another shot, I guess if I can confirm they have updated their menu and have all the food items listed in stock maybe we will give them another chance but for now, it is what it is and its not a place I desire to return to.

UcUeuihpG_QLFtGqbklyLg.text: When our food was served, I caught myself getting excited and exclaiming, "WOW!" I was off on a weekday, recovering from a turnaround trip to the East Coast. I wanted to a) not cook and b) still eat clean. Whenever this happens, my husband and I usually veer toward Mediterranean/Greek. Wanting to try new places, we headed toward The Fat Greek. It's located in a large plaza - Sammy's LA Pastrami and Ricardo's can be spotted along the perimeter. You have to drive in toward the Food 4 Less. Parking's a breeze since the lot is quite large. The interior is bright and clean. The lunch crowd was quite lively - busy enough for me to get excited about all the food gawking but open enough for us to be able to easily find a table. I ordered the full lunch Greek Salad with chicken; dressing on the side. Now, I realize that salad isn't the ideal thing to order since not much cooking is involved. However, salads and club sandwiches are foods that, when tired or lazy, I'm more than happy to pay to save my the trouble. My husband got the kefta kabob plate. That, with the salad, caught us both off guard. The food looked so so good. We were instantly impressed. Our excitement grew when we both tried the kabob and were hit with so much flavor. My husband considers it one of his top kefta kabobs. yelp.com/user_local_phot... Anyway, I've had many a salad and any a Greek salad, but this was just so pretty and so right. The chicken was perfectly cooked and flavorful and everything about it screamed freshness. yelp.com/user_local_phot... Curious, my husband ordered a side of gyro. He expected a piece of two, but was amazed to find this much served for $3. And it was good. yelp.com/user_local_phot... Satisfied by our clean meal, we decided to indulge with Athenian fries. For $3 you get this pile of cheesy goodness piled high and fresh out of the oven. yelp.com/user_local_phot... yelp.com/user_local_phot... They're basically Greek fries with the extra step of adding toasty melty goodness with extra cheese and stint under the broiler. Which begs the question: what would Spartan fries look like? I digress... You'll find the restaurant isn't fancy, but it's obvious the ownership cares. The interior is clean. The food is done right - simply, well portioned, and presented cleanly. We spent around $30 with tax and tip and I had leftover chicken to take home. Without my husband's soda, the fries, and the gyro, it's a very reasonably priced healthy lunch that brought us back in the next day for dinner... more on that to come!

5S22Sj5f5fS4ZQOAbKnFRw.text: Can never go wrong with their food!! My fave is the Far Greek salad with grilled shrimp skewer

A2ERgdZLEm7o2erUewIo9w.text: I've been to The Fat Greek a few times and I am a fan. It's a great place for lunch.  The foods delicious and reasonably priced. Gyros and sandwiches during lunch went for about $8. And their usually accommodating for groups.  I've had the beef shawerma, the chicken shawerma, and some of the gyros. Everything I've had so far has been really good, seemed fresh and taste delicious. Nothing seemed greasy or over/lacked seasoning, well I'd probably throw hot sauce on it but I love hot sauce. Someone on the table had ordered these fries, I don't know what they were called but it wasn't your usually fries it looked so good, the entire plate was wiped out before I even could try them. I will need to find out what they were and have them next time.  I remember once it was so busy that they gave us a complementary pieces of baklava. Yum that baklava was so good. Layers of flakey yet moist goodness with nuts and honey. If you have a sweet tooth make a stop here just for the baklava.  The interior is kind of mom and pops like or old however you want to call it but there are a lot of seats available, except when it's very busy and there a wait. There's a larger TV hanging on the wall.  It's located in between an Indian/Pakistani restaurant and a Food4Less on Decatur and Flamingo, cause of it's location I sometimes forget it's even there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Shawerma

TeAdzw3AmwafhTQdbRwZqQ.text: The staff here is so friendly, the food is amazing, and if you've ever actually been to Greece, this feels like a cute little hole in the wall place you'd find there.

ONXqlMDiKeDSstr0zrFSNg.text: This is our go to Greek restaurant. The food is fresh and delicious. Servers are very nice. The portions are large. The soup is the best.

8mvhA61InQNZxRRsO-bnBA.text: This is my office's Go-To lunch favorite! We always order from here! Ive brought my family and friends here, too! Great food everytime!

7z6t8EaMG-ocWMbNnTqppA.text: Been coming here for years! Love it. Food is soooo yummy and the service is amazing. One of my fav in Las Vegas.

ZcyRdMUmIVWaN2ewfkjUDw.text: I was in the mood for a salad and looking at their menu I decided to go here. Nice place inside, very clean and decorated in blue and white. I ordered the Greek Salad with Gyro meat and no onions. I didn't get any of the olives either, bummer. My wife ordered a Pita with no onions and as she took a bite noticed onions. The service was decent, your average wait staff, pretty friendly

vx-X9IwhV1cJ7lKrOkS5gw.text: AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!!  As a Greek, I have very high standards for Greek food naturally. So I thought why not give this place a try due to the high reviews. I don't know how in the world they have 4.5 stars Im actually still trying to figure that out.  The food was without a doubt the worst Greek food I have ever had in my life, this including the years I have spent there, all of the places I have had Greek food in the country, etc. The gyro was gross. The meat tasted old and not fresh and had no flavor. The pita was clearly store bought and reheated.   We ordered the pita and tzatziki.  It came with literally 5 of the smallest pieces of pita bread and a bowl of tzatiziki. The tzatiziki was had so much garlic that it made my stomach upset.  It was also very very watery :(.   It took us about an hour to have two gyros and pita. WTF??? All of those things should be just about made and take literally five minutes to assemble.   I will NEVER return and I severely suggest that if you want greek food you find some where else where its more authentic. I would rather eat Arbys gryos than ever go near this gross stuff again.

Wy0lSI5JyTkHAZbcMlASEw.text: I've eaten in the restaurant and I have delivery numerous times. Best gyros I've found outside of Greece. Soft, warm pita, tasty meat, tangy tzatziki. Even delivery is solid, so I recommend that if you can't get to the restaurant.

b2mNFywVb_MaQ6f4wyzrkQ.text: Excellent greek food for a fair price....  I order the pork chop, which is very fresh and tasty....it cost 14.99 plus tax...very cheap for grill pork chops. It was a thick cut. They are generous with there amount of food.  My friend order the falafal with gyros....the gyros was excellent. I don't recommend this dish because falafal is made out of bread...other than that, if you love falafal go for it.  Pros: they give you alot of food, very fresh and clean, service is excellent, staff is friendly and attentitve  Con: its in a shitty strip mall  Also they have excellent fresh desert...which i did not try  P.s. Im looking to go back and try the lamb shank

AoZTNdRnP827XXwkfr6-JA.text: This place was such a refreshing change from the mass produced buffetet foods of the strip. Delicious fresh food. I would definitely recommend it!

OhzeFCH1hSpSoTmM0LAE9w.text: Good food. Good atmosphere (Doesn't feel fast foodie like those other two places in the northwest - If I gotta name them..you don't eat alot of greek food) Good people. Can't ask for more. I recommend.

aRSxegx_e5kcVoRELf-mPw.text: Mmm best gyros for your money love at first bite ! Super friendly staff took 3 min to get my gyro rice and extra meat 15 bucks well spent.

4m5jmnCOTvAYr8XEQOGCPQ.text: I had no clue what to expect from the athena fries...they were delicious!! Fries piled on with feta, mozzerella and I for get the other cheese plus spices. Different and tasty!! I had the Shawarma beef, it was delicious. My friend had the Shawarma lamb and for being lamb it was pretty tasty too. Lamb can be so tricky so we were both surprised.

yykCsScxZ1JgMvyoZoA-Zw.text: We went for dinner and found the food to be good.  The saganaki was a bit strange - it was dry and breaded.  Aside from the saganaki everything was very good.  The salad was fresh and not over done in feta.  The chicken and veggies were very flavourful and fresh.  The baklava looked great but we were full.  We found the prices and service great.

wQlCcQkCgh7ad8W8isR9gg.text: We ordered through Grub Hub and in order to get it quicker my daughter went to pick it up. She waited so long her phone died. One hour in she called and said they were running behind and it would be 15-20 minutes more. At the TWO HOUR mark and with her not answering calls or texts I called the restaurant.   I said I'm looking for my daughter because I haven't heard from her the lady said oh she is right here we are running behind. I said it has been TWO HOURS! She said sorry I don't know what to tell you. I asked to speak to my daughter and told her to cancel the order and come home. She told the lady who said we have to call Grub Hub to cancel. The lady got back on the phone with me and I said you have got to be kidding right? I thought my daughter had been kidnapped but instead she has been sitting there for TWO HOURS and you can't cancel the order? She said no I don't know what to tell you. I said how much longer will it be she spoke to someone, the cooks l suppose, and they said 15 more minutes. I cannot believe they would allow a customer to wait TWO HOURS and just say I don't know what to tell you, contact Grub Hub. I would contact Grub Hub but my daughter, whose phone is dead, is the one who set up the account. There are any number of ways they could have tried to make this right.  Never again will we order from here...they obviously don't value their customers. Done with Grub Hub too, as this is outlandish. I am obviously very  thankful my daughter wasn't kidnapped.

R_qAoR0-pNIV119rTIRfHA.text: I'm torn with a review. The location is fine, and it's very bright inside. Kind of felt like I was on vacation and not at a business lunch. However, it's also kind of small. Our waiter was fantastic. He was friendly, attentive and even went along with a good humored prank. The wait for food took much too long. I don't know if they are understaffed in the kitchen or if everything is made from scratch each time. Either way, it shouldn't take an hour for food. And while the food was good, it wasn't the best Greek food I have had. I would probably go back but on a day when I could afford to spend time sitting around.

mv24JxuHpxVrtEIHV57TLg.text: I really hate to give this place 3 stars considering the fellow yelpers have given this place high ratings. I feel bad giving such a low score for such an amazing staff. First, the staff is great and everyone is smiling and happy. The lady that works there explains anything you have questions to. Super friendly. I can't emphasize how friendly everyone is!! OK, now for the food. My bf got the lamb souvlaki and I got the gyro with Athenian fries. Let's start with the lamb souvlaki. The lamb was good, but not great. It didn't have as much flavor or that pow factor in my mouth. It lacked seasoning, considering I just ate at another Greek competitors. However, the tzatziki sauce was awesome, which I think saved the protein portion of the meal. Without it, it would had been disappointing. The gyro, was good, once again, not great. My bf says the meat is better than the other Greek places, but ehh, I gotta disagree. So, to each there own right? I was excited to try the Athenian  fries. When they came out, the cheese was cold and a bit stale. I expect something along of cheesy fries where the cheese was warm and gooey and melts. I don't think I'll be getting that at all. I should have stuck to regular fries. Maybe that's how they are suppose to be, and I didn't know. We went daring and decided to get the yogurt drink too. Lol, uhhh, she warned us that it was sour and salty. I would like to describe this yogurt drink as followed: sour as if the milk is bad, then add salt to it, and top it off with some unsweetened yogurt. Blend all ingredients. Was it good? Not at all, but I kept drinking it in hopes that it would taste better. It kind of did after awhile, then my brain told me NEIN!! And then, went back to tasting like sour old diapers. The taste for me, was way too exotic for my taste buds. So, overall? Food isn't as great, but honestly, it would have tasted great for the state fair standards.

qCvbRXVL21dRPm56XAlzHg.text: Food was delicious and fresh! The falafel was seasoned so well and cut in strips...side by side with a gyro, you wouldn't be able to tell the difference between them. I also ordered a side of Athenian fries, beats your average disco fries any day!

O5A_FRsJoSlz97m3ByNTtg.text: I love The Fat Greek. A lot of places in Las Vegas will deliver a gyro to your door, but in my experience they're disappointing and often filled with identical ovals of funky lamb-spam.  Not here though. The lamb is legit, the beef is tender, and the tomatoes are fresh and sweet. Flavor-wise this place is awesome, the price is decent, and the service is good.  They will on occasion forget an item in your order. It happens to everyone, right? They won't give you trouble about it or make you jump through hoops. Just let them know and they'll fix it pretty damn quick. Half an hour after calling in a mistake, they had sent me a new order, plus a free dessert (with a little smiley face inside the carton which kinda made my day)  The third-party delivery company they use is fast, friendly, and helpful when something isn't right.  I recommend a gyro (lamb & beef), with souvlaki and Athenian fries on the side. Dolmades and spanikopita too if you're hungry. It's all delicious.

ccBoI7SYD8jkKSgZ5d4LRQ.text: The food was great! I ordered the Fat Greek Gyro, delicious. The appetizer, Tiropita, was amazing. Whatever is on top of it is addicting. Even the ice tea was wonderful. Overall tasty and not too expensive. We got out of there, 3 people, for just under 50 bucks. With some beer, so pretty decent.  The service was kind of slow. Would try again, if it gets better I will post another review.   I have been to better spots in the past, but this a pretty good gyro for sure. A repeat if I am in the mood for Greek.

ZHp3hAc39tlQsG4DPOM0yQ.text: This place has good food and bad customer service from my experience. I've returned a few times because I like their chicken kebab plate, but the time before last me and my date were kind of neglected- had to ask for silverware, napkins, asked twice for the same things and then we were kind of rushed out because it was near their closing, they took out glasses and plates and gave us paper and plastic so they could wash the dishes early... The next time I went there a guy behind the counter told me I couldn't eat there with my service dog (which had never been a problem before), then when I called later to complain to a manager because one wasn't available at the time, the manager/owner accused me of lying about the situation and said there was no reason for my call and hung up on me. I'm shocked by how bad their customer service is, I liked their food but won't go there ever again because of how poorly the staff and owner treated me.

p4HhFEctGxIoWZfIUIiuwQ.text: Love this place !! It is my favorite! Delicious Greek wraps!! My boyfriend ordered the skewers and they were on point..as well as the chicken & lemon soup! The Athenian fries are a must! Highly recommend it!

NhEZG-8KlHLVG5IsUMj1ew.text: I came in during lunch and ordered from the Gryos/Sandwich section:  __Chicken Shawerma, $7.50:  the grilled chicken was tender and juicy. I just wished that there was more hummas and  Tahini Sauce to taste. Overall, it was good/pleasant.  __ Fat Greek Gyros (w/ beef/lamb), $7.79:  I honestly felt that the meat was too seasoned, that it became slightly salty for my palette. The crumbled feta cheese on top sure did not help-- together with the meat, it brought out an overly salty taste to the gryos.   *Note: Add $1.99 for Choice of Rice, Fries, or Greek Salad and 24 oz. Fountain Drink  Although I gave this place only 3 stars, I will be back again. I definitely want to try out the other items on the menu, especially since this place is listed at the top (of the search engine) for Greek cuisine on Yelp.

DjdB8W6MCkbuiTHTezdEuw.text: We LOVE the food here!  We were here a couple years ago and found them on Yelp.  We gave it a try.  When looking for a place to go when in town tonight we searched them out.  The food and service was as good as we remembered.  There was a group of four behind us of cranky people looking to complain to obtain a discount but they are full of baloney.  One word--- yum!  We definitely made a note of this place for our next visit.  We had chicken kabob and gyro plate with Greek wine which they let us sample before we committed to purchase.  They were really busy so we had to drink water from odd glasses (too busy to keep up with dishwashing) -  small problem- tells me they have good food for a local place

jNzUOljczGOpy0tSQOaCGA.text: Don't know if the food is any good yet. Im too mad to eat yet for having to wait 30 minutes for my to go order while I watched 3 tables sit down, order and get their food before my to go order was ready. Then another to go patron was told 5 min, came back in 5 and stood another 10 to 15 min waiting. I Asked the waitress if they made the food for the dining in customers before the to go and she didnt have an answer. The pasticcio was very good. The gyro meat is standard. the grilled chicken was tender and flavorful. So the food was good but service was horrible. I guess if you eat in you will get your food faster.

3q1goznprsHL2U81pHKJVw.text: Maybe lunch time is the best time to go to the Fat Greek because we loved it.  There was one young girl working the floor but we were never left without drinks or condiments.  I had the falafel sandwich and my bf had a traditional gyro. We both could not get over how good our food was that day. I spent some time in Greece and he is a NY'er.   Like I said, maybe lunch is the time to go or maybe we just got lucky. Either way, our food was worth the trip.

Grij07sKJ2ha1c2wsomRDg.text: LOVE this place,  But! Avoid the calamari it made me sick. (It's not real calamari anyway, shocking).  Try the avgolemon soup instead

MnqTvQ1Io8gnSbO1G4719A.text: Wonderful  Mediterranean food! Fresh salad, beef and lamb are tasty and delicious.Great service! A restaurant to come back for more and the price is right!

A_Pe_NcYqVX6wEJuPoKO5Q.text: Picked up 2 Gyros and they were outstanding! Some of the best I have ever had. Large anf full of all the ingredients that were soooo good. The hummus was great too.

_jg7xMFzp27bgeQZkAdGBw.text: I love Greek food and have been to a couple of places in vegas. I read a few good reviews of this place so we decided to check it out. What a surprise!! The food was perfect. Nothing fancy or pompous, just good food done perfectly. The spanakopita appetizer was great but the octopus hooked me immediately. Couldn't have been better. We shared the family style grilled platter and everything on it was great. The meats were perfect, and the potatoes...unbelievably good. And service was great. Just perfect. I can't wait to go back again and again.

r_5UYc0ibHA_ew47y8nzFg.text: Great little restaurant that took me right back home. We had their gyros, bear and delicious desert. Server was very friendly and helpful. Food tasted just as it would if you were eating it in Greece. They had greek beer as well as Croatian beer which made me extremely happy. All of the deserts are made in the restaurant and looked amazing, we had Bogacha with vanilla custard and it was to die for. I definitely recommend this little cute place to everybody who loves good food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bugacha - vanilla custard

srQ1rMYTDLdSnX4fM4HRvw.text: I was craving Greek food and stumbled upon this gem! The food was amazing, the portion sizes were generous and more than enough. The service was great, prompt and friendly. We never had to ask for more pita or for our drinks to be refilled. Very clean establishment. I will definitely be returning here!

JHWod-oqNkWGjAgOoBHDxQ.text: Delicious Moussaka and village greek salad luv this place hands down the best greek restro in lv better then mad greek!!!! Will definitely be back needed a change from asian food better then chinese food on a regular basis!!!! The owner is sweet and awesome the service is slow but the food is delicious so it is definitely worth the wait hidden gem in lv good for Mediterranean and greek food cravings the food here is cooked with love authethic for a first timer!

krxllHQ41montdX3K8u-7Q.text: I struggle to see what all these reviewers saw in this place. I've had my share of wonderful Greek food, my husband is Greek and happens to be very good at cooking his mom's Greek dishes. This place was a huge disappointment in every way.  1. Service - Awful. One Russian waiter who did EVERYTHING while an old guy stood around and watched him. I saw another table ask where there food was and he said "I'm the only one here today and all these people came in at the same time", no apology, nothing. We sat for 15 minutes before our spanikopita came out. Another 20 minutes until our lunch came. At first we thought - this is what we get for going to a Greek restaurant on Greek Easter BUT this place is run by Russians! So that's not even an excuse. We did notice three other tables with Russian patrons were served much more quickly than us.  2. Food - all lukewarm. Spanikopita was like none other I've had, and not in a good way. Hardly any filling and there was crunchy stuff on the top. It was ok, but it certainly wasn't spanikopita. I had the chicken soulvaki and my husband had the lamb. Both meats were lukewarm, probably bc our waiter was spending too much time socializing with one of the Russian tables and the old guy just stood and watched as our dish got cold. The chicken was completely average, my husbands lamb was ok. The dish came with rice, which was very "wet". We each had a side salad. The salad was probably the best part of our meal. It was yummy.  3. Atmosphere - it's in a strip mall with a Food 4 Less so let's just say you should not expect it to have a great atmosphere and it certainly lived up to that expectation.  All in all, as a Vegas local we will not be back and will not recommend this place to anyone. It was a very disappointing, strange experience. It was this place or Thai, we should've gone with Thai...

fo1p0mL17X799Vck63ODhw.text: You have to try the athenia fries!! So good! The service was very friendly and nice - I had a gyro and husband had beef swarma- both were juicy meats and fresh sauce. Clean restaurant and nice servers. Would recommend to anyone who likes Greek food. Will defiantly be back- thanks for a great lunch!

Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef swarma - meat was very tasty!
Photo of The Fat Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Athenia fries!! You have to try these!! So good!!

CyQWlBLf7tEy9tkLuNxttw.text: My new favorite spot... been looking for a while... and will definitely be a regular here.... service a little off but food totally makes up for it...

IRYExMoG9ERh9ChH6zsBLw.text: This place is the best...you can count on your meal being great everytime here and their customer service is amazing. Ill definately be back!

d8-biXqIkmlgKR31SVMRxA.text: Great lunch specials, fresh food, and awesome staff! Nice artwork and a couple tv's with different sports on, but not loud. I've tried a few items, but I always go back to the chicken gyro. Creature of habit ha! Get there! You won't be disappointed!

NVnc3DKwA6PKGeHxnWdRHw.text: Discovered this place a few years ago. Fell for the gyros instantly, over time, I've learned that the whole menu is great. I've been dozens of times and never been disappointed. Taken friends and family, it's always a hit.  Saganaki  & gyros are great for lunch, at dinner the combo plate is a great way to sample a variety, the lamb dishes are excellent, too. I'm also a fan of the lentil soup and pastries are treat if you are able to save room.

y07UA49KO2gqEVWozbQhWg.text: I got the fat greek gyro. It was pretty good. The flavor of the meat was excellent and was cooked very well.

1CTkIDHSTlsZbWeDFdg_BQ.text: Disappointed with everything I got, very average Greek salad, very average gyros, and the spinach pie wasn't very good.  I'm hoping it was bad because it was on Easter and maybe it was old or something.  The guy was kinda pissy at the counter too.  There is a place on Maryland across from the university that is way better.

1eLNITTOeUglr3AnvbO7qQ.text: I have had dinner here a handful of times and the food is been very good. Service from the same waitress/hostess (She does both) has been good, but not today. As my brother was ordering food, I could see that the waitress was getting agitated by my brother's questions.  Once he was done ordering, my wife and I ordered a Greek salad and a Gyro. When the order came out, the Greek salad came out as the fat Greek salad, not the village Greek salad. When I waived the waitress over, she Was agitated that a mistake it been made. She said I ordered a Greek salad, but there are two Greek salads, a fat Greek salad and a village Greek salad.  While she'd knowledged that was True, she nastily said I should have specified. That's True, I guess I should've specified, but shouldn't she have also clarified, she is the waitress with more knowledge about the menu than I. I guess she was just having a bad day. This place usually deserves four stars, but not today. I'll check it out again in a month and see how it goes.

LkHVKXRgXuxpto9KAEkXEg.text: I admit that I am not very knowledgeable about Greek food, but The Fat Greek is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.   I mainly go there around lunch time (they have gyro specials that come with a drink and a side).  But since it is not close to my work, it can be come a time crunch if there are more than two people in the party.  My go-to is the Beef Shawerma.  It's Amazing.  The Fat Greek Gyro is also quite good, and the baklava for dessert is a MUST!  As I said above, sometimes the service can be a little slow, but the wait staff has always been very friendly.

PbAU8yyT3aBhivNs1BEQog.text: Excellent service and excellent food. Ordered moussaka and gyros, and some avgolomeno soup. The soup was homemade and full of flavor. The gyros plate was loaded and the moussaka was very satisfying.  This place is definitely a gem in Vegas, and I wish there was a similar place closer to home. Most Greek places are very cookie-cutter or very upscale. This is a nice family-friendly place with real food. Definitely will come back for dine-in or take-out in the future when in Vegas.

rPvBFpqTY9uQSBLLSGcymw.text: This place wasn't bad. My biggest complaint is the lack of a single greek person working there which leads me to believe it's fake. Food was decent, waitress one was ok other not ok.
